loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 42 years old and she currently works as an administrator in a business in the city of Managua. She lives in the neighbourhood Laureles Sur and she is married with 2 kids who are 13 and 16. They are studying in secondary school thanks to their parents' hard work, and her husband helps out with the family's expenses.

With the loan that she is asking for she will replace the roof of their house which is currently in a really bad state, and because of the heavy rains they have a lot of leaks. She hopes to do up her house little by little to give her family the best living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Margarita tiene 42 años de edad y actualmente se desempeña como administradora de una empresa de laciudad de Managua, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casada, y tiene dos hijos de 13 y 16 años de edad, quines al gran esfuerzo que hacen sus padres están estudiando la educación secundaria, su esposo la apoya con los gastos familiares. Con el préstamo que está solicitando cambiará el techo de su casa que actualmente se encuentra en muy mal estado, y debido a las lluvias están sufriendo filtraciones de agua. Espera poco a poco poder componer su casa de habitación para darles las mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

loans.use: To change the roof of their house/Cambiar el techo de su casa

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan is 50 years old. He lives in the Laureles neighborhood and is married. Juan and his wife have two children, ages 13 and 17. His wife works and helps cover household expenses. Juan works for a private security company as a security guard.

The loan Juan is requesting is for finishing construction of a wall around his house. The wall will provide better security for his family, as their neighborhood isn’t very safe. Juan hopes to complete construction of his house so that his children one day will benefit from the property.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El Sr. Juan tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y le tienen dos hijos de 13 y 17 años de edad, su esposa trabaja y apoya a su marido en los gastos del hogar. Don Juan trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como Guarda de Seguridad.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para terminar de construir un muro en su vivienda, para así poderle darle mayor seguridad a su familia, ya que el barrio donde habitan es poco seguro. Espera poder terminar de construirle la vivienda sus hijos para que en un futuro puedan disponer de algún patrimonio.

loans.use: Complete construction of a wall around his house

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
Paula is 43 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur. She is married and has 4 children ages 5, 7, 10, and 14. Paula works as a janitor, she has 4 years experience in this work. The money she is requesting will be used to do home improvements and to construct a wall on the Eastern part of her home to improve the security of her family. It has been hard for her to improve the standard of living for her family because her income has not been sufficient to cover expenses, but she hopes to count on the loans from AFODENIC to finish building her home>

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Doña Paula tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 5, 7,10 y 14 años de edad. La Sra. Paula trabaja como conserje, tiene mas de cuatro años de estar laborandoen este oficio, con el dinero que esta solicitando es para mejoras a su vivienda en la construcción de un muro en la parte Este de la vivienda para mejor seguridad de su familia. Le ha costado poder salir adelante con su familia debido a que los ingresos que tienen no son suficientes, pero espera poder contar siempre con los créditos que le otorga AFODENIC para poder terminar de construir su vivienda.

loans.use: To build a side wall for her home

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
Maria lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur. She is 58 years old, single and her children are already married. Maria has seven years of experience running a general store which has given her a lot of management experience. She started the business with her own savings and used the proceeds from her sales to grow and offer a wide variety of products. Her home does not have a front wall which would give her added security for her business, the money from this loan would be used for the wall's construction.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Doña Maria habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera y sus hijos ya están casados. Doña Maria tiene una pulpería desde hace siete años en los caules ha adquirido mucha experiencia de administración y en los cuales ha podido diversificar grandemente sus productos con las ganacias obtenidas,el negocio lo logró montar con dinero que ella tenía ahorrado. Su casa no cuenta con un muro frontal que pueda brindarle toda la seguridad necesaria a su negocio, y el dinero producto del préstamo lo coupará para dicha construcción.

loans.use: To build a wall in front of her home.

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
Pablo is 50 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. He is married and has two children ages 15 and 20. His wife is a homemaker. Pablo works as a supplier of local produce to general stores in his neighborhood. He has four years of experience in this business which he started with his own resources. He plans to use the money from the loan to invest in inventory, to purchase additional produce to offer a wider variety of products for the stores he serves. He plans to continue to work hard to ensure his children have everything they need.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

El Sr. Pablo tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es casado y tienen dos hijos de 15 y 20 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Pablo trabaja como proveedor de verduras a las pulperías aldeñas a su barrio, tiene cuatro años de experiencia y empezó el negocio con recursos propios. Con el dinero que le presten lo invertirá en inventario, en la compra de verduras para ampliar la oferta a las pulperías que atiende. Sus planes futuros son seguir trabajando arduamente para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.

loans.use: To purchase produce and invest in his business.

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es:
Maria is 57 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur. She is married and her husband works hard to support the family. Her children are already independent. Maria has eight years of experience running a general store that was started with financing which proved to be very helpful for her family. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the store to increase sales and offer a wider variety of products to her customers. She plans to maintain the store to increase her standard of living.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La Sra. Maria tiene 57 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposo trabaja y aporta a los gastos de la familia. Sus hijos son ya independientes. Doña Maria tiene una pulpería y tiene ocho años de experiencia, e inició con financiamientos que fueron de gran utilidad para su familia. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para inventario de la pulpería para incrementar las ventas y ofrecer más productos a sus clientes. A futuro es seguir manteniendo la pulpería, y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: To purchase basic goods and cleaning products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, who has been a seemstress for 30 years, lives with her only daughter and her granddaughter. Thanks to her work she has been able to build a house and educate her daughter, and she contributes to her granddaughter's education too. She would like to be able to leave her house in a good condition for her daughter and granddaughter so that they can live independently and in a calm and peaceful environment.

Among the things she wants to change in the house she wants to get a roof covering, build a sink, move the steps and build the foundations for a new room. She knows that her income will not let her do all that she wants to do now, so most important for her is to cover the roof of the house as she has her sewing machine and tools in the house and that is where she attends to her clients. She also needs a big sink so that she can keep more water as there is not much where she lives. These are the reason why she needs a loan; so that she can meet these needs. It is important to add that Elizabeth has had a few loans with Integral which she has all paid back on time, so she has a good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Elizabeth, se dedica al trabajo de la costura desde hace 30 años, vive con ella su única hija y su nieta, cuenta que a través de este oficio logró construir su casa y educar a su hija y ahora esta contribuyendo grandemente a la formación de su nieta, su objetivo actual es dejarle tanto a la hija como a la nieta la casa lo mejor arreglada posible de tal forma que cuando ella falte puedan convivir en espacios independientes y en un ambiente de armonía y tranquilidad. Entre las cosas que quiere mejorar de la casa están; colocar una cubierta de techo, construir una pila tipo cisterna, trasladar el escalerón metálico y construir un plafón para posteriormente edificar un cuarto. Ella sabe que no puede hacer todas estas cosas en un mismo tiempo debido a los ingresos que percibe. De primera mano su prioridad es colocar una cubierta de techo en la parte principal de la vivienda ya que ahí tiene la máquina de coser, otras herramientas e insumos y es donde atiende a sus clientes, a la vez necesita construir la pila tipo cisterna para que pueda almacenar mayor cantidad de agua, ya que en el lugar donde vive hay escasea este recurso natural. Estas son las razones por las que se ha motivado a solicitar un préstamo que le permita iniciar a solventar todas estas necesidades. Es importante mencionar que doña Elizabeth a tenido varios créditos con Integral, los cuales ha logrado cancelar con puntualidad, esto le da una buena solvencia créditicia.

loans.use: To install a roof covering and build a large sink/Para instalar cubierta de techo y construir una pila tipo cisterna.

location.town: Cumbres de Santa Tecla, La Libertad

loans.name: Gasparina's Group

texts.es:
There are 15 hardworking women from the town of Caacupé in the group Yaka Roysa. The majority run commercial enterprises from their own homes where they sell groceries or clothing or chupas (a chewy bread snack). They are all neighbours and are now in the third cycle of the women’s program. Each person receives an average of G.600.000 of credit.

The formation of the group was largely due to the efforts of Sra. Gasparina P. who invited her neighbours to participate. They soon became interested in the women’s program and so began the first meetings. The group’s objective currently is the activities associated with the San Juan festival where they plan to sell local dishes and use the money they earn to add to their own savings.

One of the characteristics of the members of this group is the high level of observance of the rules that govern the program. This is demonstrated by the regular repayment of the loan and by punctual attendance at the weekly meetings. They are also very strict about members who miss meetings without good reason, and the guilty are given warnings.

Gasparina notes that the success of an undertaking is due in large part to good organisation and discipline. For these reasons she is very grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya which, as well as helping the group raise capital, also provides an advisor to assist with training and the administrative tools necessary to run a group business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Yaka Roysa de la ciudad de Caacupé, gran parte de las señoras se dedican a actividades comerciales que lo explotan en su mismo domicilio, como despensas, chiperas, vendedoras de ropas, entre otras, todas son vecinas, actualmente y están en el 3 ciclo del programa comité de mujeres y reciben un promedio de G. 600.000 por persona en crédito.

La conformación del grupo se debió a la gran colaboración que brindo la señora Gasparina P., quien fue la que comenzó inicialmente con las invitaciones a sus vecinas quienes rápidamente mostraron interés por el programa de comité de mujeres. Fue así como se realizaron las primeras reuniones, actualmente el comité tiene como objetivo en este mes de las festividades de San Juan, realizar ferias de comidas típicas con el objetivo de recaudar fondos a para capitalizar sus ahorros interno.

Una de las características de los integrantes de este comité es el alto grado de cumplimientos de las normas que rige este programa y esta demostrado por la buena conducta de pago, y la asistencia puntual a las reuniones semanales, como también son muy exigentes con lo relacionado con las ausencias a las reuniones la misma deben ser justificadas caso contario reciben amonestaciones.

Gasparina, afirma que el éxito de un emprendimiento se debe gran parte al orden y la disciplina y en ese aspecto están muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya porque a parte de facilitarle el capital de trabajo también reciben capacitación a través de su asesor quien les brinda las herramientas necesarias para administrar grupos de personas.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand and new clothes. Several women will also buy silver jewelry and other items such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil, herbs, sugar, biscuits, noodles, drinks etc.

loans.name: Dominga Del Rosario

texts.es:
Dominga Rodriquez works very hard as a seamstress, a business she runs from her home in the municipality of Sandino in the city of Managua. She began with very few materials, and over time has been able to grow her business. Today Dominga needs to invest in her business, so she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to buy materials she needs such as fabric, thread, needles, buttons, etc.

The loan will not only help her business, but it also helps her take care of her daughter and granddaughter who depend on her.

La señora Dominga R. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de costurería atendido en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua.

Ella inició su negocio con pocos materiales de trabajo y a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo a mejorado su negocio en su sector.

Hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de mejorar su negocio y para ello busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar los materiales de trabajo como lo son hilos, telas, botones, etc. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su familia compuesta por su pequeña hija y nieta a la que mantiene.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS SUCH AS  FABRIC, NEEDLES, THREAD, BUTTONS, ETC, TO GROW HER SEAMSTRESS BUSINESS.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
In the municipality of Sandino, in the city of Managua, Maria Solis works hard at her business making bracelets and other items from leather, which she sells from her home as well as out in the streets. She has put a lot of effort into this work for the last 20 years, as this has been the only way to support herself. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials she needs to continue making her leather goods.

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, la señora Maria S. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de elaboración de fajas y pulseras las cuales las comercializa en su casa de habitación y cuando es necesario desplazarse en las calles de su municipio lo hace con tal de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Se dedica muy esforzadamente a este negocio desde hace 20 años siendo este su único ingreso para mantener su hogar. Hoy en día acude a CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito para la compra de sus materiales de trabajo como lo es la cuerina, tijeras, pega, etc.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE NECESSARY MATERIALS TO MAKE HER LEATHER GOODS

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana B. sells fruits and vegetables from her home in the municipality of Sandino. She has had this business for 20 years, and thanks to her hard work she has been able to improve her economic situation and quality of life. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell and continue to grow her business.

La dama Juana Bermúdez se dedica a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde atiende a sus clientes para ofrecerles sus productos.

Desde hace 20 años se dedica a esta labor y por medio de esta ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y ha permitido que su hogar salga adelante.

La necesidad que actualmente atraviesa es que necesita la compra de las verduras y frutas para comercializarlas y por ello busca el apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito para realizar su compra y así salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE FRUITS AND VEGETABLES TO SELL

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina N. is orginally from the municipality of Sandino in the city of Managua. She works collecting plastic items which she later sells to shops for recycling. She has been doing this for three years because she needed extra income to help take care of her three young children. Her husband does not earn enough money to cover their expenses.

With her simple, wooden cart pulled by a horse, she works around the streets of her city collecting the plastic articles. Because of the difficult economic situation today, she has requested a loan from Ceprodel to buy the materials she needs to improve her business and help make it easier for her to collect the plastics.

La señora Luz Marina Narváez es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en la ciudad de Managua y se dedica a su negocio de recolección de artículos plásticos para luego venderlos en las casas de compra para su respectivo reciclaje. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace tres años por la sencilla razón de que tiene que mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos y además su esposo no posee el recurso económico necesario para hacerlo.

Se dirige por las calles de su municipio en una carreta guiada por un caballo y donde va pasando al encontrarse algún artículo plástico lo recoge y almacena para luego venderlo en las casas de compra. Hoy en día por la difícil situación económica que atraviesa ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de materiales para mejorar su negocio y el medio donde se moviliza en busca de los artículos plásticos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO FIX THE HORSE DRAWN CART  SHE USES TO COLLECT PLASTIC ITEMS.  THE INCOME FROM RESELLING THESE PLASTIC ARTICLES HELPS SUPPORT HER THREE YOUNG CHILDREN.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Don Juan is 40 years old and lives in the barrio of Memorial Sandino. He is married and has two children ages 19 and 21. His wife is a homemaker. Don Juan sells a variety of products such as electronics, cosmetics and two years ago he began selling women's clothing. Through the years he has been able to grow and add variety to his inventory. He operates his business as a traveling store. The loan he requests will be invested to purchase clothing to offer his customers greater variety and to grow his customer base. He hopes to continue to expand his product line to meet the styles and preferences of his clients.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Don Juan tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 19 y 21 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Juan vende variedad de productos como: electrodoméstico, cosméticos, y hace doce años empezó con el negocio de venta de ropa de dama, pero a través de los años ha podido incrementar y variar su inventario. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante. El préstamo que está solicitando es para inventarlo en la compra de ropa para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes mucha variedad y así captar más clientes. Espera poder seguir diversificando su producto para sastifacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing for sale to his customers

loans.name: Ricarda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ricarda Torrez has a small general store in the municipality of Sandino in Managua, Nicaragua. She began the business more than 30 years ago, and has been able to improve the quality of life and financial situation for her family.

To continue to grow her business, she now needs to invest in more products to sell to her customers. She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to make the necessary purchases and continue to move her business forward.

La señora Ricarda Torrez se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual lo atiende en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua Nicaragua.

El negocio lo comenzó desde hace mas de 30 años y por medio de este ha mejorado su condición económica y ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, actualmente su negocio necesita la pronta inversión en la compra de sus productos para comercializarlos. Es por esta sencilla razón que solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para realizar dicha compra y así salir adelante en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena is 25 years old. She lives in the neighborhood Hills of the Memorial Sandino in Managua. She is married and has a 5-year-old girl. Her husband works as a welder and together they fight to maintain their family.

Maria Magdalena sells cosmetics and clothing on foot. She has two years of experience. She started only selling clothes with her own funds. With the money that she is requesting she plans to increase inventory and to offer her possible products to a greater variety of clients. Her future plans are to enter in the sale of another line of products, as well as also to be able to build a house with her husband for their family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Magdalena tiene 25 años de edad, habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino en Managua, es casada y tiene una niña de 5 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja desempeñándose como soldador y juntos luchan por mantener a su familia.

Maria Magdalena vende de forma ambulante cosméticos y ropa tiene dos años de experiencia, ella inició sólo vendiendo ropa con fondos propios. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para incrementar inventario y ofertar a sus clientes la mayor varieda de productos posibles. Sus planes futuros son incursionar en la venta de otra líena de productos, así como también poder construir una casa junto a su esposo para su familia.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Lider

texts.es:
Señora  Lider S. T. is an associate of the Credit Group known as "Alisson".  She lives in the department and province of San Martin, District of Tarapoto. Her residence is situated on  jr Shapaja No. 640.  She is dedicated to the sale of all kinds of iron and other materials for construction, in a rented location on jr Shapaja block 4.  
 

Señora Lider started with the sale of supplies, but, seeing that she was not very profitable, her husband motivated her to change her business.  She took advantage of his economic activity; that is, the production of windows and doors of iron.  He did not have a better idea than selling the materials to use in the production of the same.  Therefore he could worry just about filling the orders of his customers, without a need to worry about the transfer of the materials.  The business has been growing considerably, thanks to the good deals he offers his clients and to the good service that he offers.  

With the loan of  1,300 soles, that will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy more iron and diverse accessories for the production of windows and doors.  

 
Señora Lider is 36 years old.  She lives with their husband and their daughter, who motivate her to work harder each day and to manage to meet their designated goals.  One of their goals is to secure their own location to have a fixed and sure place where she can be found at any moment.  

 Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.
La señora Lider S. T. es socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Alisson” vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto  su domicilio esta situado en el jr Shapaja No 640,  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de fierros y otros materiales para la construcción, en un local alquilado en el jr shapaja  cuadra 4.
 

La señora Lider se inició con la venta de repuestos, pero viendo que no era muy rentable, el esposo la motivó a cambiar de negocio, ella aprovechó la actividad económica de él, que es la fabricación de ventanas y puertas de fierro,  no tuvo mejor idea que vender los materiales a usar en la fabricación de los mismos, pues así los clientes  solo harían sus pedidos, sin necesidad de preocuparse en el traslado de los materiales, el negocio se ha incrementado considerablemente  gracias  al buen trato al cliente y del buen servicio que brinda. 

Con el  préstamo  de S/. 1 300.00 que devolverá en un plazo de en 6 meses, comprará más fierros y accesorios diversos para la fabricación  de ventanas y puertas.

 
La señora Lider , tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y su hija, quienes le impulsan a  esforzarse cada día más y lograr cumplir con sus metas trazadas, una de sus metas es contar con su propio local para tener un lugar seguro y fijo donde la puedan encontrar en cualquier momento.

loans.use: To buy iron and accessories for making windows and doors.

loans.name: Fanny María

texts.es:
Señora Fanny María A. is a very hard-working lady that is dedicated to her personal jewelry sale business in her municipality of Sandino City in Managua. She has been dedicated to this work for 12 years, offering bracelets, rings, earrings, etc.

It is necessary to emphasize that she is a mother of two children under her responsibility and in addition she cares for two grandchildren, that being a total of four people that she must maintain. For that reason she seeks the support of Ceprodel for the purchase of her jewelry to market in her work sector.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Fanny María A. es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica a su negocio de venta de prendas personales en su municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 12 años ofreciendo pulceras, anillos, aretes, etc.

Es necesario destacar que ella es madre de dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y además atiende a dos nietos siendo un total de cuatro personas que mantener. Por este motivo es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de sus prendas para comercializarlos en su sector de trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for resale

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Señor Noel lives in the neighborhood 3-80. He is married and is 42 years old. He has two children of 6 and 11 years of age. His wife has a small store in the home. Señor Noel is a cabdriver with seven years working in this business. The family started with a store that they still they have, but they decided to generate more income for the family. That is why Señor Noel entered in the business of taxis.

With the loan that he is requesting he hopes to be able to fix his means of work that currently has mechanical problems. Also he expects to be able to invest a little in the store. He hopes to be able to change his taxi quickly to be able to improve the service that he offers.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Noel habita en el barrio 3-80, es casado y tiene 42 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 11 años de edad, su esposa tiene una pequeña pulpería en el hogar. Don Noel es taxista lleva siete años trabajando en este negocio, la familia inició con una pulpería que aún conservan, pero decidieron generar más ingresos para la familia, es por eso que Don Noel ingresó en la profesión de Taxis.

Con el préstamo que está solicitando epera poder arreglar su medio de trabajo que presenta fallas mecánicas y también espera poder invertir un poco en la pulpería. Espera poder cambiar su unidad de taxi pronto para poder mejorar el servicio que ofrece.

loans.use: To pay for mechanical repairs and improvements to his taxi.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mayela Verónica

texts.es:
Doña Mayela lives in the neighborhood of San Ignacio de Managua. She is 47 years old. She is married and has one child 13 years of age, who is a student. The business of Doña Mayela is the sales of clothing and cosmetics. She has 6 years of experience and has had difficulty growing the business because she lacks financing.

Doña Mayela would like to begin a new chapter with the creation of a new small business, which is the sales of hot dogs. It is for this that she has requested the loan, to buy materials for preparing hot dogs and selling refreshments. She works diligently to be able to give an education to her son of 13 years and to be able to leave him a patriomony that will help him in the future.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mayela habita en el barrio San Ignacio de Managua, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, y tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad, que está estudiando. El negocio de doña Mayela es la venta de ropa y cosmético, lleva seis años de experiencia y ha tenido dificultad de crecimiento debido a la falta de financiamiento.

Doña Mayela quiere abrirse paso con la creación de un nuevo pequeño negocio,como es la venta de hot dog, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para elaboración de hot dog y venta de refrescos. trabaja arduamente para poder darle educación a su hijo de 13 años y poder dejarle un patrimonio que lo ayude en un futuro.

loans.use: To invest in opening a new, small business selling hot dogs.

loans.name: Luz Rosenda

texts.es:
Señora Luz Rosenda Z. Bendezu, belongs to the “Women Bound to Develop” Communal Bank. She lives in the Region and Province of San Martin, district of Morales. Her residence and business are located on Jr.Peru. She is dedicated to the sale of natural products of the OMNILIFE line, and she supplements the business with the sale of handicrafts, beauty products (ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE) and lingerie (LEONISA).

With the credit of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy natural products such as optimus and teatino in boxes and other products of the line that she is offering. She will also buy material to give services such as injections and serum, that are the ones that have greater demand among the patients that she attends.

Señora Luz Rosenda is 48 years old. She is a technical nurse by profession. She offers health care and natural products for sale to the community in general. She is a woman that most of her life has worked with patients where she learned to serve people with many health needs. She feels happy to be able to serve others with her business that does not have a definite schedule and that always is in the service of others.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz Rosenda Z. Bendezu, pertenece al Banco Comunal” Mujeres Rumbo Al Desarrollo” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de morales, su domicilio y negocio están ubicados en el Jr.Perú, se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la línea OMNILIFE, y complementa el negocio con las venta de manualidades, productos de belleza ( ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE) y lencería (LEONISA)

Con el crédito de S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará productos naturales como optimus , teatino, en cajas y demás de la línea que oferta, también comprará material para dar servicio de inyectables y sueros, que son los que tienen mayor requerimiento entre los pacientes que atiende.

La señora Luz Rosenda, tiene 48 años, es enfermera técnica de profesión, ofrece asistencia sanitaria y venta de productos naturales a la comunidad en general, es una mujer que la mayor parte de su vida ha trabajado con pacientes donde aprendió a servir a personas con muchas necesidades de salud y se siente feliz de poder servir a los demás con su negocio que no tiene horario definido y que siempre está al servicio de los demás.

loans.use: To buy natural products for resale and products to provide services such as injections and serums.

loans.name: Mariela Vanesa

texts.es:
Mariela lives in the neighborhood called Hills of the Memorial Sandino. She is 27 years old. She is married and has two children; one of 8 years and one of 8 months. Her husband works as an administrative technician.

Mariela sells clothes, cosmetics, jewelry and various other items. She began selling clothes and has grown with the passage of time. She already has seven years of experience in this market, and, with the previously requested loans, she has diversified her sales.

The money that she is requesting is for the purchase of inventory: clothes, cosmetics and jewelry. Her plans are to open a store, since at present she has merchandise in her house, but also works by selling on foot.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariela habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos uno de 8 años y uno de 8 meses, su esposo trabaja desempeñándose como técnico administrativo.

Mariela vende ropa, cosméticos, prenda y otras variedades, ella inició vendiendo ropa y ha ido creciendo con el pasar de los tiempos, son siete años ya de experiencia en este mercado, y con los préstamos anteriormente solicitados ha ido diversificando sus ventas.

El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de inventario: ropa , cosméticos y prendas. Sus planes son llegar a poner una tienda, ya que actualmente tiene mercadería en su casa, pero también trabja de forma ambulante.

loans.use: To buy clothes, cosmetics and jewelry for resale.

loans.name: María Virginia

texts.es:
Señora Maria Virginia Q. C. is an associate of the "Violets II" Communal Bank. She lives in the department of San Martin, province of Rioja district of Nueva Cajamarca. She is dedicated to the sale of prepared poultry meat. She waits on her clients in her stall located in the market of the district.

She decided to start her business after her husband abandoned the home. She became father and mother for her 5 children. She was started with the sale of vegetables, but she saw that she was not very profitable. She managed to obtain a position in the central market of Nueva Cajamarca where she sells all kinds of prepared poultry such as: pen-raised chicken, duck, sometimes turkey and meat of guinea pigs. She supplements her business with the sale of prepared seasonings such as cilantro, garlic, chili powder, etc. She likes the business because it permits her to generate her own income, which improves her self-esteem, to grow as a person and a woman.

With the loan of 1200 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy live chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs to butcher and sell to her clients. She also buys vegetables daily to sell pre-prepared.

The lady Maria Virginia is 33 years old and has 6 children. She lives with her last son. Her goal is to come to have a grocery business, and to be able to give work to more people. She believes that with that type of activity she could rest a little, because she has to get up very early to have the meat ready to carry to the market for sale.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Virginia Q. C. es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Rioja distrito de Nueva Cajamarca, ella se dedica a la venta carne de aves eviscerados, ella espera a sus clientes en su puesto ubicado en el mercado del distrito.

Decidió iniciar su negocio después de que su esposo abandonara el hogar, ella se convirtió en padre y madre para sus 5 hijos, se inició con la venta de verduras pero vio que no era muy rentable y logró conseguir un puesto en el mercado central de Nueva Cajamarca en donde vende todo tipo de aves eviscerados como: gallina de corral, pato, algunas veces pavo y carne de cuy, implementa su negocio con la venta de condimentos licuados como culantro, ajos, ají panca, etc. A ella le gusta el negocio por que le permite generar sus propios ingresos, lo cual aumenta su autoestima, para crecer como persona y mujer.

Con el crédito de S/. 1200.00 lo cual será cancelado en 6 meses compró gallinas, patos, cuyes, vivos para venderlos eviscerados a sus clientes, también compra de manera diaria las verduras para venderlos ya licuados.

La señora Maria Virginia tiene 33 años y 6 hijos, vive con su último hijo, su meta es llegar a tener un negocio de abarrotes, y poder dar trabajo a mas personas, cree que con el este tipo de actividad, descansara un poco, por que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para tener listo la carne llevarlos al mercado para su venta.

loans.use: To buy chickens, ducks and guinea pigs to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Mayra Luz

texts.es:
Señora Mayra Luz M. M. belongs to the Credit Group known as "The Dynamics". She lives in the Region and Province of San Martin, district of Tarapoto. Her residence is located on Jr. Saens Peña, and she runs her business in the Nº 2 Market Jr. Holy Rose Nº 379 (Santa Rose store). She is dedicated to the wholesale and retail sale of dry salted fish.

The opportunity of a loan from Manuela Ramos opened doors for her to buy her product in greater quantity, since she has much demand. Her goal is to buy her product directly from the supplier without intermediaries. To achieve this she needs more capital, which will permit her to supply more clients and to meet her personal goals.

With the loan received of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy dry salted fish in bags of 50 kilograms, in greater quantity and of every size and variety.

Señora Mayra Light, lives with her 2 children and her husband. She works tirelessly to be able to see the results and to feel useful in life, therefore she has with many prospects in the future.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mayra Luz M. M. pertenece al Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las Dinámicas”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Saens Peña, y desarrolla su negocio en el Mercado Nº 2 Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 379 (Almacén Santa Rosa) se dedica a la venta al por mayor y menor de pescado seco salado.

La oportunidad de un préstamo en Manuela Ramos le abrió puertas para comprar en mayor cantidad su producto ya que tiene buena demanda. Su meta es comprar su producto directo del proveedor sin intermediarios, para lograr esto necesita un buen capital, lo que le permitirá abastecer a más clientes y cumplir con sus metas personales.

Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1000.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará pescado seca salado en sacos de 50 kilos, en mayor cantidad y de todo tamaño y variedad.

La señora Mayra Luz, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo trabaja incansablemente para poder ver los resultados y sentirse útil en la vida, pues ella tiene con muchas perspectivas en el futuro

loans.use: To buy dried, salted fish for resale.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Señora Paquita R. Upiachiua, is an associate of the "Sowing the Future" Communal Bank. She lives in the Region and Province of San Martin district of Tarapoto. Her business of selling general groceries, delicacies and other edible products of daily consumption is located in her own house located on Urb. Villa Maria of the same district.

The lady started the business of selling food away from her house, which brought her many problems with her children since they are in school. That was the main motive to change her activity, and she decided to sell groceries from her home since there is no other person that has this type of business where she lives. For this reason her clientele grows everyday.

With the loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, he will buy noodles of different varieties and brand-name products in packages, preserves in boxes, rice and sugar in bags, oil in liter bottles, and eggs in cartons, due to the fact that these food are very much in demand. She will also re-supply their stock of carbonated beverages and delicacies.

Paquita, is a very friendly and persistent woman. She is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and her two children, who she prompts to work harder each day and to reach their objectives. She desires in the future to improve and expand the area where she runs her business and to have a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Paquita R. Upiachiua, es socia del Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro” vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio de venta de abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario, está ubicado en su propia casa ubicada en la Urb. Villa Maria del mismo distrito.

La señora, se inicia en el negocio con la venta de comida, lo realizaba fuera de su casa lo cual le traía muchos problemas con sus hijos ya que ellos están en la etapa escolar, eso fue el principal motivo para cambiar de actividad, y decide por la venta de abarrotes ya que por donde ella vive no hay otra persona que tenga este tipo de negocio, lo que hace que su clientela aumente cada día.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, que será devuelto en 6 meses, comprará fideos de distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botellas de litro, huevos en javas, debido a que estos alimentos son muy requeridos, además de surtir su stock de bebidas gasificadas y golosinas.

Paquita, es una mujer perseverante y muy amigable, tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día más y alcanzar sus objetivos, desea para el futuro mejorar y ampliar el ambiente donde desarrolla su negocio y tener su minimarket.

loans.use: To buy noodles, brand-name products, eggs, oil, rice, sugar, preserves and other products for resale in her grocery business.

loans.name: Hen Hang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hen H. is the group leader of a group of four in Trok Kandal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife. She is 38 and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while two others are studying in the state school. The remaining three are too young to work or attend school. Her husband, Mr. Chanimol Pen, is currently in the business of selling palm sugar, and he is also a subsistence farmer.

Even though they have various business activities, the family members still live in poor conditions. In order to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Hen H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow, to start a cow breeding business. Previously, Mrs. Hen H. obtained a loan to buy fertilizer to support her rice field.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Kin Nhem Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group of four is Mrs. Kin N., a housewife and subsistence farmer. The soil in her field is now infertile, so she has asked for a loan to buy fertilizer to make it more productive. Her husband, Mr. Kheang Mich, is also a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Kin N. is 34 and the mother of three children, who are all too young to work or study. Previously, she also obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer for her field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her field in order to make it more productive

loans.name: Chany An Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chany A. is the group leader of a group of four in Trok Kandal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Chany A. is currently a wedding planner: she rents out wedding outfits and equipment and she assists the bride and groom during the wedding ceremony. Her husband, Mr. Bunthoeurn Lot, is a pig breeder, and his business is doing very well.

Mrs. Chany A. has asked for a loA. to buy two more pigs and pig food. She is 37 and the mother of five children, all of whom are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Chany A. obtained a loA. from AMK to buy pig food.

loans.use: To buy two more pigs and pig food in order to improve her living condition

loans.name: Hit Kaing Group

texts.en: Five people in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang Province form a borrowers' group, and Mrs. Hit K. is the group leader. She owns a small piece of land and her soil is now infertile. Therefore, she has asked for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support her field, in order to obtain a better crop. Mrs. Hit K. is 52 and the mother of three children, all of whom are employed in a garment factory. Previously, Mrs. Hit K. obtained another loan from AMK to buy fertilizer for her field.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to support her field in order to obtain a better crop

loans.name: Hiy Kaing Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiy K. is the group leader of Hiy K. Group in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife and the mother of two children, one of whom is a palm juice collector, while the other is attending school. Her husband, Mr. Hoeurn Sam, is a subsistence farmer.

Nowadays, Mr. Hoeurn Sam's plantation faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to purchase more fertilizer to support his field. Therefore, Mrs. Hiy K. has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer for her husband's business. Previously, she obtained another loan to buy fertilizer for her husband’s field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her husband's  business

loans.name: Chantha Seang Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Chantha S., the group leader, is a 32-year-old widow with two children. One of the children is enrolled in school, while the younger one is too young to work or attend school.

Mrs. Chantha S. is currently employed in a garment factory and can generate only a small salary. With this small salary, she cannot support her family. In order to improve her family’s standard of living, she wants to start a business buying rice to keep in stock and sell for a better price later in the year. In order to do this, Mrs. Chantha S. decided to ask for a loan.

loans.use: To start a business stocking rice to sell later in the year for a better price

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S., 46, sells fish in her village and can earn about $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Uy Phorn, helps Mrs. Sokheourn to sell the fish. They have six children and live in Angkanh Village, Pursat Province. 

Mrs. Chan S. is requesting a loan of  $400 to purchase a motorcycle for business and family use. The loan will allow her to expand and improve her business, as well as improve her quality of life through better transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Rap

texts.en:
Mrs. Rap L., 42, grows crops from her home to sell, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband, Chea Choun, 35, is a motorcycle taxi driver. He earns approximately $3 per day. They live with their three children in Sophy Village, Siem Reap Province. All of their children are young and attend primary school. 

Mrs. Rap L. is requesting a loan of $250 to help purchase a new motorcycle for her husband’s motorcycle taxi business. The new motorcycle will help to expand the business and increase income by attracting more patrons.

loans.use: To help purchase a new motorcycle for her husband’s motorcycle taxi business

loans.name: Oyzodakhon

texts.en:
A. Oyzodakhon is 40 years old, married, and has 6 children. Oyzodakhon owns a vendor shop in the famous central market called “Panjshanbe” in Khujand town. For more than 10 years, she has been selling soft drinks and juices. Oyzodakhon is the only bread-winner in the family, since her husband is currently unemployed. She is very hard-working, and her store offers a wide range of goods at affordable prices. She has loyal clients, and her business brings in stable income for the family. One of Oyzodakhon's dreams is that her children achieve a lot in their lives through obtaining good education. Therefore, making considerable financial sacrifices, she is paying for their studies at a university. 
During the current hot season, the goods at Oyzodakhon's store are in high demand. Therefore, Oyzodakhon is asking for a loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase more goods for sale. The loan will be repaid within 6 months and will greatly help her reach her business goals.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: I. Zuhro is 53 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works as a constructor, while Zuhro has been running her own general store for the past seven years. Starting her own business, she thus tried to ensure sufficient income for her family. This business is one of Zuhro's greatest accomplishments, as she had always dreamed of owning one to not be dependant on anyone else. In her store, Zuhro sells underwear for women, men, and children. She travels to the neighboring town Istaravshan to purchase the goods, and her elder son helps her manage other aspects of the business. While in the beginning Zuhro was selling only a few products, now her store offers a large variety. Currently, she needs to increase the working capital in order to expand her business even further. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$1,000 for a term of 4 months. Zuhro promises to manage the current loan with accuracy as she has done with all the previous ones. She thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Development of a clothing sales business

loans.name: Thi Hiep's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. T. Thi Hiep (ID number: 070037), 48 years old, wants to borrow 300 USD to sell vegetables, assisting local peopL.. She currently is breeding 5 pigs and planting vegetables. Her family has 6 members. Her 2 oldest sons are working, earning 200 USD/month. Her 2 younger children are still going to school. Her husband works everyday. Her family average income is very convenient for her to repay gradually. This method helps her family economy improved.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Hoa (ID number: 070038), 34 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to D. retailing.
  • Mrs. T. Thi Giang (ID number : 070033), 34 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to buy fishes.
  • Mrs. H. Thi Hau (ID number: 070035), 22 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to breed animals.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Bick (ID number: 070032), 44 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to breed anikmals.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Van Anh (ID number: 070036), 38 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to breed animals.
  • Mrs. D. Thi Hai (ID number: 070034), 48 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to D. retailing.

  • Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Trần Thị Hiệp 48 tuổi (Ms 070037), mức vay: 4.256.000 vnđ. Chị vay vốn về để buôn bán rau phục vụ bà con trong làng.Hiện gia đinh chị nuôi 5 con lợn và trồng rau.Gia đình chị có 6 người, hai con trai lớn của chị đã đi làm thu nhập khoảng 3.000.000 vnđtháng, hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học, chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm thuê. Gia đinh chị có thu nhập thường xuyên phù hợp với vốn vay trả dần nên chị rất thích. Được vay vốn sẽ giúp kinh tế gia đình chị phát triển, đời sống được cải thiện. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Lê thị Hoa 34 tuổi (Ms 070038), mức vay: 3.808.000 vnđ để buôn bán nhỏ. Trần Thị Giảng 34 tuổi (Ms 070033), mức vay:3.808.000 vnđ đi chợ cá. Hoàng Thị Hậu 22 tuổi (Ms 070035), mức vay: 3.808.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Lê Thị Bích 44 tuổi (Ms 070032), mức vay: 3.808.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Nguyễn Thị Vân Anh 38 tuổi (Ms 070036), mức vay 3.808.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Đỗ Thị Hải 48 tuổi (Ms 070034), mức vay: 3.808.000 vnđ để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Abdunazar

texts.en: K. Abdunazar is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable, since he is the only bread-winner in the family. Abdunazar earns income providing taxi services with his car. He works from early morning till late night in order to keep his customers and to obtain new ones. Abdunazar has been involved in this business for the last five years, doing his best to provide high quality services at affordable prices. For this purpose, Abdunazar installed a gas-based fuel system in the taxi a while ago. However, now he is planning to replace the previous gas cylinder with a new one made of kapron, since this material is considered safer. Abdunazar is therefore asking for a loan of US$600 for a term of 7 months to be able to purchase the kapron gas-cylinder. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase of a kapron gas-cylinder for a taxi fuel supply system

loans.name: Esmatullah

texts.en:
This is Esmatullah, son of A.. He is married and has two children, and they are the residents of the Ningarhar province. When he graduated from class twelve, he started working as a shop keeper, and he is still working in his shop.

Esmatullah is an active man, and he is attempting to increase his current level of his income to solve all of his family's problems. He wants to pave the road to improve his small business, but for this goal he needs some money to buy many things and find more customers. He applied to AFSG for a loan of 50,000 Afghanis, and he has decided to repay it in 18 months.

loans.use: To buy many things for his shop

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: S. Matluba is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is currently unemployed, and Matluba's business is the main source of income. Matluba is a market vendor: for the past eleven years she has been selling cotton-seed and sunflower-seed oil in the local market. In the traditional Tajik cuisine, most meals are fried or cooked using a lot of oil. Especially the preparation of the national dish “Oshi palov” requires large quantities of cotton-seed oil. Thus, the goods that Matluba sells are highly demanded by the local population. With the income that she makes from the business, Matluba takes care of her two children. She is now asking for a loan of US$1,000 for a term of 6 months. She wants to use this loan to buy more cotton-seed and sunflower-seed oil to increase the stock at the store. Matluba hopes that it will help her increase her income and allow her to pay her children’s school fees. Matluba thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase of sunflower-seed and cotton-seed oil for sale

loans.name: Almahmad

texts.ru:
Almahmad T. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He uses his own car to work as a taxi driver, and has been doing so for five years. He likes this work, but a car is a machine, and it needs repairs. In order to make the repairs he decided to take out a loan of 450 US dollars. This will allow him to provide higher quality services to clients by making the car more comfortable for passengers. He will pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Тошмуродов Алмахмад житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Работает на своем автомобиле таксистом. Занимается этим видом услуги уже пять лет . Работа ему нравится , но машина это техника , которая требует ремонта. Для того , чтобы сделать ремонт он планирует получить кредит в размере 450 долларов США. Сделав ремонт он сможет улучшить качество обслуживания клиентов , создав комфортные условия для пассажиров. Поасит кредит он планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Automobile repair

loans.name: Musabbe

texts.en: Y. Musabbe is 48 years old. She is married and has three children. Musabbe’s husband is currently unemployed; accordingly, she is the main bread-winner in the family. Musabbe has been running her own business for eleven years, keeping a grocery store in the central market. She sells foodstuffs, such as macaroni, sugar, sweets, as well as detergents, soap, washing powder, tooth-paste and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her daughter helps her in the store registering the stock and serving the clients. The business is stable and allows her to improve the living conditions of her family. This year, Musabbe’s daughter is finishing school and hoping to enter a university. In order to make her daughter’s dream come true, Musabbe needs to develop her business and earn more income. She is therefore asking for a loan of US$1,000 which she plans to spend for purchasing more goods for sale. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Qurbonali

texts.ru:
Qurbonali Z. lives in the Khuroson region. He owns a bar, which is located in the center of the region close to a market. He would like to change the assortment of his inventory and purchase various drinks and ice cream. To realize his goal, he plans to obtain a loan and pay it off within 12 months. Qurbonali is married and has 3 children. He is the single provider for his family, but so far he is doing well. For this reason, development of his business even further will bring him good profits.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Забиров Курбонали жительрайона хуросон. Имеет свой бар, который находится в центре раона рядом с рынком. Хочет изменить ассортимент и закупить различные напитки и мороженное. Для этого он планирует получить кредит и погасить его в течении 12 месяцев. Курбонали женат и имеет троих детей. Он является единственным кормильцем семьи , но у него получается неплохо , поэтому развитие его бизнеса принесет неплохой доход.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Muhammad Ashraf

texts.en:
35-year-old Muhammad Ashraf, son of G. A., is one of the people who has returned to his own country, Afghanistan, after the Taliban regime. He currently lives in district Shewa of the Ningarhar province, and he has been working as a miller for the last four years.

Muhammad Ashraf is married and has four children. He cant solve all of his financial problems with his current income because it's about $100 (5000 Afghanis), so he thought about how to find a solution for his problems. When he heard about AFSG, he requested a loan of 50,000 Afghanis to buy some necessary equipments for his mill and raise his income through that. He is an expert man in this field, and it seems that he can achieve his target. He promised that he would repay this loan in 18 months.

loans.use: To buy some necessary equipments for his mill

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Z. Rano is 36 years old. She is married and has two children. Her elder daughter is studying at the university, and her son is at school. Her husband is a market vendor, and Rano is a seamstress, sewing national dresses for women and girls. She has been involved in this business for more than sixteen years and, over time, has gained rich experience. The fabrics required for sewing Rano buys herself in a local market. During her long career as a businesswoman, Rano has become a very popular seamstress and receives many orders. That is why her business has been stable and served as the main source of income for her family. 
Today Rano is requesting a loan of US$600 for a term of 12 months to be able to purchase modern fabrics for sewing. Rano thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate in loan payment.

loans.use: Purchase of modern fabrics for a tailoring business

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Farhod G. lives in the Khuroson region. He is married and has 4 children. He owns a store, where he sells various foods and other products. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. His experience tells him that to increase the profits, he needs to obtain more inventory. To do so, he needs additional financing. This loan will enable him to purchase more inventory and pay off the credit within then next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Гадоев Фархот проживает в районе Хуросон. Занимается торговлей . Имеет магазин , где продает продукты питания и другие промышленные товары. Занимается торговлей уже пять лет. Опыт работы подсказывает , что надо увеличить товарооборот. Но для этого сначала нужно получить кредит . На эти деньгт он купит товар и в течении 10 менсяцев будет погашать кредит. Фархот женат и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Oimgul

texts.ru:
Oimgul H. lives in the Khuroson region. She is married and has 2 children. Their family is very close and strong, which helps them deal with common problems. She stays at home and takes care of animals. She feeds calfs, so they could gain weight, and her husband sells them later on. She would like to obtain a loan to purchase one more calf. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months. Her business helps local residents purchase fresh and quality meat, and also helps Oimgul and her husband provide for their family.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Хотамова Оимгуль проживает врайоне Хуросон. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Они живут очень весело и дружно , что помогает им пережить возникающие проблемы. Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством. Откармливает молодых бычков , а муж продает на рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одного бычка . Погасить кредит она сможет в течение 10 месяцев. Ее бизнес помогает населению покупать свежее и качественное мясо , а так же помогает мужу обеспечивать семью.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Vaysiddin

texts.ru:
Vaysiddin R. lives in the Khuroson region. Vaysiddin has a large family, and that is why he needs to work long hours to provide for his family. He owns a piece of land, which he uses to plant various cultures. In order for him to work the land, he needs to purchase a number of fertilizers. To finance this purchase he is applying for a 10-months loan. This will help him grow quality crops, which he will be able to sell without any problems.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рустамов Вайсиддин проживает в районе Хуросон. Работает агрономом , а так же в частном порядке занимается земледелием.Имеет участок земли , который засеивает различными сельхозкультурами. Для того , чтобы обработать землю ему необходимо закупить удобрения , Но для этого нужно получить кредит со сроком в 10 месяцев. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай , который он сможет продать без каких-либо проблем. У Вайсиддина большая семья , и поэтому ему приходится много работать для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Savriddin

texts.ru:
Savriddin R. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 47 years old, married, and has 6 children. He has secondary education. He is a truck driver by training, but works in agriculture. He plants wheat, flax, and a variety of vegetables. He is occupied by agriculture all year around, and he sells his crops on a market. He would like to obtain a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рустамов Савриддин Вайсиддинович житель района Хуросон. 47 лет , женат и имеет шестерых детей. Образование среднее. По специальности шофер , но зарабатывает на жизнь земледелием.Сеет пшеницу ,., а так же сажает бахчевые и другие овощи. Круглый год он занимается земледелием , а получаемую продукцию продает на рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы использовать его для покупки удобрений и семян. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy L., 33, is a mother of one young child and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has a business selling groceries in the local market and normally earns around $2 profit each day. Her husband owns a big stand in a market, selling a variety of fishes, typically making $25 a day in revenue. Fresh fish, tasty and affordable, is a favorite food among Cambodian people.

Mrs. Luy would like to apply for a loan to invest into her husband's business and to renovate their house. She hopes her husband will be able to expand his business and earn more income for their family. She also hopes that renovation of their house will make it more stable and able to withstand the rainy season.

Mrs. Luy and her daughter are pictured above in front of her grocery store.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services throughout both rural and urban communities in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and renovate the house.

loans.name: Sut

texts.en:
Sut L., 36, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She and her husband have a business selling coffee, rice and noodles. On average, they make $5 in profits each day. This couple has four children, one of whom is married and no longer lives at home; another child works in security, typically earning around $140 per month.

Mrs. Sut L. would like a loan of $1000 to invest in her existing business and to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. This loan would allow her family to increase their income through greater profit from their coffee sales. Mrs. Sut and her husband are pictured above.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services throughout both rural and urban communities in Cambodia.

loans.use: To invest in a coffee business and to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas V., 50, is a widow and lives with her children in Siem Reap province. Mrs. Meas has had a business selling a variety of fruits in a busy market since 1998 and earns around $10 each day. She also gets support from her son who is a fruits vendor in a different market who typically makes about $5 each day. She has four children, one of whom is married and lives away.

Mrs. Meas V. would like a loan to purchase more fruits in order to meet her customers' growing demand and to expand her business. She is pictured here with her son.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services throughout both rural and urban communities in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Thaong

texts.en:
Thaong C. S., 38, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Mrs. Thaong is a government official, working at the Finance Ministry. To supplement her income she also sells some groceries from her home. She earns around $2 each day. Her husband, Nith C., 39, is a local doctor. He provides medical treatment for those in his community who are ill and not well. On average, he makes around $8 per day. This couple has three children and all of them are students.

Mrs. Thaong would like to apply for a loan in order to purchase additional medicine and medical supplies to enhance her husband's business. She believes his work is important for their community, and would like to help support it so that he can expand and improve his services.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Mr. Khat C., 33, is a widower and lives with his only child in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. He is a truck driver and his truck is used to transfer a large amount of soil from place to place. Since 2003 he has been in the business of selling soil by using a big truck. On average, he makes USD $5 per day. Currently Mr. Khat is earning less profit because his truck is too old and uses a lot of gas. He wants to replace the old and unreliable motor to make his truck more fuel efficient. This move would allow his business to be both more economical and environmentally friendly.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To replace an old motor for his truck.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mrs. Pen S. H., 26 years old, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Mrs. Pen and her husband are sugar cane dealers who purchase their product wholesale in bulk from a farm and resell it to the market to earn approximately USD $5 each day to support the family. They have two children and all of them are too young to attend school.

Each day Mrs. Pen pays money for a trailer to transfer her sugar cane to sell in the market. To reduce this daily expense she would like a loan to purchase a small truck. This will help her to transfer the cane to the market herself and lower her overhead costs.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom S., is 59 years old, is a mother of eight children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Both of them earn a combined income of  around US$5 per day. There is one child still lives with them and the rest are married and live away from home. A son who still lives with them is a rice dealer. He purchases rice from house to house until he has a large amount of rice stock, then resells it to the market. On average, he makes US$5 each day.

Mrs. Mom S. would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase a small truck to transfer the rice. She will be able to increase her profit through the purchase a small track. (Mrs. Mom is pictured with the truck that she going to purchase.)

loans.use: To purchase a small truck to transfer rice.

loans.name: Klaok

texts.en: Klaok P., age 53, is married and lives with six of her children. She and her husband work raising pigs. On average, this couple makes US$8 per day. Two of her children are married and no longer live at home. Klaok would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase more pigs to breed and also to purchase feed for the pigs. This loan would allow her family to increase their profits from raising pigs.

loans.use: To raise pigs.

loans.name: Thị Thủy's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. Dao Thi Thuy (ID number: 010006), 37 years old, wants to borrow 260 USD to breed cows and plant vegetables. She is living with her husband and 2 children who are going to school. She and her husband both have stable income. Her husband is a truck driver, earning 100 USD/month. She stays at home. Her family average income is 175 USD/ month.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Huyen (ID number: 010053), 43 years old, needs 260 USD to make tofu and sell vegetables.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Linh (ID number: 010157), 27 years old, needs 100 USD to sell vegetable and breed animals.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi May (ID number: 010008), needs 145 USD to expand her vegetable shop.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Nhu Thanh (ID number: 010013), 48 years old, needs 260 USD to breed pigs.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: breed animals, sell vegetables

loans.name: Kuv

texts.en: Kuv B., age 44, makes US$5 each day from selling groceries in the village. Her husband helps Mrs. Kuv with her grocery business. The couple has three children, one of who is married and lives away from home. One child is a construction worker that builds houses. To increase her sales, she would like to add inventory and purchase fertilizers for resell.

loans.use: To add grocery inventory and purchase fertilizer to resell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Urunboy

texts.ru:
Urunboy S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is in the business of children's clothing sales. He imports his inventory from China. He is married and has 2 children. His wife stays at home and takes care of the children. However, they have a garden, where they grow vegetables. They have a friendly and strong family, where everyone likes to work.

Urunboy does not have enough money to increase the inventory assortment and turnover. For this reason, he would like to obtain a loan. He plans to pay it off within the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Шокиров Урунбой живет в районе Рудаки. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Ездит в Китай за товаром. Торгует на рынке детской одеждой. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Жена не работает. Но у них есть огород , где они выращивают овощи. Вся семья дружная и все любят работать.Но для оборота не хватает немного денег , поэтому он хочет получить кредит и таким образом увеличить товарооборот.Погасить кредит он исможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok N., age 41, is a widow and lives with four of her children in the Prey Veng province. There are not maN. stores that sell soft drinks in the village so Sok has maN. customers. She sells a variety  of soft drinks, and on average she makes US$3 of profit per day. Two of her children are married and live away from home. Sok would like a loan from Kiva to add items to her inventory to meet her customer’s demand.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Anvar S. lives with his family in Rudaki. He is married and has six children. Additionally, his daughter-in-law and his small grand daughter lives with him. They have a big family, but all of them help each other. His wife works in gold embroidery. She sews and embroiders traditional dresses for brides. He works in the Dekhkon market where he has a shop. He sells vegetables. He wants to take out a loan to increase his product turnover. He can pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Шокиров Анвар живет со своей семьей в районе Рудаки. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Кроме того вместе с ним живет сноха и маленькая внучка. У них большая семья , но они все помогают друг другу. Его жена занимается золотошитьем. Шьет и вышивает нацианальные наряды для невест. Сам он работает на рынке «Дехкон» , где имеет торговую точку. Продает овощи. Хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот . Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Anvar.

texts.ru: Шокиров Анвар живет со своей семьей в районе Рудаки. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Кроме того вместе с ним живет сноха и маленькая внучка.  У них большая семья , но они все помогают друг другу. Его жена занимается золотошитьем. Шьет и вышивает нациoнальные наряды для невест. Сам он  работает на рынке «Дехкон» , где имеет торговую точку. Продает овощи. Хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот . Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Увеличить товарооборот

loans.name: Ohundjon

texts.ru:
Ohundjon S. lives in Rudaki. He is married and has four children. He works driving a cargo taxi. He has a small truck and transports cargo. He works out of the SOMON market. It is a vegetable market where large-scale farmers trade; therefore, he has many clients. Ohundjon wants to repair his vehicle so that he can work without interruption. Therefore, he wants to take out a loan to help him make repairs. He can pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Шокиров Охунджон житель района Рудаки. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает водителем грузового такси. Имеет небольшую грузовую машину и перевозит грузы . Рабочая точка рынок « СОМОН» . Это овощной базар , где торгуют дехкане, поэтому он имеет много клиентов. Охун хочет сделать ремонт в машине , который даст возможность бесперебойно работать . Поэтому он хочет получить коредит , который сможет помочь ему сделать ремонт.Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon S., 28, is a mother of one young child and, with her husband, works at construction site. They earn a combined income of around $15 each day. This couple would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will reduce the daily expense that they have to spend on a motor-taxi. (Husband is pictured alone)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru:
Rahima A. lives in Rudaki. She lives with her son and his family. Despite the fact that her son works, she earns a living for herself and still helps her son's family. She sells honey and eggs. She works in the Shokhmansur market. She buys goods from suppliers and sells them at retail. She buys eggs at a factory for low prices. She wants to increase her product turnover and increase her honey supply. This is possible only if she receives a loan. She plans to pay off her debt in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Абдуллоева Рахима проживает в районе Рудаки. Живет с сыном и его семьей. Но не смотря на то , что сын работает она сама зарабатывает на жизнь и еще помогает семье сына. Занимается торговлей меда и яиц. Торгует на рынке «Шохмансур». Закупает товар у поставщиков и продает в розницу. Яйца скупает на фабрике по более низким ценам. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , для того , чтобы увеличить запас меда. Это возможно только при получении кредита. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Inobathon

texts.ru:
Inobathon M. lives in the Rudaki area. She sews Tadjik quilts. She buys cotton wool and material, sews the quilts, and distributes the finished product. This business requires additional investment since the price of cotton wool grows daily. Therefore, she has decided to buy all the materials necessary for her business and work with all of her might since it is time for her son to marry. For this, Inobathon plans to take out a loan which she can pay off in 12 months. Inobathon is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Махмаджонова Инобатхон жительница района Рудаки. Занимается пошивом ватных одеял, которые актуальны у таджикского народа. Закупает вату и материал, шьет и отдает под реализацию. Ее бизнес требует вложений , так как цены на вату ежедневно растут. По этой причине она решила закупить все необходимое для бизнеса и работать в полную силу, так как пора женить сына. Для этого Инобатхон планирует получить кредит , погасить который сможет в течении 12 месяцев. Инобатхон замужем и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Purchasing Materials

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Sabohat M. lives in Rudaki. She lives with her family. She is married and has one child. To provide for the family, she and her husband are engaged in trade. They sell clothes in the Korvon market. To increase their product turnover, she wants to take out a loan for 750 US dollars for 12 months. This will help to increase the profitability of her business and will help to improve living conditions for her child.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.
