Махмадалиева Сабохат проживает в районе Рудаки. Живет со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Чтобы обеспечить свою семью они с мужем занимаются торговлей. Торгуют на рынке «Корвон» одеждой. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот хочет получить кредит в размере 750долларов США со срокос в 12 месяцев. Это поможет увеличить доходность ее бизнеса и поможет улучшить условия жизни для ее ребенка.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin L., 38, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her five children. She works in the local food market selling Khmer cakes known as, “Num Akeo.” It is a traditional Khmer cake made from sticky rice and sugar and it earns her about US$3 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes US$2 each day, while the family is also supported by some of the children who work. Two of the daughters sell soft drinks on the roadside near the local market, making around US$2 each day, while the other three are too young to work. Yin L. has asked for a loan of US$800 to purchase a stand near the market for her daughters to sell desserts. The dessert business is much more profitable than soft drinks and she believes her family can increase its income with this expansion.

loans.use: To purchase a stand in the market

loans.name: Cheikh Oumar

texts.fr:
Cheikh Oumar is a mechanic and his main business consists of repairing motorcycle tires. This loan would help him build his business and buy new products. The income will help him pay for the schooling expenses for his children as well as take care of his wife and children.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Cheikh oumar est un vulganisateur son activité principale est la réparation des pneus pour moto .Le pret contracté lui permet de renforcer ses activités par l'achat de nouveaux produits.Les revunus tirés de l'activité lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants mais aussi d'entretenir sa femme et ses enfants.

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Chiv

texts.en: Chiv N. is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with one of her two children. One child is a student and the other works in Phnom Penh making and selling incense. Chiv N. is a farmer and she typically makes US$2 each day, while her husband (pictured above) works as a motortaxi driver in front of the busy market. Her husband typically makes US$2.50 each day, but inflation has caused many prices of basic necessities to rise very high. Chiv N. sees an opportunity to expand her farm and to increase her daily income. She has asked for a loan of US$700 to purchase rice crops from the growers to resell for a profit. This is a common employment opportunity for Cambodians, as it involves removing rice from its husk and reselling it in the market for a profit.

loans.use: Purchase rice to resell in the market.

loans.name: Chao

texts.en: Chao T., 43, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and four children. She cares for her family as a housewife and she cooks food for the household, while her husband sells and buys rubber in Kampong Cham. He typically makes US$3 of net income each day,  but the family is also supported by two of the children who work to collect rubber as well. High inflation in Cambodia has forced many Cambodians to find new means of income to make ends meet. Chao T. would like to purchase a cow to raise and sell for a profit and she is asking for a loan of US$650 to accomplish this goal. She believes that the profit she can turn over on such a high priced animal will be enough to meet some of the family’s needs.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Nal

texts.en: Nal N., 20, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Soeun Sim, and their one young child. She is a farmer who typically makes US$1.60 working the fields, while her husband  is also a farmer who grows cucumber and rice, making US$2.30 each day. This has been a difficult year for farmers in Cambodia, because weather patterns have not been as consistent and inflation has been high. Many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. Nal N. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase ducks to breed for eggs. She sees this as the beginning of a business that would expand and, in the future, she would like to have a lot of ducks to generate many eggs. Duck eggs are a popular food here in Cambodia and she is confident that once the business starts, her customer base will grow rapidly.

loans.use: To purchase ducks

loans.name: Tou

texts.en: Tou L. S., 33, is married to Lu Ya, and they live in the Kampong Cham province with their three children. She sells groceries and vegetables in the market, typically making US$5 each day, while her husband works at a rubber plantation collecting rubber for US$2 each day. They are also supported by the employment of one of their sons who works with his father collecting the rubber. Tou L. S. has seen a need for electricity in her community where there is none, and she would like to purchase a generator. She has asked for a loan of US$650 to purchase a generator and the necessary wires and equipment to sell electricity to people in her community. She sees this as only the beginning, though, and would like to expand her electricity business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of a generator

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S., 22, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Mun Pheap (pictured above), and their young child. She works together with her husband in the city, making US$13 of income each day as they sell firewood. Her business, however, is in need of capital to expand their customer base. She has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase two cows to use for transporting her firewood from place to place. A couple of cows will make her much more mobile and allow her to travel to make sales. In the future, she would like to expand her business even further with the purchase of a car to transport the firewood. A small car for her business transportation would allow her to reach an even larger group of customers.

loans.use: To purchase two cows to transport firewood

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Sat Y., 54, is a widow living in the Kampong Cham province, who sells firewood for US$5 of net income each day. This has been a difficult year for people in Cambodia, because weather patterns have not been as consistent and inflation has been high. Many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. She has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase more wood and increase her inventory. She believes that she has a large enough customer base to expand her business, she simply lacks the capital necessary to meet the demand. She sees this loan as an opportunity to increase her daily income and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Darou Salam Santhie Group

texts.fr:
The Darou Salam group unites 3 merchants who hold a fruit and vegetable stand at the corner market. To help themselves out, they have a daily contribution system set in place; however, now they are requesting a loan of 500000 cfa (1200 USD) to build the operating fund for their small business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Le groupement darou salam réunit 3 commerçants qui tiennent des étales de fruits et légumes au marché du coin.Pour s'entre aider ils ont d 'abord mis en place un systeme de cotisations journaliéres avant de solliciter un pret de 500000f cfa pour renforcer leur fonds de commerce.

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Son K., 52, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her four children. She works in the fields as a farmer, making around US$2 each day, while she is also supported by  two of her children who work in the local garment factories and her son who works in the market selling fruits. The income from the two daughters is US$2.60 each day, while her son typically makes US$3 each day of net income. This has been a difficult year for farmers in Cambodia, because weather patterns have not been as consistent and inflation has been high. Many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. Son K. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to expand her son’s fruit inventory. She sees his business as more profitable than her own and has set it as a higher priority. However, she would like to expand her own farmland in the future, and expand her cultivation. She is an ambitious woman who is working hard to support her family and improve its standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. Dy S. is a 57-year-old teacher. She sells groceries at her school and she earns around $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Meng Savuth, is 28-years-old and drives a motorcycle-taxi and he earns around $2 per day. They have five children, two of whom are married. Of the remaining children, two are in school and one is a motorcycle-taxi driver. 

Mrs. S. seeks a loan in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. The loan will allow her to improve her family’s income so that she can better manage her family's expenses and children’s school fees. The picture is of Mrs. S.'s husband.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Din L., 48, is married and lives with one of her four children in the Kampong Cham province. She works in the fields as a farmer together with her husband (pictured above), and they both make US$1 each day. Three of their children live outside the famiL.’s home, but there is one child who is still dependent upon Din L.. This has been a difficult year for farmers in Cambodia, because weather patterns have not been as consistent and inflation has been high. Many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. The high inflation has caused food prices, especialL. rice, to skyrocket. She has asked for a loan of US$250 to purchase seeds and fertilizer to expand her rice crops. She has seen how the price of rice is currentL. very high and will be able to generate a high profit from these purchases.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: May

texts.en: May K., 53, is married and lives with her three children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband work in the fields together as farmers and they make around US$4 each day. The family is also supported by one of their children who is a brick ladder maker. This has been a difficult year for farmers in Cambodia, because weather patterns have not been as consistent and inflation has been high. Many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. May K. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer and yam seeds. They believe that with an opportunity to expand their business, they can generate more income and improve their standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business even further with the purchase of rubber trees.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and yam seeds

loans.name: Sarth

texts.en: Sarth S., 36, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham with her four children. She works in the fields as a farmer, making US$3 each day, while her husband, Im Chhun, is a fisherman who typically makes US$4.50 each day. Two of their children work in the garment factories, making US$100 each per month, while the other two children are enrolled in a primary school. She has asked for a loan of US$400 to purchase some new fishing tools for her husband and to purchase fertilizer for her own business. She believes that with some new tools her husband can generate more income and the fertilizer can improve her yields. In the future, she would like to continue expanding her family’s two businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sabine G., who was born on July 19, 1978 in Cotonou, is married to Moïse Kouton, a welder with his own workshop in Cotonou. The couple has two children, both at school. Sabine G. has run a business selling various products such as soap, candy, cookies, pasta and toothpaste in Cotonou for well over a decade. Facing high demand, she felt the need to increase her inventory. This led her to request a first-time loan on September 25, 2006 of CFA 10,000. She is now on her fourth loan, for which she is requesting CFA 100,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame G. Sabine née le 19/07/1978 à COTONOU est mariée à KOUTON Moïse, Soudeur autogène ayant son atelier à COTONOU. Ce couple a à son actif deux enfants tous scolarisés. G. Sabine a pour activité la vente de divers produits à comme le savon, les bombons, les galettes, les pâtes alimentaires et de pâtes dentifrices depuis une dizaine d'années à Cotonou. Confrontée à une forte demande, elle a ressenti la nécessité pour elle d’accroître son approvisionnement ; ce qui l’avait amené à faire recours à son premier crédit le 25/0906 pour un montant de prêt initial de 10000FCFA. Elle est à son quatrième crédit pour lequel elle sollicite 100 000F CFA.

loans.use: To buy 20 dozen tubes of toothpaste and various everyday staples

loans.name: Afoussatou

texts.fr:
Born in the north of Togo in Lama-Kara on May 12, 1966, Mrs. Afoussatou B. M. is married to Mr. Baba Ouro-Tagba who retails motorcycle spare parts. She has three children who are all enrolled in school. Her primary business activity is selling cereals (corn and dried beans) in the market at Agoè Assiyéyé.

She has already had one loan from WAGES and is requesting this second loan to buy 10 sacks of corn and 4 sacks of dried beans so as to stock up and be able to have a good turnover.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née au nord du Togo à Lama-Kara, le 12 mai 1966, madame B. M. Afoussatou s’est mariée à monsieur OURO-TAGBA Baba qui est un revendeur des pièces détachées de moto. Elle a trois enfants qui vont à l’école. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des céréales (maïs et haricot) dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé.

Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs et 04 sacs du haricot afin de refaire le stock et pouvoir bien vendre.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 sacks of corn and 4 sacks of dried beans

Achat de 10 sacs de maïs et de 04 sacs du haricot

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rita - Mahouty

texts.fr:
Aged 34, Mrs. Rita-Mahouty K. was born in Ivory Coast. Her first husband was an expatriate with whom she had two children, Jean Carlos and Whitney, ages 17 and 12 respectively, who are both in the care of their father. She remarried Gérard Messan, a computer engineer with whom she has one child aged one. The couple has lived in the Gbèdjromèdé neighborhood in the center of Conotou for four years. A qualified hairdresser by profession, Mrs K. has been practicing her trade and at the same time selling hair extensions and cosmetics for 18 years. Her welcome and expertise have brought in a large clientele that she can no longer satisfy because of lack of financial means. In order to remedy this, in March 2007 she turned to a first-time loan of CFA 50,000. Bolstered by this initial experience, which was very beneficial, she is now requesting a loan of CFA 100,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 34ans, dame K. Rita – Mahouty est née en Côte-d’Ivoire et a eu de son premier mariage avec un expatrié avec qui elle a eu deux enfants, Jean Carlos et Whitney âgés respectivement de 17ans et 12ans tous à la charge de leur père. Elle s’est remariée avec MESSAN Gérard, Ingénieur Informaticien avec qui elle a eu un enfant âgé d’un an. Le couple réside au quartier Gbèdjromèdé au centre de la ville de COTONOU depuis 4ans. Maîtresse coiffeuse de profession, dame K. Rita – Mahouty exerce sa profession et vend parallèlement des mèches et des produits cosmétiques depuis 18ans. Son accueil et son expertise lui ont attiré une forte clientèle qu’elle n’arrivait plus à satisfaire, faute de moyens financiers. Afin de parer ce déficit, elle a recouru en mars 2007 à un premier prêt de 50 000F CFA. Aguerrie, par cette première expérience qui lui a été très bénéfique, elle demande à présent un prêt de 100.000F CFA.

loans.use: To buy three dozen hair extensions and various beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 45 year old married mother of six children. She lives in Manyatta Kisumu, Kenya. Pamela is the proprietor of a tailoring business that she initiated 25 years ago. She supplements her income with the sale of ready-made clothes. Pamela has applied for $600.00 to enable her to purchase more stock of tailoring materials.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To buy stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Abdukavi

texts.ru:
Abdukavi has been buying and selling cattle for years, even as a child, with his father, he raised domestic cattle and that's where he learned all the secrets of the trade.

Now, he's a professional with a good business sense. He started out his business buing and selling small cattle and gradually began to buy and raise large livestock.

Today, he goes from district to district to buy cattle from one and sell to another. He uses part of the profits for his family's subsistance, and the other part he puts back into his business.

He has been working with Microinvest for a year, and in this time, has proven himself to be punctual with his payments. Abdukavi has applied for a new loan to help him further expand his business.

Translated from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Абдукави уже много лет занимается куплей продажей скота. С детства он еще вместе с отцом занимался выращиванием скота дома и оттуда познал все секреты этого занятия.

Сейчас он уже профессионал и знает толк в своем деле. Свой бизнес начинал с купли продажи мелкого скота, постепенно стал покупать и выращивать крупный рогатый скот. На сегодняшний день он ездит по району и покупает скот в одном месте а перепродает в другом и получаемый доход частично тратит на семейные расходы а другую часть вкладывает в бизнес.

С Микроинвест сотрудничает год и за это время показал себя пунктуальным клиентом. В планах у Абдукави дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и поэтому он обратился за новым займом.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru:
Davron G. lives in the Gissarsky area. He is married and has three children. He works buying and selling small livestock. He has been doing this business for 14 years. He brings sheep and goats from other areas and sells them locally. The business brings in quite a good income; therefore, Davron has decided to increase his product turnover. This will help to increase profits and to improve living conditions for his family. Because of this, he has decided to take out a loan to be repaid in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Гулямов Даврон житель Гиссарского района. Женат и имеет троих детей. Занимается купле-продажей мелко рогатого скота. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 14 лет. Привозит овец и коз из других районов и продает у себя в районе. Бизнес приносит неплохой доход , поэтому Даврон решил увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить получаемую прибыль и улучшить условия жизни для своей семьи. В связи с этим он решил получить кредит со сроком в 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product turnover

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru:
This is not the first time Hamidahon is in business and she knows all the subtleties of entrepreneurship. She started by selling fresh greens, and having gradually expanded her business, began selling fruits and vegetables.

She goes to the wholesale market in Khujand (100 km from her home) to purchase produce in bulk from local farmers.

Hamidahon turned 50 years old this year, she is married and raises five children. Her eldest children help her trade in the market.

With the assistance of loans in the past, Hamidahon significantly expanded her business, and she plans to further expand it with this loan.

Translated from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

Хамидахон не первый год занимается бизнесом и знает все тонкости предпринимательства. Начинала с продажи зелени, постепенно расширив свой бизнес перешла на продажу фруктов и овощей.

За товаром она ездит на оптовые рынки Худжанда (100 км от ее дома) и многое покупает здесь же на рынке у местных фермеров.

Хамидахон в этом году исполнилось 50 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 5 детей. Старшие дети уже помогают ей на рынке торговать.

Хамидахон с помощью займов намного расширила свой бизнес и с новым займом собирается дальше развивать его.

loans.use: To expand Business

loans.name: Moliya

texts.ru:
Moliya is 25, married and has a child. Every year, in the season for drying apricots, she and her family go to the apricot gardens to pick apricots for drying. The dried apricots are stored in sacks in her house, and are gradually sold for income that Moliya and her family subsist on. After she learned about the possibility of getting a loan, Moliya decided to apply for one so that she could purchase additonal fresh apricots.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Молие исполнилось 25 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 1 ребенка. Каждый год в сезон сушки абрикосов, она и ее семья выезжают под абрикосовые сады и сушат абрикосы. Высушенные абрикосы хранятся в мешках дома и постепенно продавая их семья Молии живет на вырученные деньги. Узнав о возможности получения займа Молия решила подать заявку на займ и собирается получить займ и дополнительно к своим собственным сбережениям прикупить свежих абрикосов.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh apricots

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera M. is married and has three children. The money she was making in her previous job was not enough to support the basic needs of her family. Therefore, Vera decided to start her own business. For the last 12 years, she has had a vending kiosk selling women’s clothing in the central market. It is the only source of income for her family. 

Vera realizes the value of lending services which have contributed to the growth and success of her small business. She has maintained a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine,” repaying all of her loans. Currently, Vera is requesting a loan of US$875 to buy assorted inventory. One of her long-term plans is to develop a sustainable venture that she could leave for her children when they grow up. She believes that her optimism and tenacity, combined with external financial assistance, will continue to improve her business and its profitability.

loans.use: Purchase of summer dresses for retail sale

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a small entrepreneur from Kamenka who sells leather goods, cosmetics, and small items like batteries, flashlights and blades in the central city market. Galina has chosen this market segment, because there are very few other businessmen working in it despite the high demand. She has a lot of experience selling clothing, since she has been working as a market entrepreneur for about 11 years. Currently, Galina has about US$6,000 worth of goods in the store inventory, and her monthly income is about US$600. Previously, Galina used to work as a book-keeper, and this practical skill now helps her in her everyday work. 

Currently, Galina would like to take out a short-term "express" loan (to be repaid within one month) to be able to purchase additional merchandise for the summer season, thus better meeting the needs of her customers. Financial assistance also previously has helped Galina sustain her business and herself, since, like most retired people, she receives a very small retirement fee which is not sufficient for covering even the basic expenses. The current loan will be of considerable support for Galina and will help her feel financially more secure.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for inventory

loans.name: Rooslana

texts.en:
Rooslana is single. After working for a while as a salesperson, she decided to start her own venture. Three years ago, Rooslana began selling men and women’s clothing in one of the local markets of Ivano-Frankivsk. Roslana has been an outstanding client with “Nadiya Ukraine,” promptly repaying all the loans that he has taken out and that have had a considerable positive impact on her business.

Rooslana is now asking for a short-term seasonal loan (to be repaid within two months) to be able to purchase 40 women’s shirts and 40 pairs of men's socks. She believes that a good variety of clothing items that are both comfortable and durable will sell well and will help her generate additional profit. Rooslana is hoping to invest part of her profits in fulfilling one of her long-term plans of opening a second vending facility and significantly expanding her business.

loans.use: Purchase of additional goods for sale

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is single and supports himself and his younger brother working as a taxi driver. He owns a car and provides transportation services throughout Ukraine. Sergei is physically challenged - he has cerebral palsy. The taxi business is his only income source, and he puts much hope in its further growth. Sergei works very hard, sometimes without days off or vacation, in order to earn enough income. He uses a walkie-talkie to help him facilitate his work and pick-up passengers a lot faster. 

Sergei has been in this business for 8 years. His determination to succeed has helped him keep his business stable and sustainable and has promoted its expansion. Sergei has paid back all the loans that he ever borrowed from “Nadiya Ukraine.” Currently, his daily income is about US$30-40, and he would like to take out a short-term seasonal loan to be repaid within two months. With the help of the money, Sergei would be able to do some repair work on his vehicle and, in the future, remodeling of his apartment. Sergei's modesty, diligence and responsibility so far have helped him develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other taxi drivers, and it will also help him promptly repay the current loan.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru:
Even though Dilovar is only 22 years old, she has been doing business for many years. She sells all kinds of clothing: men's, women's and children's. She does not have a permanent vendor space so she travels over to surrounding regions and sells where there are markets available. She travels to the wholesale markets to buy the goods. She lives with her parents and the profits from the business no matter how small make a decent investment into the family budget. Dilovar dreams about the time when she will save enough money to open her own little shop so then she will not have to travel to the outside villages. Even it will be small, but her own store.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хотя Диловар исполнилось всего 22 года она уже много лет занимается бизнесом. Продает она все виды одежды - мужскую, женскую и детскую. Постоянного места торговли у нее нету и она ездит по окрестным районам где есть базары и торгует на них. За товаром она ездит на оптовые рынки. Живет вместе с родителями и прибыль от бизнеса приносит хоть и небольшой но все же вклад в семейный бюджет. Диловар мечтает о том времени когда она сможет накопить денег и открыть маленький магазинчик, и тогда не надо будет ездить по окрестным деревням. Это будет маленьки но все же свой магазинчик.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Shahnoza is 21 years old, not married. After graduating from school she has not worked anywhere and stayed at home because there were not positions open anywhere where she could work. To have some kind of additional income Shahnoza has been drying fresh apricots during the season for the past three years. The technology is simple and does not require any hard labor. In the early mornings the apricots are collected into boxes and after being burned in sulfur are lied on the sun to dry. After a couple of days the seeds are taken out and the fruit is dried more. The ready made dry apricots are then collected into sacks and then sold closer to autumn when the price for them is higher. The profits from this business helps support the family. This year Shahnoza decided to get a loan to buy more apricots.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шахнозе 21 год, она незамужем. После окончания школы она нигде не работает и сидит дома, так как нету места где можно было бы устроиться на работу. Чтобы иметь хоть какой нибудь дополнительный доход Шахноза уже третий год в сезон сушки абрикосов покупает свежие абрикосы и сушит их. Технология простая и не требует особых затрат труда. Рано утром абрикосы собираются в ящики и после обкуривания серой выкладываются на солнце. через день-два из них выжимаются косточки и потом снова сушатся. Готовые высушенные абрикосы закладываются в мешки и потом ближе к осени когда цена на них вырастает их можно продавать. Полученный таким образом доход помогает содержать семью. В этом году Шахноза решила обратиться за займом, чтобы закупить больше абрикосов.

loans.use: To buy fresh apricots

loans.name: Luchando Por El Por Venir Group

texts.en:
Rosa M. is one of the members of the 10-person micro-bank, Luchando Por El Por Venir, which means Fighting for His Return. This small bank is composed of all Haitian immigrants who live in a small community just outside of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.

Each of these unique Haitian entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

Rosa M. intends to use this loan to purchase pants, blouses, women’s shoes, and perfume from the nearby city of Santiago. She will sell her inventory both on the streets of her community and from within her small home. She has established a reputation in her community for providing good quality clothing and has a small group of clients who come to her house regularly. Her business allows her to feed her three children and purchase school uniforms for them, a responsibility that she must face on her own as her husband has left her to provide for their children alone.

On behalf of Rosa, the entire Luchando group, and the team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, women's shoes, perfumes, and more for resale in the streets of Puerto Plata.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is a 45 year old entrepreneur. She is married and lives with her family in Nyamasaria Kisumu, Kenya. She runs a grocery stall that she initiated in 1985. She has received three microfinance loans from KMET. She owes her success to KIVA/KMET partnership. Benta has requested for $400.00 to enable her add more stock to her store.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mahinou

texts.fr: Mrs. Mahinou D. was born around 1970 and lives in Enagnon, a slum neighborhood of Cotonou. Married to Houinsavi Akpovo, a carpenter, she is the mother of his three children of whom two are in school and the third is an apprentice. Having lived in this neighborhood for 7 years, she sells smoked fish, jewelry, and various other products. On October 10, 2006 she came in and requested a first loan of US$ 75 which allowed her to take care of some financial difficulties with her business. She has made a lot of progress with her little business and for her fourth loan, she is requesting the amount of US$ 250 to bolster her capital which is somewhat improved at present. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerDame D. Mahinou est née vers les années 1970 et réside à ENAGNON un quartier bidonville de Cotonou. Mariée  à AKPOVO Houinsavi, menuisier de son état, elle a eu avec ce dernier trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés et le troisième en apprentissage. Installée dans ce quartier depuis sept ans, elle vend du poisson fumé, des bijoux et des produits divers. Le 10 octobre 2006, elle vint faire pour un premier prêt la demande d’un montant de 30.000fcfa qui lui a permis de régler quelques difficultés financières qu’elle avait dans l'exercice de ses activités. Elle a beaucoup évolué dans son petit commerce et pour son quatrième prêt, elle sollicite un montant de 100.000fcfa pour renforcer son capital qui s’est quelque peu amélioré.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 cases of fishAchat de 10 cartons de poissons.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Nigina has been a client of MicroInvest for two years now. She has proven herself to be a punctual client. She is 33 years old, married and is raising two children. Her husband travels to Russia for work and she is staying in Isfara with her children. The business helps her sustain a small family budge. She brings in the goods from wholesale markets and resells at a local market. Nigina has recently rented out a small store at the central market. She needs a loan to increase the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нигина кредитуется в Микроинвест уже 2 года. За это время показала себя пунктуальной клиенткой. Ей 33 года, она замужем и воспитывает 2 детей. Ее муж ездит на заработки в Россию, а она вместе с детьми живет в Исфаре. Бизнес помогает поддерживать ее скромный семейный бюджет. Свой товар она привозит с оптовых рынков и продает на местном рынке. Нигина недавно арендовала небольшой магазинчик на центральном рынке. Для расширения ассортимента своего бизнеса решила обратиться за новым займом.

loans.use: To increase variety

loans.name: Lissikatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Lissikatou H., 28, is married and the mother of three children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is married to Ernest Fanou, a trained cook who lost his job two years ago. Mrs. Lissikatou H. has lived for 25 years in Xwlacodji, a densely populated neighborhood of Cotonou. For the past 8 years, she sold foodstuffs, especially corn. In view of the evolution of her business, she felt the need to take out a loan. At the beginning of 2008, her daughter Florence had some health problems that caused Mrs. H. to spend all her business capital to save her daughter's life. Despite this very unfortunate situation, she fully reimbursed her last loan. To get her business up and running again, she is again asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 250 to be used for a new project, namely selling cooked food which should be more lucrative because of the current crisis in the food supply.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame H. Lissikatou est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Agée de 28 ans, elle s’est mariée à FANOU Ernest, cuisinier de profession qui a perdu son emploi il y a deux ans. Dame H. Lissikatou réside à Xwlacodji un quartier populaire de Cotonou depuis 25ans. Elle vendait au départ les produits vivriers surtout le maïs depuis 8ans.Voyant l’évolution de son activité; elle sent la nécessité d’avoir recours au prêt. Au début de l’année 2008 elle a eu des problèmes de santé avec sa fille Florence qui l’ont amené à dépenser tout son capital pour sauver la vie de son enfant. Malgré cette situation combien préjudiciable, elle a remboursé entièrement son dernier prêt. Pour se faire relancer, elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit d’un montant de montant de 100000 Fcfa pour un nouveau projet plus rentable qu’est la restauration à cause de la crise alimentaire actuelle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 25 liters of peanut oil, 5 sacks of charcoal, 1 50-kg sack of corn, 1 sack of rice, a 10-kg sack of dried beans

Achat de 25 litres huile d’arachide, de 5 sacs de charbon, 1 sac maïs de 50 kg, 1 sac de riz, de 10kg de haricot.

loans.name: Oishahon

texts.ru:
Oishahon is not a young woman. She has turned 67 and has raised eight children. She is already retired long time ago, but still sells on the market. She receives a small pension, but to be able to cover her expenses she needs to find work. Oishahon sells greenery, and although it is a small but decent addition to her pension. She goes to the market in the early morning and sells there all day. In the early spring she sells greenery, then changes to garlic and later starts selling tomatoes and cucumbers. When she found out about MicroInvest she decided to apply for a loan. She will use the loan to expand her small business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Оишахон уже немолодая женщина. Ей исполнилось 67 лет, воспитала 8 детей. Она уже давно на пенсии, но продолжает выходить на базар и торговать. Пенсия маленькая , а чтобы позволить себе большие расходы надо чем то заниматься. Оишахон продает зелень. это хоть и небольшой но все же прибавок к ее пенсии. Рано утром она собирается на базар и весь день она торгует на нем. Рано весной она продает зелень, потом переходит на чеснок и потом продает помидоры и огурцы. Узнав о Микроинвест она решила обратиться туда за займом. Поолученные средста она расходует на расширение своего маленького бизнеса.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Jose Patricio

texts.es:
José Patricio is a long-time client. He has three school-age children. He does not own his own home. His wife sells CDs. Both work 12-13 hours a day to be able to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El Sr.José Patricio es cliente antiguo de la institución, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, no cuenta con vivienda propia, su esposa se dedica a la venta de Cds, ambos trabajan de 12 a 13 Hrs. al dia para poder sustentar los gastos de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of computer accessories and DVDs for sale

loans.name: Fidelia's Group

texts.es: Mi nombre es Fidelia A. F. soy comerciante, tengo 45 años de edad, tengo 15 años de vivir en esta comunidad, tengo 2 hijos que actualmente estan en la escuela, tengo una pequeña pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitacion, aqui vendo todo tipo de productos de consumo popular tambien desde hace 10 años me dedico a la elaboracion y venta  de pan de levadura, tengo una ventaja la cual es que mi negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico porque circulan muchas personas que vienen de otras comunidades y aldeas vecinas, actualmente estoy solicitando apoyo monetario para poder surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes mayor y mejor variedad de productos

loans.use: compra de mercaderia como ser pan, mantequilla, manteca, aceites, arroz, azucar, leche, harina de maiz y de trigo, frijoles, queso, embutidos, sal, agua.

loans.name: Gregoria Lurdes

texts.es:
Gregoria Lurdes lives with her husband and their children. She helps her husband with the business (general store) and has worked with our organization for about a year. This client was recommended by an excellent former client. She has never been late on her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

LA SEÑORA VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS HIJOS. AYUDA AL ESPOSO CON ESTE NEGOCIO Y TRABAJA CON NUESTRA INSTITUCIÓN CASI UN AÑO, ESTA CLIENTE FUE RECOMENDADA POR UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA EXCELENTE. NUNCA TUVO DÍAS DE ATRASO

loans.use: Increase stock of products sold in the store

loans.name: Eva Beatriz

texts.es:
Eva M. has worked in this sector (owner of bodega or small grocery store) for 16 years. Her husband is a driver. They have two small children. Eva has been an Emprender client since 2002, initially as recipient of a group loan. Later she took a break from the group before finally becoming an individual borrower. Currently she is in the ninth sequence and has made her payments in good faith.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La sra, Eva M. trabaja en esa actividad hace 16 años, el esposo es transportista, tiene dos hijos pequeños, ella es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2002, con grupo solidario, luego descanso algun tiempo para retornar con crédito individual, actualmente se encuentra en la 9a. secuencia, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase groceries in bulk to stock her business

loans.name: Ana Bertha's Group

texts.es: Hola Mi nombre es Ana H.  tengo 30 años de edad, estoy casada y tengo 3 hijos los cuales estan en la escuela primaria. soy comerciante, vivo en esta comunidad hace 8 años y hace 6 años me dedico a la venta de productos para la agricultura como ser agroquimicos, tengo mi negocio en mi casa de habitacion esto me ayuda mucho ya que no pago ningun alquiler por vender mi producto, actualmente estoy solicitando apoyo monetario para poder surtir con mas productos mi negocio ya que las ventas son buenas pero las ganancias son pocas y teniendo mas productos mis ganancias aumentarias mucho mas, este producto tiene demanda aqui en nuestra comunidad y aldeas vecinas, mis hijos me colaboran en sus tiempos libres, yo me encuentro bien contenta con mi negocio ya que sin descuidar a mi familia puedo generar ingresos para la misma que es lo que mas me importa en mi vida.

loans.use: compra de Gramoxone, Paragua, Remansato, Xaprin.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.es: Hola mi nombre es Elizabeth R. H. tengo 29 años de edad, estoy casada y tengo dos hermosos hijos que actualmente estan en la escuela en 2do y 5to grado. , recido en esta comunidad hace unos 9 años. mi nogocio se encuentra en un lugar estrategico para la venta porque estoy muy cerca del centro de educacion basico de Danli, en este momento estoy solicitando ayuda para poder abastecerme de lo necesario para la elaboracion de pan y nacatamales, necesito el dinero para tener mayores ganancias y poder alimentar mi familia que es lo mas importante para mi.

loans.use: compra de carnes, verduras, maiz, leña, condimentos, harina, huevos y azucar

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Mrs. Marcelina sells bread in the area of Tejar, a peri-urban area of the city of La Paz. For many years she has lived with her husband and her children. This activity will allow her to help her husband with the household expenses. She is a punctual client in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA MARCELINA VEND. PAN EN LA ZONA EL TEJAR UNA ZONA PERIURBANA D. LA CIUDAD D. LA PAZ, HACE MUCHOS AÑOS, VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS HIJOS, ESTA ACTIVIDAD LE PERMITE AYUDAR AL ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, ES UNA CLIENTE PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS

loans.use: Purchase of baskets

loans.name: Rosa Idalia Del Carm's Group

texts.es: Hola mi nombre es Rosa Idalia del Carmen E., me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular cuanto con un pequeño negocio ubicado en mi casa de habitacion en el centro de la ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir con los compromisos  con los proveedores y cubrir con los gastos familiares, soy madre soltera, tengo un hijo que es lo mas preciado para mi, el esta cursando el plan basico en el Centro Basico Escolar de mi ciudad, actualmente necesito ayuda monetaria para surtir mi negocio y poder atender la demanda existente y tambien tener una mejor ganancia ya que la situacion en nuestro pais es dificil para nosotros los pobres.

loans.use: compra de granos basicos como ser arroz, frijoles, maiz,  azucar, manteca, aceite, sal, enbutidos, lacteos, jabon, pastas dentales.

loans.name: Arnoldo Javier

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega Arnoldo L. has a business selling used clothing which he sells in his own house. It's worth noting that he started off as a mobile vendor that had to work in all weather conditions, but as time has passed he has improved his economic situation.

The reason that he is requesting a loan via Ceprodel is for the purchase of a pack of clothes to sell. He is the father of one son that he has to take care of and provide the basic necessities that will allow him to have a proper childhood.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Arnoldo L. se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa usada comercializándolas en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitado por sus clientes. Es de interés destacar que desde que inició su negocio el vendía ambulantemente y a la intemperie pero a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo ha mejorado su condición económica.

El motivo por el cual solicita el crédito en Ceprodel es para la compra de una paca de ropa para comercializarla puesto que es padre de familia con un hijo que mantener y con el deber de proporcionarle todas las condiciones necesarias para que este se desarrolle.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell

loans.name: Jose Daniel's Group

texts.es: Hola mi nombre es Jose Daniel C. tnego 35 años de edad, estoy casado, tengo 3 hijos, me dedico a la venta de repuestos y reparaciones de bicicletas, tengo 4 años de dedicarme a este negocio, mi taller es el unico en esta zona ahi que tengo mucha clientela y como las bicicletas en nuestra cominudad son un medio de transporte para muchas personas ir a los colegios a los trabajos, entonces hay bastante demanda de repuestos para bicicletas, mis clientes me quieren mucho ya que les brindo una buena atencion y amabilidad. en la actualidad no cuento con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mi negocio y poder cumplir con toda la demanda que existe, por esa razon solicito ayuda a uds para poder salir adelante con mi pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Compra de cadenas, balineras, pedales, neumaticos, cables de breques, guadafangos, parrillas, monturas,

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan is 53 years old and lives in the Mirna Hugarti neighborhood. He is married, and has two children ages 12 and 16. His wife is a homemaker. Juan works at a company that provides security services, a job in which he has eight years of experience.

With the loan he is asking for, he would like to improve the infrastructure of his home by adding a porch roof to help repel water from entering into the house this winter. At the same time, he would like his family to live more comfortably. He hopes to be able to keep his job so that he can continue building his house until it is completed.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Juan tiene 53 años de edad, habita en el barrio Mirna Hugarti, es casado y le tienen dos hijos de 12 y 16 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Juan trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose en servicio de seguridad, tiene ocho años de experiencia. Con el préstamo que está solicitando mejorará la infraestructura de su hogar poniéndole techo al porche de su casa para así prevenir que el agua de este invierno se meta a su casa y al mismo tiempo poder estar más cómodo con su familia. Espera poder conservar su empleo para poder seguir construyendo su casa y poder terminarla.

loans.use: Add a roof to the porch of his house.

loans.name: Byron

texts.es:
Byron is a single 24-year old who lives in the Hialeah IV neighborhood in Managua. Byron dedicates himself to welding and is also a bricklayer, work that he has carried out for two years. His profession started when he was studying bricklaying, but thanks to the effort he put into his work he learned the welding trade.

His plan is to acquire enough experience to start working on his own. While he is single and still without the responsibility of a family, he wants to start making improvements to his house. This is the reason he is asking for a loan; he would like to purchase building materials and add a bedroom to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Byron es un joven de 24 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah IV etapa de Managua y es soltero. Byron se dedica a la soldadura y tambien es albañil, desde hace dos años ha realizado estas profesiones, su profesión la inició como ayudante de albañil, pero gracias al empeño que puso en su trabajo aprendió el oficio de soldador. Sus planes son poder adquirir la suficiente experiencia para poder realizar su trabajo de forma independiente. Ahora que está soltero y sin responsabilidades desea empezar a mejorar la construcción de su casa, es por eso que solicita el préstamo, para comprar materiales de construcción y hacer una habitación en su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase building materials to install a bedroom in his house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Miguel Angel's Group

texts.es: Hola mi nombre es Miguel Angel D., tengo 34 años de edad, estoy casado y tengo 3 hermosos hijos que los tengo estudiando en la escuela regional de nuestra ciudad, soy comerciante y tengo 3 años de vivir en esta ciudad y es el mismo tiempo que tengo de dedicarme a este negocio, hasta el momento me va muy bien ya que las personas aqui comen muchas verduras por lo saludables que son, mi clientela es especial ya que me tienen mucho aprecio por la forma en que los trato, tamabien viajo a varias colonias y aldeas para vender mi producto, sin embargo en estos momentos no cuento con capital para surtir mi negocio, tengo que vender mas para poder tener mayores ganancias y asi poder alimentar mi familia, y tambien para poder comprar combustible que este sumamente caro en nuestro pais.

loans.use: compra de repollo, tomates, papas, chile dulce, brocoli, cebollas, limones, patastes,

loans.name: Elena Esther

texts.es:
Elena is married and lives in the Hialeah district. She is 42 years old and has a 7-year-old daughter. Her husband works in security.

Elena has four years experience selling cocktails and refreshments. She has obtained much practice, especially in the preparation of cocktails. Her products are greatly enjoyed by neighbors and inhabitants of her district, and for this reason she has been able to maintain a successful business throughout the years.

Among her plans for growth, Elena would like to be able to extend her business to food sales. Part of the growth will also apply to home improvements. With the money she will buy construction materials to finish building a room in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Elena es casada, habita en el barrio Hialeah, tiene 42 años de edad, tiene una niña de 7 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad.

Doña Elena se dedica a la venta de cócteles y refrescos tiene cuatro años de experiencia, en los cuales ha adquirido mucha práctica sobre todo parala realización de los cócteles. Sus productos son muy gustados entre los vecinos de su barrio y es por eso que ha podido mantener su negocio a través de estos años.

Entre sus planes de crecimiento está el poder extender su negocio a la venta de comida. Parte de su crecimiento también lo aplicará en la mejora de su vivienda, con el dinero comprará materiales de construcción para terminar de construir una habitación en su vivenda.

loans.use: To acquire cement, beams, zinc sheets and sand to finish construction of a room

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra lives in the Lomas del Memorial Sandino neighbourhood of the city. She is 42 years old, married and has a nine year old daughter. Her husband works as a gardener in a private house to support the family. Sandra has also worked as a domestic servant for the last seven years. In addition, she sells ice cream and ice from home.

With this loan, Sandra is planning to build a separate room for her business, with the view to open a shop to sell refreshments, thus improving their home and educating their daughter.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Sandra tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino, es casada y tiene una niña de 9 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como jardinero en una casa particular y ayuda a los gastos del hogar. La Sra. Sandra trabaja como doméstica también en una casa particular y tiene siete años de estar laborando, también ella vende en su casa helados y hielo. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para construir un cuarto. A futuro es poner una refresquería, mejorar su vivienda y educar a su hija.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials to build a room

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen has been selling coffee and local drinks as a mobile vendor for 20 years in the city of Santa Tecla. She starts at 6:00AM in order to take advantage of the fact that everyone in the area walks to work. The improvements that she has made to the business have been thanks to her great effort and loans provided by Apoyo Integral over many years and with them she has been able to improve the living conditions her and her children.

She is now requesting a loan in order to finish building a retaining since there is a bunch of rubble on a nearby slope that is about come loose, which is causing a lot of insecurity and worry for her and her two children since they run the risk of becoming buried since the returning rain has contributed to the instability of the slope.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María del Carmen tiene 20 años de vender café y bebidas típicas de forma ambulante en la Ciudad de Santa Tecla, inicia la venta a las 6:00 AM , para aprovechar a toda la gente de la zona que se conduce a pie a sus lugares de trabajo. La mejoras que le ha realizado al negocio han sido gracias a su gran esfuerzo y a los préstamos que Apoyo Integral le ha brindado durante mucho tiempo y con ello a podido mejorarlas condiciones de vida, tanto de ella como de sus hijos. Hoy ella esta solicitando un préstamo para terminar de levantar un muro de contención, ya que hay un talud de tierra que esta muy próximo a desprenderse, generándole a ella y sus 2 hijos una gran inseguridad y preocupación, ya que corren peligro de quedar soterrados debido a que las lluvias que se han suscitado han contribuido más a la inestabilidad de dicho talúd.

loans.use: To build a retaining wall

loans.name: Humberto's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Humberto R., tengo 66 años de edad, estoy casado y tengo 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 estan casados, toda via 1 depende de mi, este se encuentra cursando la escuela, Resido en esta ciudad desde hace 4 años y tengo 2 de dedicarme a la venta de productos de consumo popular, el cual me genera ganancias para sustentar mi familia, en este momento no cuento con suficiente capital para surtir mi negocio y la demanda es mucha, por lo que necesito su apoyo monetario para poder salir adelante con mi negocio que es lo unico que tengo para poder generar dinero ya que por mi edad ninguna empresa me contrata para trabajar.

loans.use: compra de manteca, azucar, dulces, carnes, embutidos, arroz, jabon y refrescos.

loans.name: Henry Ramón

texts.es:
Henry is 27 years old, single and lives in the Batahola Norte neighbourhood of the city. He works as a customs officer. He also has a small business making and selling mirrors and decorative pictures and paintings.

Henry had to save for several years before being able to start his small business. He is hoping that the business will continue to grow and at some point in the future he would be able to concentrate solely on running his business.

The loan is for the purchase of raw materials for the production of new designs for his mirrors, paintings, and pictures. This would enable him to increase his sales revenue by expanding into additional market segments and appealing to a wider customer base.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Henry tiene 27 años de edad, habita en el barrio Batahola Norte, es soltero. Henry trabaja como Gestor Aduanero y tambien tiene una microempresa que consiste en la elaboración y comercialización de espejos y cuadros decorados. Dicho negocio lo pudo empezar producto del ahorro que por varios años hizo. Espera poder seguir creciendo en este negocio para en un futuro dedicarse de lleno a la administración delmismo. El dinero solicitado es para la adquisición de materia prima para la elaboración de espejos y cuadros para así poder incrementar el volumen de ventas a través de adquisición de nuevos segmentos de mercado, ofreciendo nuevos diseños que sastifagan los gustos del cliente.

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials for making decorative mirrors and pictures

loans.name: Celmith

texts.es:
Celmith S. S. works every day selling treats like popcorn, fried chips made from a variety of plantains, candied nuts, and other snacks as well as soft drinks of all kinds on a street corner near the sports fields of Club Chacarita.

Celmith is happy to be a member of the Manuela Ramos group and, thanks to the financing it provides, she was able to start her own business to generate her own income to pay for household expenses and better her family’s economic situation. With this loan of 1000 Nuevo Sol ($350), which she will repay in four months, she will purchase nuts and popcorn by the kilo, plantains by the bunch, soft drinks by the dozen, sugar for preparing the nuts. This way she will be well stocked with the necessary elements to prepare her snacks and satisfy her customers.

Celmith is 40 years old and relies on the help of her eldest son with her business. She is a mature and content person who has made good investments in her business. She wishes to continue working in order to increase her business and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Celmith S. S., socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “28 DE JULIO”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica de manera diaria a la venta de golosinas como: palomitas de maíz, chifles de diversos variedades de plátanos, así como maní confitado y saladito, además bebidas gasificadas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, todo esto en una de las esquinas de la cancha deportiva del Club Chacarita de Tarapoto, ella vive en el Jr. 28 de Julio No 110. La señora Celmith se siente contenta de pertenecer al Grupo de Manuela Ramos, y que gracias al financiamiento que le brindan, decidió invertir para implementar su propio negocio para poder generar sus propios ingresos, poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y mejorar su economía familiar. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 que será devuelto en 4 meses, ella comprará, maní en kilos, plátanos en racimos, maíz canchita en kilos, gaseosas en docenas, azúcar para preparar el confitado de maní, de esa manera implementar, y contar con los elementos necesarios para preparar sus golosinas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Celmith tiene 40 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo mayor, ella se siente una persona realizada, cuenta también, que tiene buenos ingresos y que no le va nada mal, tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando para crecer en el negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of nuts, plantains, corn and soft drinks.

loans.name: Norma Suyapa's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Norma Suyapa G.  tengo 29 años de edad, tengo una niña que esta cursando la primaria, mi actividad principal es la elaboracion de chicharras de cerdo, tengo 5 años de dedicarme a este negocio y tambien cuando termino la jornada de venta de chicharras, me pongo a costurar y hago blusas y faldas para damas lo cual me genera mas ingresos para mantener mi hogar y mi hija, actualmente la demanda a crecido y no cuento con el capital suficiante para satisfacer a mis clientes, ya que ahora en nuestra ciudad se juegan partidos de futbol, y la venta de las chicharras son buenas en estos tipos de eventos, es por lo que estoy solicitando su apoyo monetario para poder salir adelante con mis metas.

loans.use: compra de lonja de cerdo, leña, sal, manteca, bolsas, chile.

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Antonia del Carmen V. tengo 60 años de edad,  mi actividad principal es la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio, el cual es muy bueno ya que la tortilla es un alimento fundamental en la comida de nuestras comunidades,  esta actividad me genera ingresos para cumplir con los compromisos adquiridos y colaborar con los gastos de mi hogar ya que en mi hogar solo somos mi esposo y yo, y con nuestras edades es dificil conseguir trabajo fijo, necesitamos de su apoyo para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: compra de harina de maiz, leña y cal.

loans.name: Cinthia Lali

texts.es:
Cinthia Lali T. R. runs a profitable business selling handcrafted items in “El Centro,” a well known shopping center in the Tarapoto, in the District of San Martín. Cinthia is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Inmaculada” and started her business selling crocheted string bags handcrafted by her mother. When she realized that this was a good business venture, she began to add items little by little and she now sells wide variety of goods including those you see in the photo. There is a great demand for these items from tourists who come to her stall looking for handcrafted items. She now brings in items from other locations, which insures that she is selling unique handicrafts. This is how Cinthia maintains and increases the number of customers she attracts.

With this loan of 800 Nuevo Sol ($275), which she will pay off in six months, Cinthia will purchase many colors of string and different types of fabric (which she uses to make into beautiful bags). She will also buy fabric from the indigenous Shipiba tribe which is available in Iquitos. All of this will enable her to have a good selection of unique items for her customers. At her young age, Cinthia is already a determined businesswoman who wants to continue expanding her business. She is 24 years old and has a new born daughter who is her inspiration to continue to improve her situation. With entrepreneurial vision, she hopes to have her own shop and become more independent. Thanks to the support of her husband she is able to improve their lives with this business; she has no plans to stop until she realizes her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Cinthia Lali T. R., es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de Artesanías, ella vende en un Centro Comercial muy conocido con el nombre “El Centro” ubicado en el Jr. Moyabamba del distrito de San Martín, ya que este es un buen negocio rentable. Cinthia, se inició vendiendo bolsos de hilos que su mamá los confeccionaba donde ella se dió cuenta que era un buen negocio, y fue implementando poco a poco hasta obtener lo que tiene ahora, ella tiene una buena demanda por parte de los turistas, que llegan a su puesto buscando artesanías, ya que ella trae novedades de otros lugares y se cerciora que no se repita el Stok de los otros puestos, así es como ella mantiene e incrementa el numero de su clientes,. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que será pagado en 6 cuotas mensuales, comprará: hilos de colores, telas de diferentes tipos para la elaboración de sus bolsos que ella misma los confecciona y que después serán vendidos, además comprará telas Shipiba y que no hay acá, si no en Iquitos donde abunda bastante este material, y que la gente aledaña consume, de esa manera busca tener bien surtido su negocio y así sus clientes encuentren de todo. A su corta edad ya es una mujer empresaria, decidida y con ganas de seguir trabajando ella tiene 24 años de edad y 1 hija recién nacida, quien es el estímulo para seguir trabajando y superándose cada vez mas, con visión empresarial piensa tener un local propio e independizarse en su negocio, gracias al apoyo de su pareja, ella esta saliendo adelante y no piensa darse por vencida hasta lograr sus objetivos trazado

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fabric and string for handicrafts

loans.name: Erika Yulissa

texts.es:
Erika Yulissa S. S. sells food, particularly grilled meats, at a small stand in Tarapoto, in the district of San Martín. Things are going well for her and she has a good base of customers – this is attributable to her courtesy and the cleanliness of her operation. Erika came from Trujillo with her sister to the city of Tarapoto, the largest city in the department of San Martin, looking for a better life. She fell in love with this part of the country and decided to stay. Her career as a businesswoman started then, when she decided to open a small stand selling meals such as beef kabobs, roasted chicken, juanés (similar to a tamale, but made with rice, spices and meat), chicken soup, fried pork rinds, plantains and many other dishes from the region. You can find Cinthia at her stand in the Alameda Marina Aguilar from the afternoon until midnight.

With this loan of 1000 Nuevo Sol ($350), which she will repay in four months, she will purchase supplies needed for the preparation of her food such as rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of oil, and large quantities of condiments in addition to daily purchases of beef, chicken, pork and fish which allows her to prepare many different dishes from the region to satisfy the tastes of her customers. Erika is a young woman of 33 with three children. She wants to provide them a better future and a good education. She has a goal of having her own store front for her business. She is a mature, responsible person who strongly desires to continue working to achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La Señora Erika Yulissa S. S. pertenece al Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto ” 28 de Julio”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas y asados a la parrilla, le va muy bien por lo que su clientela es bastante y fluida, sus ventas están aseguradas por el buen trato y la higiene de su negocio Erika, nos cuenta que vino con su hermana desde Trujillo, y que también forma parte del grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto, vino buscando un mejor futuro, donde se enamoro de esta tierra y terminó quedándose, desde allí empieza su historia como empresaria se propuso en poner un pequeño puesto de venta de diferentes platos de comidas como, anticuchos de carne de pollo asados al carbón, juanés, caldo de gallina, chicharrón de chancho, tacacho, y muchos platos típicos mas de la región, a ella le pueden encontrar vendiendo en la Alameda Marina Aguilar del distrito de Tarapoto partir de horas de la tarde hasta la media noche. Con el crédito de S/ 1000.00 que devolverá en un plazo de 4 meses, comprará insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como: arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en galones, condimentos en grandes cantidades, además sus compras diarias de carnes de res, pollo, cerdo y pescado también en kilos que le permite preparar los diferentes platos de la región para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes. Erika es una mujer joven de 33 años con 3 hijos a quienes, quiere darles un mejor futuro y una buena educación, ella tiene como meta tener un local propio para la instalación de su negocio hoy se muestra un mujer realizada y con ganas de seguir trabajando para lograr lo que se propone.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale food items

loans.name: Juana Francisca's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Juana Francisca V. tengo 42 años de edad, tengo 2 hijos y estoy casada, soy comerciante y resido en esta comunidad hace 30 años, tengo muy buena clientela ya que los atiendo personalmente y los precios que vendo mis productos son accesibles para toda la comunidad, en estos momentos no cuento con suficiente capital para invertirlo en mi negocio por tal razon estoy pidiendo su apoyo o ayuda para poder surtir mi negocio y asi tener mayores ventas, mis hijos estan en la escuela y necesito dinero para poder apoyarlos en todo lo que les piden en la escuela, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo pero como la situacion en nuestro pais es cada vez mas peor a todos nos cuesta hacer un poco de dinero para alimentarnos,  mis hijos me ayudan a atender mi negocio cuando regresan de la escuela.

loans.use: compra de manteca, jabon, papel higienico, huevos, arroz, frijoles, pan, azucar, salsa de tomates, pastas, canela, candelas

loans.name: Flor Marleni

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor Marleni F. M. is a member of the interim credit group "Las Flores de María" (Mary's Flowers), and lives in San Martín in the Morales district. She dedicates herself to selling eggs, and also runs a business selling goods that her customers request, like detergent, bleach, toilet paper, ground coffee and charcoal. She runs her store out of her home in the San Martín neighborhood. Her daily customers are also her neighbors from the area.

She told us that she began selling undergarments, but due to her lack of experience, it didn't go very well. As she is optimistic and persevering, though, she decided to change her business, thanks to her mother's push, encouraging her to try something new, as well as her need to generate some income to cover the household expenses and her children's education. She saw that her neighborhood lacked general stores, and since she didn't have a better plan, she started up her business and began to run it a little at a time.

With this loan for $275 that will be repaid in four monthly payments, she will buy cartons of eggs and other products that she needs, including bleach, detergent, toilet paper, charcoal, and whole bean coffee to roast and grind which will then be sold to her customers. This product in particular sells well since most vendors sell ground coffee that's been prepared chemically and put in envelopes.

She is 27 years old and has three children, who are her inspiration to keep moving forward and to fight for her goals. She demonstrates assuredness and self-confidence as her customer base continues to increase, and by taking to heart their suggestions she is able to expand her business little by little as its manager. One of her goals for the near future is to expand and stock her store such that her customers are able to find everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Flor Marleni F. M., es socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las Flores de Maria” vive en la Región San Martín, provincia San Martín, distrito de Morales, se dedica a la venta de huevos, además implementa su negocio con productos que le piden sus clientes como detergentes, lejía, papel higiénico, café molido y carbón, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su propia casa del Jr. Sucre Nº 61 Barrio San Martín del mismo distrito, sus clientes que diariamente acuden a comprar son los vecinos de su barrio. Ella manifestó que se inicio vendiendo ropa interior pero por la falta de experiencia no le fue muy bien, y como ella es una persona optimista y perseverante decidió cambiar de negocio, gracias a la iniciativa de su mamá quien la motivo a probar de nuevo, además tenia la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de su familia y de la educación de sus menores hijos. Ella vio que en su barrio no hay muchas bodegas no tuvo mejor idea que empezar su negocio de esta manera y que poco a poco esta implementando. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que pagará en 4 cuotas mensuales, comprará huevos en casilleros, y demás productos que vende como: lejía, detergente en cajas, papel higiénico, carbón, café en granos para tostar y moler, luego ser vendidos a sus clientes, por que este, es un producto que tiene buena salida, en vista que la mayoría de negociantes lo venden en sobres y preparados químicamente. Tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, quienes la motivan a seguir adelante y luchando por sus metas y objetivos, ella demuestra tener mucha seguridad y confianza en si misma por que sus clientes va en aumento y de acuerdo a las sugerencias de ellos va implementando poco a poco su negocio, pues ella es quien la maneja, una de sus metas en un futuro cercano es ampliar y surtir su negocio, para que sus clientes encuentren todo lo que necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase eggs wholesale. Buy various cleaning products.

loans.name: Alba Luz's Group

texts.es: hola mi nomnre es Alba Luz V. tengo 35 años de edad, tengo 2 hijos a los cuales quiero mucho, estoy casada, mi actividad principal es la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo 5 años en la experiencia del manejo y administracion de mi negocio, el cual a crecido en los ultimos 2 años y la demanda es bastante y no tengo capital para invertir en productos, por tal razon estoy solicitaqndo ayuda monetaria para poder cumplir con todas las necesidades de mis clientes.

loans.use: compra de carnes, lacteos, refrescos, manteca, aceite, sal, azucar, jabon, embutidos, churros, papel higienico, salsas, chiles, desinfectantes

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Mrs. Milena T. P. is a member of the interim credit group "Alisson", and lives in San Martín in the district of Tarapoto. She dedicates herself to selling various types and flavors of cakes for all occasions, such as weddings, quinceaños (Sweet Fifteen parties), birthdays, as so on, as well as selling sweetbreads and taking orders.

When she first started, "I was a little nervous about my lack of experience and knowledge in this kind of business, and was especially afraid to lose the money I had invested if no one bought what I had made, since this product expires quickly. But as the days went by, I perfected my technique and got to know my customers, who grew little by little thanks to the people who bought from me. As it's a good product, they recommended me to their friends for when they needed this type of product. " With this credit for $450, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the ingredients she needs to make her cakes, such as sacks of sugar, packets of enriched flour, cases of eggs, packages of butter, boxes of milk and food coloring for the frosting, as well as other ingredients and accessories needed for cakes and sweetbreads.

She is 38 years old and has 2 daughters. She is a woman with a lot of vision for the future and a lot of self-assuredness that she can overcome any obstacle. She hopes to plan and create a modern environment with all the necessities for selling her cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Milena T. P., es socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Alisson” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la preparación y venta de diferentes tipos y variedades de tortas, para todo tipo de ocasiones como matrimonios, quinceaños, cumpleaños, etc, así como también de biscochuelos, atiende pedidos. Al principio cuando se inicio, sentía un poco de inseguridad por la falta de experiencia y conocimiento en este tipo de negocio, sobre todo por el temor a perder su capital al no vender lo preparado ya que este producto es de rápido consumo, pero con el transcurrir de los días fui perfeccionando mi técnica y conociendo a mis clientes, que poco a poco fue aumentando, gracias a las personas que me compraban, como mi producto es bueno me recomiendan con sus amigos, cuando requieren de este tipo de producto. Con el crédito de S/. 1300.00 que lo pagará en 6 meses, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de sus tortas como: azúcar en sacos, harina preparada en paquetes, huevos en jabas, mantequilla en paquetes, leches en cajas y colorantes para el decorado de las tortas, y demás ingredientes y accesorios para la preparación de las tortas y biscochuelos. Ella tiene 38 años y 2 hijas, es una mujer con mucha visión de futuro, y segura de si misma que puede vencer cualquier obstáculo, por lo que piensa implementar un ambiente moderno con todo lo necesario para la venta de sus tortas.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale ingredients for making cakes and sweetbreads

loans.name: Julia Arlita

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia Arlita S. S. belongs to the interim credit group "28 de Julio" (July 28th), and lives in San Martín in the Tarapoto district. She dedicates herself to selling typical foods of the area and grilled meats. She earns her living at a sales stand in the Marina Aguilar Avenue in the same city. Her customers are residents of the community and visitors from nearby areas, as this street is very well known and traveled.

She is originally from the city of Trujillo, but currently lives in the city, performing this enjoyable role. She sells grilled chicken, beef, and pork, and also prepares typical dishes of the area such as dried meat with potato rolls, and various dishes wrapped in steamed banana leaves called juanes. Thanks to the loan she received, she is able to expand her business, and she is content.

With this loan for $350, which will be returned after 4 months, she will buy necessary ingredients to prepare her various typical dishes, such as rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of oil, condiments, and so on. She will also buy meats such as beef, chicken, and cubed pork daily so she can prepare a variety of meals to the delight of her customers and others who visit her.

Julia is a happy and enthusiastic woman of 28 years. She is already a succesful woman, and has dreams of getting ahead to forge herself a better future so she can provide her young children with a better education, and like every woman, she dreams of having her own store so her business can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Julia Arlita S. S., pertenece al Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto ”28 de Julio”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica al la venta de comida típicas de la región y carnes a la parrilla, su negocio lo realiza en su puesto de ventas ubicado en la Alameda Marina Aguilar en esta misma Ciudad, sus clientes son moradores de la propia localidad y visitantes de lugares cercanos, en vista de que esta alameda es muy conocida y concurrida. Ella es natural de la Ciudad de Trujillo, pero actualmente vive en esta ciudad, desempeñándose en esta actividad que le agrada mucho, vende asados de pollo, carne de res y cerdo, además de preparar conocidos platos típicos de la región como la cecina con tacacho, juanes, ninajuanes, avispajuanes, etc. gracias al apoyo del préstamo que le brindaron ahora ella incrementó su negocio y se siente contenta. Con el crédito de S/ 1000.00 que lo devolverá en un plazo de 4 meses, con lo que comprará insumos necesarios para la preparación de los variados platos típicos que ella misma lo prepara como, arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en galones, condimentos, etc, además compra todos los días, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo en kilos, que le permitirá preparar las diversas comidas para el deleite de sus clientes y personas que la visitan.
