Julia es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con sus 28 años, ya es una mujer triunfadora y con ganas de seguir adelante quiere forjarse un futuro mejor para ofrecerles una mejor educación a sus menores hijos y como toda mujer sueña contar con un local propio para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale ingredients for her food sales

loans.name: Belkin Anabel's Group

texts.es: mi nombre es Belkin R. tengo 22 años de edad, tengo un hijo y soy madre soltera, me dedico a la venta de productos de comsumo popular, tengo 3 años dedicandome a esta actividad, a mis clientes les brindo una atencion especial en un ambiente agradable, trato de mantener todo tipo de mercaderia, en la actualidad no cuento con el capital necesario para poder surtir mi negocio, por eso les pido ayuda monetaria para poder sacar adelante mi negocio y poder alimentar mi hijo.

loans.use: compra de arroz, frijoles, azucar, cafe, pan, manteca, margarina, mantequilla, embutidos, lacteos, frescos, papel higienico, pasta dental, especias, sal, tortillas, harina de trigo y maiz, pollo, huevos,

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa R. I., a member of the interim credit group "Las Flores de María" (Mary's Flowers) lives in San Martín in the district of Tarapoto. She dedicates herself to selling basic groceries and other food products. Her grocery is locaed in her own home in the Partido Alto neighborhood. Thanks to the support of her family and the loan received from the Manuela Ramos movement, she was able to stock her store more and better. She has a large clientele thanks to her charisma and the quality of her products.

With this loan for $275, which will be returned in 4 months, she will buy bags of detergent of various brands and sizes, boxes of seafood, sacks of rice and sugar, liters of oil in various brands and sizes, boxes of milk in different brands and sizes, carbonated beverages of all flavors and so on so she can meet the needs of her customers. She knows that a well-stocked business guarantees loyalty and satisfaction of customers.

She is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband supports her, and she feels happy and fulfilled, very sure of herself. One of her projects to to expand her house to get her Minimarket, since she does not have much competition in the area where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa R. I., socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “LAS FLORES DE MARIA”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario, su bodega está ubicado en su propia casa, sito en el Jr. Capirona Nº 132 barrio Partido Alto. Gracias al apoyo de su familia y del préstamo recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos logró implementar mas y mejor su negocio, tiene una gran cantidad de clientela por el carisma que tiene y además por la calidad de sus productos.. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que será devuelto en 4 meses, comprará detergente en bolsas de distintas marcas y tamaños, conservas de pescado en cajas, azúcar en sacos, arroz en sacos, aceite en litros de distintos marcas y tamaños, lecha en cajas y de diferentes marcas y tamaños, también bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas, tamaños y sabores, etc, para atender las necesidades de sus clientes, por que ella sabe que un negocio bien surtido nos garantiza la fidelidad y satisfacción de nuestros clientes. Ella es casada, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, su esposo es quien la apoya, se siente feliz y realizada, muy segura de si misma, uno de sus proyectos es ampliar su casa para llegar a tener su Minimarket , en vista de que no tiene muchas competencia en la zona donde vive.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale general store merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa Q. G. is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras" (Fighting Women) and she lives in the San Martín region of the San Martín province in Tarapoto. She dedicates herself to what she loves to do: cooking. She sells food and typical dishes of the region such as juanes, chicken soup, etc. She waits on her customers at a sales stand in Market #3 in the Huayco neighborhood.

She began with a little cart selling juanes, a typical food of the region and chicken soup, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and friends. She is a hard-working, optimistic and persevering woman, who never stops until she reaches her goal. She set herself toward acquiring a food stand in the market so she could rest a little from her walks, continue to earn money, and provide her children with a good education.

With this loan for $525, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy ingredients such as sacks of rice, pounds of chicken, gallons of oil, and cartons of eggs that she needs to create the various plates of food that she offers to her customers everyday. She will also purchase bundles of wood as that is an important element for cooking her meals and gives an original flavor to her dishes. Additionally, she will buy utensils such as pots, ladles, spoons, bowls that she needs to serve her customers.

Teresa is 57 years old. She is a decided woman, enthusiastic, and with a humility that demonstrates her desire to get ahead by having a business out of her own home. Teresa considers herself a fighting woman because she does not rest until she achieves her planned objectives to live an old age free of worry and care.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teresa Q. G., es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, ella se dedica a lo que le encanta hacer que es cocinar, por eso ella vende comida, y platos típicos de la región como juanes, caldo de gallina, etc., ella espera a sus clientes en su puesto de venta en el mercado No 03 del barrio Huayco. Ella se inició con una carretilla vendiendo juanes (plato típico de la zona), caldo de gallina, ofreciendo de casa en casa a sus vecinos y amistades, ella es una mujer luchadora, optimista y perseverante, que no desmayó hasta conseguir sus metas, se propuso adquirir un puesto de venta de comida en el mercado, para descansar un poco de las caminatas, seguir generando sus ingresos y dar una buena educación a sus hijos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará ingredientes como arroz en sacos, gallinas en kilos, aceite en galones, huevos en casilleros, que le hacían falta para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su clientela, también comprará leña en tercios ,porque es un elemento principal para cocinar las comidas y que le dan un sabor original a sus platos, además comprará utensilios como: ollas, cucharones cucharas, platos hondos y tendidos, que le hacían falta para atender a sus clientes. Teresa tiene 57 años, es una mujer decidida, entusiasta, y con la humildad que demuestra quiere salir adelante que anhela tener un negocio en su propia casa. Teresa se considera una mujer luchadora por que no descansa hasta lograr sus objetivos trazados para tener una vejez tranquila y libre de preocupaciones.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and supplies for her food cart

loans.name: Maria Magdalena's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Maria C. mi actividad es la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo 2 años de dedicarme a esta actividad, tengo 52 años de edad estoy casada y tengo 2 hijos, tengo muy buena clientela ya que mi negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy transitada de nuestra ciudad y siempre que un cliente viene encuentra lo que busca, ya que tengo bien surtido mi negocio, vendo carnes y a la gente le gusta comprarme ya que es muy higienico mi producto, en la actualidad deseo surtir mi negocio con nuevos productos pero no tengo el capital suficiente por eso estoy solicitando un prestamo monetario para poder equipar mejor mi negocio,

loans.use: compra de harina, lacteos, carnes, granos basicos, refrescos, manteca, aceite, jabon, sopas instantaneas, pan, cafe, confites, churros, galletas, cloro, cereales, huevos, culey.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz M. R. is an enthusiastic member of the communal bank “El Triunfo” who sells cosmetics such as Oriflame, Unique, Eskia, and Avon. She got started in this business thanks to a friend who saw that she was a friendly woman and suggested that she put this to good use to earn an income and help with the household expenses and education of her children. Little by little she has increased her number of customers, initially going door to door. These days she has set clients from whom she takes orders.

With this loan of 2000 Nuevo Sol ($700 USD), which she will repay in six months, Beatriz will increase her stock of beauty supplies, as they sell well and are not perishable. Also she will be able to take advantage of sales with each supplier to stock up on cologne, creams, shampoo, powders and other beauty supplies. Beatriz is a happy woman who is simple and enthusiastic; she dreams of living a long life surrounded by her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Beatriz M. R., es una entusiasta socia del Banco. Comunal “El Triunfo” vive en la región de San Martín provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como ORIFLAME, UNIQUE, ESIKA, AVON. La Señora Beatriz se inicia gracias a la idea de una amiga quien viendo que es una mujer amigable, le propuso este negocio, para generar sus ingresos y apoyar en los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos es así poco poco fue ganando su clientela, al comienzo empezó ofreciendo casa por casa, actualmente ya tiene cliente fijos y conocidos trabaja con pedidos. Con el crédito de S/. 2 000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, implementará su stok en artículos de belleza, porque son productos tienen buena salida y no son perecibles, aprovechando sobre todo las ofertas de las empresas con quienes trabaja, para comprar colonias, cremas, champus, talcos y otros productos de belleza. Beatriz es una mujer alegre, sencilla y entusiasta, sueña con tener una vejez tranquila rodeada de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of Beauty Supplies

loans.name: Yuberli

texts.es:
Yuberli B. I. belongs to the “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Picota, her activity is to provide telephone services through her “locutorio” (a phone shop where people can make phone calls at cheap rates) which is located in La Marginal Avenue.

Thanks to the loan received she was able to install a phone booth. She is new in this type of activity and hopes to achieve her goals.

With the new loan of $275 USD (S/.800), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy phone cards of different brands and amounts, some of which are reloadable and can be used on cell phones such as movistar and claro. Yuberli is 24 years old, she is a single mom, has one daughter who is her reason to keep fighting and working, Yuberli wants to give her a good education, one of her goals is to install more phone booths and sell cell phone accessories. Currently, she has a large number of customers thanks to the great service she provides.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Yuberli B. I. pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia Picota y distrito de Picota, su actividad es brindar servicio de telefonía en su Locutorio que esta ubicado en Av. La Marginal S/n.

Gracias al préstamo recibido logró instalar una cabina telefónica, es nueva en esta tipo de actividad y espera cumplir con sus objetivos.

Con el reciente crédito de S/. 800.00, el cual será devuelto en un plazo 6 meses, comprará tarjetas telefónicas de diferentes marcas y cantidades, también tarjetas de recarga virtual de distintas cantidades y tipos de celulares como movistar y claro.

Yuberli tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, quien es la razón para seguir luchando y trabajando pues quiere darle una buena educación, una de sus metas es implementar mas cabinas telefónicas, además complementar con la venta de repuestos de celulares, actualmente tiene una gran cantidad de clientes gracias a su buen trato.

loans.use: Purchase prepaid phone cards

loans.name: Olga Cristina

texts.es:
Olga is 41 years old, married, and has two sons, who are 11 and 14 years old. They live in the Laureles Norte neighbourhood of the city.

Olga and her husband both work to support their family. He is a bricklayer and she has been running a small general store from a room in their house for the last eight years, which she started using the money she had saved. Her business shows steady growth and she hopes that by working hard she will be able to grow it further.

Her current plan, however, is to secure her home and shop by building a wall for the front room, where the shop is located.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Olga habita en el barrio Laureles Norte en donde tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 14 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y ambos aportan para el sustento del hogar. Doña Olga tiene 8 años de tener esta pulpería, y durante todos estos años ha podido crecer mucho, ya que cuando empezó no vendía lo que vende actualmente. Esta pequeña pulpería la pudo montar gracias a unos ahorros que ella tenía. Y planea seguir trabajando duramente para que el negocio pueda salir adelante y crecer económicamente. Pero por el momento sus planes son darle seguridad a su casa y al negocio, necesita construir un muro frontal para su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Building of a wall in front of her house and shop

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es:
Oscar is a 62 year old man with two children, who are 20 and 26 years old and live independently. But he always tries to help them in any way he can.

Oscar and his wife live in Laureles Sur neighbourhood of the city. He is a topographer and a painter and his wife runs a small general store from their home. They require this loan to secure their home and shop by building a wall for the front room, where the shop is located.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Don Oscar es un señor de 62 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 26 años que ya son independientes a él, pero Don Oscar siempre está haciendo lo posible para ayudarles. Don Oscar habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y su esposa es una pequeña comerciante que posee una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Don Oscar trabaja como topógrafo y también es pintor. Está solicitando el préstamo para construir un muro delantero en su casa de habitación, para así poder darle seguridad al pequeño negocio de su esposa y a su casa también.

loans.use: To build a wall in front of the house and the shop

loans.name: Mayra Indira's Group

texts.es: mi nombre es Mayra E. soy comerciante tengo 4 años de dedicarme a estactividad, tengo una niña y estoy casada, mi esposo me ayuda a con los gastos de la casa y tratamos de salir adelante con nuestro hogar, en estos momentos estoy necesitando un prestamo monetario parar poder comprar mas mercaderia ya que no me doy abasto con las necesidades de mis clientes,

loans.use: comprar blusas, zapatos, jeans, pantaloles, camisas para dama y caballero

loans.name: Nelsa Leticia's Group

texts.es: mi nombre es Nelsa P., soy comerciante y tengo 3 años de estar en esta actividad, tengo 3 hijas de las cuales dos ya estan graduadas del colegio y solo una depende de mi, mis clientes son excelentes ya que les gusta mi producto por el precio y la calidad por su puesto, en estos momentos tan dificiles es necesario vender productos a precios bajos para que los clientes los puedan comprar, cuando termino de vender en las mañanas y parte de la tarde mi producto me dirijo a una cafeteria en la cual trabajo haciendo comida. necesito un prestamo para poder comprar mas mercaderia y tener mayores ganancias y con las ganancias poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: compra de pantalones de caballero y dama, ropa de niño, blusas y camisas.

loans.name: Grover Gerardo

texts.es:
Mr. Grover Gerado A. C. has a neighborhood store as his principal activity and he sells artisan products made of knit macrame as his secondary activity. The gentleman travels to Potosí and Sucre to sell his merchandise. He lives with his sister, he has worked for almost two years with the institution and he has never been overdue.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

EL SEÑOR GROVER GERARDO A. C. TIENE COMO ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL TIENDA DE BARRIO Y COMO ACTIVIDAD SECUNDARIA LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS ARTESANALES FABRICADOS EN TEJIDO MACRAMÉ, EL SEÑOR VIAJA A POTOSÍ Y SUCRE A VENDER SU MERCADERIA VIVE CON SU HERMANA, TRABAJA CASI DOS AÑOS CON LA INSTITUCIÓN Y NO TUVO DÍAS DE ATRASO.

loans.use: Half will be invested in the store and the other half in his second activity of making macrame

loans.name: Jhanneth Adelaida

texts.es:
Mrs. Jhanneth is an old client with a good history of payment. She is dedicated to selling pork and with this income she supports her spouse who is a driver. She has two children who are studying.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA JHANNETH ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA Y CON UN BUEN HISTORIAL DE PAGO, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE VENTA DE CARNE DE CERDO CON ESTOS INGRESOS AYUDA A SU ESPOSO QUE ES TRANSPORTISTA, TIENE DOS HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN ESTUDIANDO.

loans.use: Purchase of pork to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Laura Emperatriz's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Laura J. soy comerciante, vendo zapatos para dama y carteras, tengo 4 años de estar en esta actividad, mi producto lo vendo en diferentes lugares ya que tengo un ayudante que reparte mis zapatos y carteras a mis clientes, este negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi hogar y mi familia, pero tengo la necesidad de hacer un prestamo para poder comprar mas zapatos y carteras ya que las necesidades de mis clientes son bastantes, porque a la mayoria que les vendo mis zapatos son a clientes de oficinas.

loans.use: compra de zapatos para dama y carteras

loans.name: Celedonia's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Celedonia Q., a mi avanzada edad tengo que dedicarme a la venta de refrescos, churros, pan, ya que es muy dificil conseguir trabajo en las condiciones que me encuentro en este momento, ya que para la gente de la tercera edad es muy complicado que alguna empresa ya sea publica o privada lo empleen, tengo 3 años de tener mi negocio el cual me genera ingresos para sustentar mi hogar, tambien elaboro tortillas por las noches cuando cierro mi negocio y las mando a vender todas las mañanas aqui cerca de mi casa, en estos momentos ncesito un prestamo para poder mejorar mi negocio y quiero salir adelente con mi negocio que es lo unico que puedo hacer en estos tiempos dificiles.

loans.use: compra de refrescos, churros, pan, galletas.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora C. López operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Chimaltenando neighborhood market, which is about 18 km (11 miles) from where she lives.

She started her business 40 years ago: since she was a little girl she has sold fruits in the school where she studied. She has always enjoyed selling these products.

Teodora buys the fruits and vegetables in bulk and sells them in smaller quantities. She sells her fruits on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, which are the days of greatest sales in the market.

Teodora has had 12 children, some of whom no longer live with her. However, thanks to her business, Teodora has helped her children get ahead and provided for their education. She still supports some of her children and wants to help them get ahead, too.

Teodora’s husband also sells agricultural products during harvest times.

Teodora wants a loan to be able to sell more of the same products she sells now, in particular during harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Teodora C. López tiene su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, en el mercado del departamento de Chimaltenando, a 18 kilómetros de la localidad donde vive.

Este negocio lo inicio hace 40 años, desde muy niña se dedico a la venta de frutas en la escuela donde estudiaba, y siempre le gusto dedicarse a la venta de estos productos.

Ella compra las frutas y verduras por mayor, y las vende en unidades más pequeñas. Aprovecha a vender sus productos los días lunes, miércoles y viernes de cada semana, ya que son los días de principal venta en el mercado.

En total ha tenido 12 hijos, algunos ya no viven con ella, pero gracias a este negocio los ha sacado adelante y le ha dado la oportunidad de que tengan educación, todavía tiene hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, y los quiere sacar adelante.

Su esposo también se dedica a la venta de productos agrícolas aprovechando las temporadas de cosecha.

Ella quiere el préstamo para vender más productos de los que actualmente vende, y aprovechar las épocas de temporada de cosechas.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmen sells typical products of the high plains in the Andes such as pasankalla, a local popcorn with a sugar coating, toasted noodles , toasted rice, etc. She has two children who can study because of her work. Some time ago she purchased a small house in the city of El Alto. She is a hardworking woman and punctual in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA CARMEN VEND. PRODUCTOS TIPICOS DEL ALTIPLANO COMO SER LA PASANKALLA, FIDEO TOSTADO, ARROZ TOSTADO, ETC, LA SEÑORA TIENE DOS HIJO UNO CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD LSO HACE ESTUDIAR Y HACE ALGUN TIEMPO SE COMPRO UN CASITA EN LA CIUDAD D. EL ALTO, ES UNA MUJER MUY TRABAJADORA Y PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio P. has a business selling mobile telephones in the area.

He started his business two years ago with financial support from his parents.

Thanks to his business he has been able to continue his university studies. Despite his young age, José is a very enterprising person.

He started this business after identifying local demand for mobile phones and the need for people to travel to the next town to buy one.

Given constant changes in cell phone technology, José needs a loan to invest in acquiring more products.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El señor José Antonio P. tiene un negocio de venta de aparatos de teléfonos móviles en la localidad.

Su negocio lo inicio hace 2 años, con la ayuda económica de sus padres. Gracias a su negocio el ha podido continuar sus estudios universitarios, a pesar de ser muy joven, es una persona muy emprendedora.

El empezó este negocio aprovechando la necesidad de que las personas de adquirir teléfonos móviles, y muchas de ellas tenían que trasladarse a otras localidades para obtenerlos.

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en más productos, ya que este negocio requiere de mucha inversión, por los constantes cambios en la tecnología.

loans.use: Purchase of cellular telephones for sale

loans.name: Lucy Adriana

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucy has a store where she sells spare parts and accessories for automobiles. Her husband is a mechanic and together they worked hard to purchase the house in which they were former tenants. They have a son that is studying and she is punctual client with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA LUCY TIENE UNA TIENDA DOND. VEND. REPUESTOS Y ACCESORIOS PARA MOVILIDADES, SU ESPOSO ES MECANICO Y JUNTOS TRABAJARON MUCHO PARA COMPRARSE LA CASA EN DOND. ANTES ERAN INQUILINOS TIENEN UN HIJO AL QUE ESTAN HACIENDO ESTUDIAR ES UNA CLIENTE PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS.

loans.use: Increase in merchandise of automotive parts

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
Maria Raquel H. Vasquez, belongs to “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province of Picota, district of San Hilarion. She sells groceries as well as fish brought from the coast, very popular in the area.

She started in the business selling fish, which she continues to do, expanding her business with the sale of groceries, because in her neighborhood there is no other grocery store. With effort she hopes to achieve her goals.

With the $700 USD (S/.2,000) loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy products such as: rice, sacks of sugar, boxes of pasta, packages of salt, bags of toilet paper, packaged treats, boxes of sweet and salty cookies, boxes of soap, different brands of detergent, as well as fish like mackerel, shark, and others.

She is married, has 3 children, who push her to keep going and contribute with her husband to the home expenses and the studies of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Raquel H. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo” vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de Picota, distrito de San Hilarión se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, complementando con la venta de pescado traídos de la costa, que son muy vendidos en la zona.

Ella se inició en el negocio vendiendo pescado y que hasta ahora lo sigue haciendo, ampliando su negocio con la venta de abarrotes ya que por su barrio no existe uno, con su esfuerzo espera lograr alcanzar sus metas trazadas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 que pagará en 6 meses, comprará de productos como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en cajas, sal en paquetes, papel higiénico en bolsas, golosinas en paquetes, galletas en cajas entre dulces y saladas, jabones en cajas, detergentes de diferentes marcas, además compró pescados como caballa, toyo, entre otros.

Ella es casada, tiene 03 hijos, quienes la impulsan para seguir adelante y contribuir con su esposo en los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale groceries.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian K. P., belongs to “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province of Picota, district of San Hilarion. Her business is located in the Jr. Bolognesi market, she sells root vegetables and other vegetables.

Thanks to help from her aunt she started the business, with enthusiasm and effort it has slowly grown, she thanks the bank for helping her with the loan that allowed her to implement the business.

With the new loan of $700 USD (S/.2,000) which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase: sacks of potatoes, cucumbers by the hundreds, kilograms of cabbage, pumpkins by the hundreds, sacks of garlic, bananas and other vegetables that her clients need.

Miriam is very outgoing and joyful, she is 34 years old, lives with her husband, her two daughters who are the motor that make her keep going forward, she works with enthusiasm and care to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora, Mirian K. P., pertenece al banco comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en la región San Martín provincia de Picota, distrito de San Hilarión su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi - Mercado de abastos, se dedica a la venta de tubérculos y verduras.

Gracias al apoyo de su tía se inicia en el negocio, con entusiasmo y esfuerzo fue aumentando poco a poco, ella le da gracias al banco por haberle brindado el apoyo con un préstamo, que le permitió implementarlo.

Con el reciente crédito de S/.2000.00 el cual será pagado en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará : papas en sacos, pepinillo en cientos, repollo por kilos, zapallo por cientos, ajos en sacos, cebolla en sacos, plátanos en racimos y otras verduras que el cliente lo requiera.

La señora Mirian es muy comunicativa y alegre, tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas, que son el motor para seguir adelante, ella trabaja con entusiasmo y esmero para crecer en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.es: mi nombre es Saira C. me dedico a la venta y produccion de tortillas, tengo 4 años de dedicarme a esta actividad, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para salir adelante con nuestra familia, el trabaja de electricista,. en estos momentos necesitamos incrementar nuestras ventas, pero para eso necesitamos tener mayor produccion de tortillas, y por esa razon estamos solicitando un credito para poder incrementar nuestros inventarios.

loans.use: compra leña, cal, maiz,

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia C. S. belongs to “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province of Picota, district of San Hilarion. She sells local vegetables and fruits, her business is located in the Jr. Bolognesi market. Thanks to her niece's initiative she started this business and has now been doing this activity for 11 years, the business has grown and now she sells all types of local fruits and vegetables, she keeps her clientele thanks to her good service and competitive prices. With the new $450 USD (S/.1,300) loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy different vegetables like cabbage, potato, pumpkin, Chinese onion, garlic, celery and a variety of fruits such as papaya, orange, banana and other local fruits, as well as rice. She knows the business will be profitable if her inventory levels are high. Lidia is 41 years old, lives with her husband and her 4 children, who help daily around the house. They have learned that to achieve goals they must be united as a family.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lidia C. S. pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, ella se dedica a la venta verduras y frutas de la región, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi dentro del mercado de Abastos de la localidad. Gracias a la iniciativa de su sobrina se inició en este negocio, ya tiene 11 años en esta actividad, logrando incrementarlo, ahora vende todo tipo de frutas y verduras de la zona, por su buen trato y sus precios competitivos, mantiene su clientela. Con el reciente crédito de S/. 1,300.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará, diversas verduras como repollo, papas, zapallo, cebolla china, ajos, apio y variedad de frutas como papaya, naranja, plátano ceda y otras frutas de la zona complementando con la venta de arroz, sabe que el negocio es rentable si esta bien surtido. La señora Lidia tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes diariamente le apoyan en las tareas domesticas del hogar, enseñando que para cumplir las metas hay que estar unidos en la familia.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Iris Suyapa's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Iris A. me dedico a la venta de tacos de res y de pollo, tambien frabrico charamuscas y paletas de fruta, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para salir adelante con nuestro hogar, el se dedica a la carpinteria, pero tambien vende mercaderia, nuestras hijas estan en la escuela, tengp 5 años de dedicarme a esta actividad, pero en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder tener mas produccion y asi vender mas, para generar mayores ganancias, ya que la situacion esta muy dificil.

loans.use: compra de tortillas, carne, pollo, bolsas, paletas, salsas, chiles, verduras

loans.name: Estelbina Del Socorr

texts.es:
Estelbina del Socorro Sánchez is a hard-working woman that has a business selling food in the Central Market in the city of Chinandega. It was very difficult in the beginning because she only made a few dishes, but as time has passed the number has increased and she has managed to improve her situation.

Nowadays, she has steady clients that frequent her locale and thanks to them she has managed to achieve high sales and maintain her family, composed of her small son, for whom she has to be mother and father since she doesn't have a husband. For this reason, she has come to Ceprodel to request a necessary loan for the purchase of raw ingredients for the production of her platters to continue supporting her little son.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Estelbina del Socorro Sánchez es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque comenzó a elaborar pocos platillos pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo los fue aumentando hasta mejorar su situación.

Hoy en día posee clientes fijos que le visitan y gracias a estos ha logrado realizar altas ventas y así ha mantenido su núcleo familiar compuesto por su pequeño hijo que mantener ya que al no poseer esposo ella hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez. Por este motivo es que ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener el creidito necesario para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos para continuar con el mantenimiento de su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients for prepared dishes

loans.name: Sandro Group

texts.es:
The group of two people are working on new loans with an institution with whom they have a good history of payment; both have children and spouses. Mr. German is a mechanic and has an automobile which he uses at night as a taxi service. Mr. Angel sells accessories and spare automotive parts. He has a son that married very young and so he still supports him economically. Both members of the group are very enterprising people.

Translated from Spanish by H. Smith, Kiva volunteer.

EL GRUPO DE DOS PERSONAS TRABAJAN NUEVE CREDITOS CON LA INSTITUCION CON UN BUEN HISTORIAL DE PAGOS, AMBOS TIENEN HIJOS Y ESPOSAS, EL SEÑOR GERMAN ES MECANICO Y TIENE UN TRANSPORTE CON EL QUE EN LAS NOCHES TRABAJA COMO SERVICO DE TAXI, EL SEÑOR ANGEL VENDE ACCESORIO Y REPUESTOS PARA MOVILIDAD TIENE UN HIJO QUE SE CASO MUY JOVEN AL CUAL AYUDA ECONOMICAMENTE AUN, AMBOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON PERSONAS MUY EMPRENDEDORAS.

loans.use: One member will purchase car accessories and the other member will purchase tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Kati Escarleth

texts.es:
Katy B. works in the production and selling of delicious platters which she sells in the city of Chinandega, where is originally from. With a lot of effort, she has managed to improve the conditions of her business and she has dreams of becoming a great merchant in her food market.

She has come to Ceprodel to request a necessary loan for the purchase raw ingredients to prepare her platters. That's why she hopes that the loan will be provided since this business is her only means of support to maintain her household, which is composed of her and her two small children that she dearly loves.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Katy B. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosos platillos los cuales comercializa en la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio por lo que son sus sueños convertirse en una gran comerciante en su mercado de alimentos.

Actualmente ha buscado el apoyo de Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos. Por esta razón es que espera que el crédito será otorgado ya que al elaborar y vender los alimentos, este es el único sustento para mantener su hogar compuesto por ella y dos pequeños hijos a los que tanto ama.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for food products

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
In the zone of Huayna Potosí in the city of El Alto one finds, located in the center of Germán Buch, the "Kantutas" association which is made up of 10 members. It is a very nice group that gets together with its credit advisor, working very enthusiastically with Pro-Mujer to improve their businesses. The majority of the women have small children who do not have basic medical attention, that is to say, indispensable vaccines and medical checkups because of their lack of economic resources. This situation is very concerning for their parents and has brought them to look for greater income in their small businesses.

The activities that the Kantutas association does are informal, that is to say, the mobile sale of different products. For example, doña Carmen sells scarves and wool gloves, Señora Mari sells candies and chocolates. What is particular about this business are the sales that they make using little, special carts that they take along the distinct city streets. Now they would like to buy or rent fixed stands in the main markets to ensure sales. For this, they require more capital for their work. This way they will be able to generate greater income. This is all for the good of their families, principally to insure the health and well-being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

En la zona Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Germán Buch, a este pertenece la asociación “Kantutas” integrado por 10 socias. Un grupo muy simpático que junto a su asesora de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucho entusiasmo de mejorar en sus negocios. La mayoría de ellas tienen niños pequeños y estos no cuentan con atenciones médicas básicas, vale decir vacunas y valoraciones indispensables, esto por falta de recursos económicos. Esta situación es muy preocupante para sus padres lo que les lleva a buscar mayores ingresos en sus pequeños negocios.

Las actividades que realiza la asociación “Kantutas” están dentro el comercio informal, es decir venta de diferentes productos de manera ambulante, .por ejemplo doña Carmen vende bufandas y guantes de lana, la Señora Mari, vende golosinas y chocolates. Lo particular de este negocio es que la venta, la realizan en pequeños y particulares carritos con lo que recorren las distintas calles de la ciudad. Ahora quieren comprar o alquilar puestos fijos en los principales mercados para asegurar sus ventas por eso requieren mayor capital de trabajo.de esta forma poder generar mayores recursos, todo esto para el bien de sus familias, principalmente para asegurar la salud y bienestar de sus hijos.

loans.use: Capital to buy or rent fixed stands to make sales

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor is 38 years old, married, and has three children, who are 2, 9, and 14 years old. Her husband is a taxi driver and they live in the 3-80 neighbourhood of the city. They bought the taxi from their own savings and are responsible for its maintenance. Also, for the last twelve years, Flor has been selling handicrafts.

With this loan, they plan to buy building materials to build a new room in their house. In time, they also hope to trade in their taxi for a newer model to enable them to give their customers a better service.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Flor habita en el barrio 3-80, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 2, 9 y 14 años de edad, su esposo es taxista y el vehículo que usa lo compraron ambos con esfuerzo propio y es él quien se encarga de administrarlo. Doña Flor vende artesanía desde hace doce años y este negocio también lo iniciaron por cuenta propia. Con el préstamo quieren comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un nueva habitación. En un futuro esperan poder cambiar la unidad de taxi por una más nueva, para así poder dar mejor servicio de taxi.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials to construct a new room

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Carmen is 42 years old, married, and has a 10 year old son. They live in the La Fuente neighbourhood of the city.

She has a small cheese-making business, where her husband is also employed as a dairy technician. She has 28 years of experience in the industry and prior to starting her own business, she was involved in the training of small cheese-making businesses.

Carmen is a very enterprising woman. She started her business using her own capital and is always willing to train those involved in cheese-making as an additional source of income for their families. Her future plan is to put the business on a firmer footing and create a formal cheese production family business.

Carmen requires the loan to buy milk so that she can continue to supply the cheeses that her customers love so much.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la elaboración de quesos. Tiene 28 años de experiencia en la elaboración de quesos, anteriormente se desempeñaba brindando capacitaciones a pequeños productores, comenzó su negocio con capital propio. Es una mujer muy emprendedora, y siempre la están buscando para que brinde capacitaciones a los productores que también elaboran quesos artesanales. Los planes para un futuro es poder llegar a poner una empresa familiar de producción de queso. Carmen tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio la Fuente, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, su esposo es técnico en lácteos en el negocio familiar. Solicita el crédito para comprar leche y así seguir produciendo sus quesos tan gustados por sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of milk for making cheese

loans.name: Kanahuara Group

texts.es:
The Kanahuara association is comprised of 12 active members who work together with the Pro-Mujer family in the center of Germán Buch in the city of El Alto. The day starts very early for the Kanahuara association as they sell jackets at the "Early Risers" market. The market is called this because they are only allowed to sell from 5:00 a.m. until 10:00 a.m. Generally, they offer domestic merchandise, but now they want to acquire Chilean merchandise to increase their stock. For this reason they need more capital to make trips to Iquique (Chile) to buy their products. Their only aim is to increase their income to improve the way of life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación kanahuara esta formada por 12 miembros activos que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer en el centro focal de Germán Buch de la ciudad de El Alto. Muy temprano comienza el día para la asociación Kanahuara, ya que se dedican a la venta de chamarras en la feria de las mañaneras, llamada así porq solo les permiten vender desde las 5:00am hasta las 10:00am, por lo general ellas ofrecen mercadería nacional, ahora quieren adquirir mercadería chilena para ampliar su stok, por esto requieren mayor capital para realizar viajes a Iquique (Chile) y así poder comprar sus productos. La única finalidad de mejorar sus ganancias es la de mejorar la forma de vida para sus hijos.

loans.use: Capital to buy better merchandise

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota T. O. belongs to “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province of Picota, district of San Hilarion. She sells candy.

Her economic circumstances motivated her to look for business alternatives and she opted for selling candy, she visits high traffic areas, like the local schools, the main square, bus stops, etc. and it has given her good results.

With the $350 USD (S/.1,000) loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy boxes of cookies of different brands, boxes of chocolates, lollipops, bags of gum, and candies of different flavors to keep her inventory levels high.

Carlota is 48 years old, she is a persevering and responsible woman, wishing to get ahead and support her husband with the home expenses and the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carlota T. O., socia del Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria.

La necesidad económica por lo que estaba atravesando, la motivo a buscar alternativas de negocio y ella opto por la venta de golosinas, ella vende de manera ambulatoria recorriendo los lugares donde hay mayor concentración de personas como los colegios de la localidad, plaza de armas, paradero y ve que le esta dando buenos resultados.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 para pagarlo en 6 meses, comprará galletas en cajas de distintas marcas, chocolates en cajas, chupetines, chicles en bolsas y caramelos de diversos sabores para tener bien surtido su bazar.

Carlota tiene 48 años de edad, es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su casa y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale candy.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina is a young woman who is 24 years old and lives in the village of La Ceiba, in the Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan municipality of Sololá Province in Guatemala. With her contributions to the community she has gained respect for her small business in which she has been selling groceries for 10 years. As her father died when she was an infant, she and her mother continued ahead, passing through various trying times but alway managing to overcome them.

Being young and with positive thinking about growing the business she came to the ASDIR Association to request a loan of 7,080 quetzales, money that she will use to increase her business capital. She has quite a bit of customer demand since she is the only person that is selling products like hers in the area. This will enable her to increase her earnings and improve her living condition as well as help her two young brothers to finish their studies. She always has as a top priority satisfying her clients with a variety of grocery products.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Señorita que cuenta con 24 años de edad, con oficios domésticos, con domicilio en la Aldea La Ceiba, Jurisdicción municipal de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Departamento de Sololá, Guatemala, con sus participaciones en la comunidad se ha ganado el aprecio con su pequeño negocio en la venta de productos de consumo diario desde hace 10 años, la cual desde su infancia quedo huérfana de padre, en donde juntamente con su mama salieron avante en la vida, pasando por varias pruebas lográndolas superar, siendo joven y pensando de forma positiva en seguir creciendo en su negocio acudió a la Asociación ASDIR a solicitar un préstamo de Q7, 080.00, quetzales, dinero que utilizara para incrementar su capital en su tienda, ya que cuenta con bastante demanda, por ser la única persona quien se ha posicionado en la venta de estos productos en el lugar donde se encuentra su negocio. Además así podrá obtener ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida como también ayudarse a ella misma y a sus dos hermanitos a que concluyan sus estudios, y lo más importante es de satisfacer a los clientes con una variedad de productos de consumo diario.

loans.use: Increasing capital for her grocery store

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
The association named "27 de mayo" has been part of the family of Pro-Mujer for many years. One finds this association in the Andes in the city of El Alto. To date the association has 18 members who have demonstrated themselves to be an organized group in terms of their credit installments and internal activities. Within the group, the majority is married with an average of five children under 13 years of age. Their parents' dream is to have the power to provide them with better schooling to ensure their future. For this reason, they work hard in their jobs, saving money to pay for their children's studies. There are different business in the association like the sale of food, sale of shoes, of casual clothing, but the principal activity is the making of traditional knitted sweaters, veils, scarves and others that are later sold in the markets in the city of La Paz. The "27 de mayo" association needs more capital to purchase of the best quality raw material so that their products can also be of the best quality and, that way, they will have more clients and subsequently more income for their only objective which is to improve their economic situations. In this way they can offer their children a better way of life, principally in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación denominada “ 27 de mayo” forma parte de la familia de Pro-Mujer hace ya varios años, esta se encuentra en la zona de Los Andes, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 18 socias que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas. Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con un promedio de 5 hijos, la mayoría menores a los 13 años. El sueño que tienen sus padres es el poder brindarles estudios superiores para asegurar el futuro de ellos, por eso se esfuerzan en sus trabajos y van ahorrando el dinero, para solventar los estudios de sus hijos. Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de comida, venta de zapatos, de ropa casual, pero la actividad principal es la confección de chompas, matillas, chalinas y otros, que luego las venden en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. La asociación 27 de mayo afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra materia prima de mejor calidad de esta manera sus productos también tendrían mejor calidad y así obtendrían mayores clientes y por consiguiente mayores ganancias con el unico objetivo de mejorar su situación económica de esta manera ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor forma de vida principalmente en su educación.

loans.use: Capital to purchase raw material

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ms. María Del Pilar G. S. is a member of the “Santa Isabel” microfinance institution. She lives in the San Martín region of the Picota province and district. She sells groceries and cleaning products for a living. Her business is located inside her home in Los Jardines block 11- Las Alamedas in the same district.

She decided to start her own business with the aim of improving her family’s financial status. Thanks to her daily efforts, she has been able to make her business grow considerably, offering quality products at competitive prices.

With the loan of 2,500.00 Peruvian soles, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase rice, sacks of sugar, crates of milk, crates of cooking oil, detergent, soap bars, shampoos, diapers, soft drinks, and assorted sweets, among other products, to restock her business and meet customer demand.

Ms. Maria del Pilar is 39 years of age. She works arduously everyday so that she can reach her goals. In the future, she would like to expand her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María Del Pilar G. S. es socia del B.C. “Santa Isabel” vive en la región de San Martín provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, artículos de limpieza, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Los Jardines manzana 11- Las Alamedas del mismo distrito.

Decidió poner un negocio con la finalidad de mejorar la situación económica de su familia, y gracias al empeño que pone cada día, ha logrado que su negocio crezca considerablemente ahora oferta productos de calidad y a precios competitivos acorde con la realidad de la localidad.

Con el crédito recibido de S/.2,500.00 que lo devolverá en un plazo de 6 meses, comprara arroz, azúcar en sacos, leche en cajas, aceite, en cajas, detergentes, jabones en cajas, shampoo en cajitas, pañales para bebes en bolsas, gaseosas, golosinas diversas, entre otros, para surtir su negocio y cubrir la demanda de su clientela.

La señora Maria del Pilar tiene 39 años, se esfuerza cada día por lograr cumplir con sus metas trazadas, desea para el futuro ampliar su bodega.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale goods

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Ms. Dolores C. A. is a member of the “Santa Isabel” microfinance institution, located in the district of Picota, in the province of Picota, San Martín department. She prepares and sells meals for a living in the district’s market, courteously serving her patrons—mostly all residents of the area.

The need to improve her financial situation impelled her to start her own business, having at that time only a small kitchen, a table, and a few utensils. She later improved her business via loans from the microfinance institution and the profits from her daily sales.

With the loan of 1,500.00 Peruvian soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase ingredients such as: rice, sacks of sugar, cooking oil, and condiments in bulk. She will buy meats (chicken, beef, pork, fish) and assorted vegetables daily. She will buy kitchenware such as pots, plates, bowls, spoons, forks, and plastic table covers so that she can meet her patrons’ needs.

She is 67 years of age and has 3 independent children. She would like to have a well-established business so that she can have a calm old age. She counts on the affection and respect of her patrons.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dolores C. A., es socia del Banco Comunal ”Santa Isabel” ubicado en el distrito de Picota, provincia de Picota, departamento de San Martín, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en el mercado del mismo Distrito atendiendo con amabilidad a sus clientes que en su mayoría son los moradores de la localidad.

La necesidad de mejorar su situación económica le impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio, contando en ese momento solo con una cocinita pequeña, una mesa y unos cuantos utensilios de cocina luego fue implementando con los prestamos del Banco Comunal y con las ganancias de sus ventas diarias.

Con el préstamo recibido de S/. 1,500.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, compró ingredientes como: arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en litros y condimentos en grandes cantidades, y diariamente compra carnes (pollo, res, cerdo y pescado) y verduras diversas, también compró utensilios de cocina como ollas, platos (tendidos y soperas), cucharas, tenedores, plástico con motivos para tender sus mesas, así satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes.

Tiene 67 años, y 3 hijos que ya son independientes, desea estabilizarse como negocio para tener una vejez tranquila, cuenta con la simpatía y respeto de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale supplies

loans.name: Neida

texts.es:
Neida P. D. Rios is a member of the “Santa Isabel” community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Picota. She makes and sells bread, she makes them at home to sell them in a local market.

Neida used to sell “anticuchos” (meat skewers) and sodas, but she thinks that bread is a basic element on the table of every family and she decided to start making it.

With the loan of $700 USD (S/.2,000), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of flour, cases of eggs, liters of oil, packages of butter and other ingredients necessary for bread making and this way satisfy the demand of her clients, who live in the community.

Neida is 44 years old, she is separated, has 4 children of whom only one lives with her and 3 that are doing their professional studies in the capital city of the country, reason why she has to keep fighting, hoping to achieve her dream of owning her own bakery where she can offer a variety of the breads she knows how to make.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Neida P. D. R., es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Isabel”, vive en la región San Martín provincia y distrito D. Picota, se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. panes, los elabora en su casa para llevarlos a vender en su puesto que tiene en el mercado D. abastos D. la localidad.

La señora Neida anteriormente D. dedico a la venta D. anticuchos y refrescos, cree que el pan es un elemento esencial en la mesa D. todas las familias y decidió iniciarse en esta actividad.

Con el crédito recibido D. S/.2,000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses compró sacos D. harina, huevos en javas, aceite en litros, mantequilla en paquetes y demás insumos para la elaboración del pan y D. esa manera satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes que son los pobladores D. la localidad.

Neida tiene 44 años, ella es separada, tiene 4 hijos solo uno vive con ella y que 3 realizan sus estudios superiores en la capital del país, razón por lo que ella tiene que seguir luchando, espera alcanzar todos sus sueños que es tener un local propio para su panadería donD. oferte la variedad D. los panes que ella sabe preparar.

loans.use: Purchase flour and wholesale ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Florecer Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto one finds, in the middle of the Andes, the "Florecer" association made of up 13 members anxious to progress in their small businesses. The majority of the group members are married and realize that they need to help their partners with their household expenses since they already have an average of four children. This is the case for Doña Mela who lamentably separated from her partner and had to take charge of her family alone. For this reason, she needs better resources to sustain her household expenses. The main activity in the association is business like the sale of traditional knitted wool sweaters, food, natural fruit juices, cosmetics, CDs, school supplies, and other items depending on the season. They offer products in the Tiahuanacu market in the city of El Alto. They need capital to acquire other types of merchandise and to have a variety of products. In this way they willl generate greater and, ultimately, more income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de Los Andes a éste pertenece, la asociación “Florecer”, integrada por 13 miembros ansiosos de progresar en sus pequeños negocios. La mayoría en el grupo están casados y afirman que necesitan ayudar a sus parejas en la economía del hogar, ya que tienen un promedio de 4 niños , tal es el caso de doña Mela, que lamentablemente se separo de su pareja y tubo que hacerse cargo de su familia ella sola por lo que necesita mayores recursos para sustentar los gastos de su hogar. La actividad principal en la asociación es el comercio, venden chompas tejidas en lana, comida, jugos de fruta natural, cosméticos , cds , material escolar y otros dependiendo de la temporada. Productos que los ofrecen en la feria del mercado Tiahuanacu de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas precisan capital para adquirir otro tipo de mercaderia y tener variedad de productos,de esta manera generar mayores y por ende mayores ingresos para sus familias.

loans.use: Acquire Capital for the Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim B., 28, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and three young daughters. She and her husband work in the fields as farmers together and they sell palm leaves. Palm leaves are sold to people who use them to bind together baskets. Their three young daughters attend a local school. Lim has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase a motorbike to transport  the palm leaves.  She and her husband would like to cut down on  transportation costs and owning their own motorbike would allow them to save money and time.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S. R., 36, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Ros Bou Rithy, and their two young children. She sells common Khmer dishes that she cooks, earning US$6 net income each day. She and her husband work together in their business, serving pork and beef with Khmer wine. She has asked for a loan of US$500 to build a separate room for their restaurant business to increase their customer base. Their current business is hampered by a lack of adequate space. In the future, she would like to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Build a separate room to sell food

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry R., 58, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her six children. She rides her bike around Phsar Skun market every day, selling secondhand clothes for a US$2 income. She is also supported by two of her daughters who work in garment factories. She has asked for a loan of US$800 to purchase her own stand inside the market to sell her secondhand clothes. She believes that her bicycle is not the best way to reach customers and she needs the exposure that a stand can provide. She believes this investment will allow her to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a stand in the market

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun S., 33, is married and lives with her three children in the Kampong Cham province. She sells fish at the local food market earning US$2.50, while her husband feeds poultry for US$1 per day. Two of their children attend the local school, while the other is too young to attend school or work. High inflation has resulted in rising costs in Cambodia and many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income.

Lun S. has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motortaxi service near the market. The market provides a steady stream of people throughout the day and the service will serve as a good source of income for the family.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Thi Thuynh's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. T. Thi Thuynh (ID number: 11030001), 51 years old, wants to borrow 175USD to buy pig mash to breed pigs. Before, she borrowed 125 USD to continue making her family traditional cake, improving her family economy.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Chien (ID number: 11030006), wants to borrow 125 USD to buy pig mash.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thao (ID number: 11030005), wants to borrow 150USD to improve her family carpentry.
  • Mrs. T. Thi Vien (ID number: 11030004), wants to borrow 150 USD to buy chicken feed.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hanh (ID number: 11030003), wants to borrow 150 USD to buy more chinawares for rent.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Duc (ID number: 11030002), wants to borrow 150 USD to sell fruits in the market.

  • Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Cô Trần Thị Thuynh (MS: 11030001), năm nay 51 tuổi. Nhóm cô đã tham gia một kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt. Ở kỳ vay trước cô làm trưởng nhóm và đã hoàn thành rất tốt vai trò của mình. Với khoản vốn vay là 2.006.000 VND của kỳ trước cô đã mở rộng được nghề làm bánh truyền thống của gia đình nhờ đó kinh tế gia đình cô khá phát triển. Kỳ này cô vay 2.714.000 VND để thêm vốn mua cám lợn phát triển chăn nuôi. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm gồm có: Chị Nghiêm Thị Chiến (MS: 11030006), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thảo (MS: 11030005), vay 2.478.000 VND để gia đình phát triển nghề mộc. Chị Trần Thị Viễn (MS:11030004), vay 2.478.000 VND để mua cám nuôi gà đẻ trứng. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hạnh (MS: 11030003), vay 2.478.000 VND để thêm vốn mua mâm bát cho thuê. Chị Nguyễn Thị Đức (MS: 11030002), vay 2.478.000 VND để đi chợ mua bán hoa quả.

loans.use: buy pig mash, chicken feed, sell fruits, buy chinawares

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nizomiddin

texts.ru:
Nizomiddin has several businesses: he has a confectionеry, a small grocery store and he also raises cattle. He is 43 years old, married and has four children. A year ago he has come to MicroInvest and got his first loan which helped him buy several calves. After the sale he used the profits and invested into business expansion. In addition he has also rented out a small space for manufacturing of confectioneries and hired several workers to produce them. He has not abandoned his cattle business though. At this time the prices for cattle are lower and Nizomiddin has decided to apply for another loan to further expand this business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

У Низомиддина много занятий - у него есть кондитерский цех, маленький магазин продовольственных товаров и еще он занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота. Ему 43 года, он женат и имеет 4 детей. Год назад он обратился в Микроинвест и получив свой первый займ приобрел несколько бычков. После продажи их он получив прибыль стал вкладывать его в расширение бизнеса. В дополнение к этому он взял в аренду мини-цех по производству кондитерских изделий и наняв несколько человек стал производить кондитерские изделия. При этом он не бросил выращивание скота. Сейчас когда цены на скот немного снизились Низомиддин решил обратиться за новым займом чтобы далее развивать свою деятельность.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Thi Vu's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. T. Thi Vu (ID number: 11030012), works as a nurse. She also works on rice field and breeds animals. At first, she borrowed 125 USD and profited from breeding pigs. This time, she wants to borrow 75 USD to buy more pigs. Her average income is 20 USD/week.
  • Mrs. V. Thi Tinh (ID number: 11030017), needs 150 USD to improve her family carpenter shop.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Tu (ID number: 11030014), needs 125 USD to buy pig mash.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hoa (ID number: 11030024), needs 125 USD to improve her famili carpenter shop.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hang (ID number: 11030015), needs 150 USD to buy pig mash. Every member of this group has finished repaying the money they borrowed before.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Chị Trần Thị Vụ (MS: 11030012). Chị Vụ làm y tá tại nhà ngoài ra chị còn làm ruộng, chăn nuôi. Kỳ một chị đã hoàn thành vốn vay 2.006.000 VND và thu được tiền lãi khá nhiều nhờ chăn nuôi lợn thịt. Nay chị muốn chuyển hướng sang chăn nuôi lợn nái nên vay 1.062.000 VND để mua lợn giống. Mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 300.000 VND/ tuần. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm: Chị Vương Thị Tình (MS:11030017), vay 2.478.000 VND để gia đình phát triển nghề mộc. Chị Nguyễn Thị Tư (MS:11030014), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 11030024), vay 2.006.000 VND để phát triển nghề mộc. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng (MS: 11030015), vay 2.478.000 VND để mua cám lợn ( Tất cả các thành viên trong nhóm đã hoàn trả hết vốn vay kỳ trước).

loans.use: buy pigs and pig mash, improve carpenter shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru:
Shohida is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is in the retail business and sells children's clothing at the central market of the town of Isfara. She has six years of experience in this business. She started out with small retail and now her cash flow has grown and allows her to support the family. She goes to the market in the early morning and sells there until the afternoon. This is the best time for her to sell and many of her clients buy from her. Her lively personality attracts the clientele and she has many regulars. Shohida has first come to MicroInvest two years ago and got her first loan. She has gradually increased commodity circulation and achieved the level of a well established business. At this time she is applying for another loan and will use it to increase the variety of summer clothes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шохиде 28 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Она занимается куплей продажей детской одежды на центральном рынке города Исфара. Опыт работы в этой сфере составляет 6 лет. Начинала она с мелкой торговли, сейчас ее оборотный капитал вырос и позволяет содержать семью. С раннего утра она приходит на рынок и и до обеда торгует там. В это время у нее очень хорошая торговля и многие клиенты приходят за покупками. Ее жизнерадостность привлекает клиентов и у Шохиды очень много постоянных клиентов. 2 года назад она обратилась в Микроинвест и получила свой первый займ. Постепенно увеличивая товарооборот она достигла уровня хорошо поставленного бизнеса. Сейчас она обратилась в Микроинвест за новым займом и потратит его на увеличение ассортимента летней одежды.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Thi Thanh's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. L. Thi Thanh (ID number: 020056), is 27 years old. She wants to borrow 167 USD to do business on waste metals. Her husband is a truck driver, contributing to the family income. She has 1 child who is still going to school. Her family average income is 10 USD. She has been a member of the TYM Fund for one round and she has finished repaying the first-round borrowed money.
  • Mrs. T. Thi Truc (ID number: 020007), wants to borrow 167 USD to do business on waste metals.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Tuyet (ID number: 020057), wants to borrow 124.5 USD to sell vegetables daily.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Dung (ID number: 020058), wants to borrow 124.5 USD to sell sodas and beverages.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Lien (ID number: 020060), wants to borrow 167 USD to sell Vietnamese ham. Every member of this group has finished repaying the money they borrowed before.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Chị Lê Thị Thành (MS: 020056), năm nay 27 tuổi. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để bổ xung vốn mua bán phế liệu. Chồng chị lái xe chở hàng thuê tạo thu nhập thêm cho gia đình. Chị có môt con nhỏ đang đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 150.000 VND. Chị đã tham gia được một chu kỳ vay vốn, và thấy mình tiết kiêm hơn, đồng thời mua được nhiều hàng phế liệu hơn. Nhóm chị đều đã hoàn trả rất tốt chu kỳ I và cùng nhau tiếp tục vay ở chu kỳ II. Chị Trần Thị Trúc (MS: 020007), vay 2.714.000 VND để buôn bán phế liệu. Chị Nghiêm Thị Tuyết (MS: 020057), vay 2.006.000 VND mua rau bán hàng ngày. Chị Nghiêm Thị Dung (MS: 200058), vay 2.006.000 VND để bán hàng nước ngọt. Chị Nghiêm Thị Liên (MS: 020060),vay 2.714.000 VND để buôn bán giò trả. ( Tất cả các thành viên trong nhóm đều đã hoàn trả rất tốt chu kỳ I).

loans.use: do business on waste metal, sell vegetables, beverages, Vietnamese ham

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Chheam

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheam R. sells groceries from her house in Or Ambil Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. She can earn around $5 per day, which currently covers the family’s expenses. With expenses growing from day to day, she has to work hard to overcome local competition. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver who can earn $3.50 per day to help to support the family’s expenses. Because her husband's motorcycle is old, he cannot attract many customers. He has noticed that lately his income has declined, as well.

R. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband to replace the old one. The loan will allow her husband to attract more customers and thereby increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for her husband to replace the old one

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Mr. Met S. repairs motorcycles and bicycles in his area, from which he can earn $8 per day. Mr. S. works hard every day and provides good repair service, because he has a lot of experience in motorcycle and bicycle repair. His income is not enough to support the family’s expenses, so his wife helps to generate more income by selling porridge and coffee. She earns approximately $10 per day from these activities.

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase grocery inventory so that his wife can sell it alongside her porridge. He plans to use the remainder of the loan to fund a new business for his daughter.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory so that his wife can sell it alongside her porridge

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong S., 25 years old, lives with her husband, Meng Sarin (pictured here) in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. The couple work together in a grocery sales to support their two young children. They are now applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase fertilizer in bulk. They would like to start a new business re-selling fertilizer in smaller amounts to local farmers in order to diversify and expand their source of income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for resale purposes

loans.name: Klouk

texts.en: Klouk K. is a 44 year old widow, residing with four of her children, in Prey Veng province. As a farmer, she typically earns about $7 daily, while her two children, earns a combined total of approx. $5 per day as garment workers. The inconsistent weather condition patterns in the last year have resulted in more farmers, like Klouk, to have less output. To improve her standard of living, Klouk would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a grinding mill that can be rented out to other local farmers and raise additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill.

loans.name: Kum

texts.en:
Kum P., 40, lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband and eight children. She sells vegetables in the local food market typically earning US$10 per day, while her husband is a farmer earning US$3 each day. Two of their children are also employed, one as a telephone company technician and another as a garment worker. This has been a difficult year for farmers in Cambodia because weather patterns have not been consistent and inflation has been high. Many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income.

Kum P. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to meet some of her families needs and improve her standard of living. She would like to purchase a water pump for her home, gas for the family’s motorbike, and if possible, livestock and/or fertilizer. In the future, she would like to open up a grocery stand in the market. She believes this loan will increase her daily income and help expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase housing and farming equipment

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum S., 29, lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband, Nut Piseth, and their two children. She is a teacher making US$1.60 each day, while her husband is a farmer. Her husband owns a small tractor and frequently rents it out to earn an extra profit. The family has asked for a loan of US$500 to purchase gas to fill up the tractor’s tank. This investment will allow the family to rent out the tractor to many new customers and increase their income. This has been a difficult year for farmers in Cambodia because weather patterns have been inconsistent and inflation has been high, therefore Prum S. and her family have lacked capital to increase their business.

loans.use: Purchase gas for a tractor

loans.name: Loas

texts.en: Loas K. lives with her husband, Chea Sokkheoun (pictured above), and their young child in the Prey Veng province. She works in the local garment factories making US$2 each day, while her husband drives a motortaxi typically making US$5 each day. Cambodia has faced high inflation and high food prices lately leaving many families struggling to purchase basic necessities. She has asked for a loan of US$500 to purchase some foods to sell in the factory. This will increase her daily income, and she knows that there is a large customer base that will purchase from her store. She has an entrepreneurial mindset and in the future, she would like to open up a furniture shop and stop working in the factory.

loans.use: Purchase food to sell in the factory

loans.name: Hairullo

texts.ru:
Hairully has a specialized education in computer programming. After graduating from college he has decided to start his own business to provide computer services. When he started this business it was still a new niche. He bought several computers, a scanner, printer and other peripherals and rented out a space in the city center. He gave his business a related meaningful name - Imkon, which is translated from Tajik as possibilities. He has gradually added a few other services offered by his business such as recording of celebrations and events on video and an internet-cafe with access to the world wide web. Hairullo's services include the following: word processing and printing of documents, internet access, document lamination, making of invitation cards and much more. At this time Hairullo has created and will soon be launching his new project. He wants to start an advertising business which will include design and printing of ad banners. He has already ordered a 12 color plotter and has hired a specialist who will tune and get the plotter working properly. Hairullo has heard of Kiva and decided to apply for a loan to fulfill his financial needs.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайрулло имеет специализированное образование в области программирования. После окончания университета он решил начать свой бизнес - предоставлять компьютерные услуги. К тому времени когда он начал этим заниматься это была та ниша которая еще не была заполнена. Он приобрел несколько компьютеров, ксерокс, принтер и другую оргтехнику, взял в аренду помещение в центре города. Название для своего центра он подобрал соответствующее - "Имкон", что в переводе с таджикского языка означает "возможности". Постепенно он развивая свой салон добавил еще несколько услуг, в частности видеосъемку торжественных мероприятий и доступ к всемирной паутине - интернету. Сегодня Вы можете воспользоваться следующими услугами - компьютерный набор и распечатка текстов, аренда компьютерного времени, ламинация документов, услуги интернета, изготовить пригласительные билеты и многое другое. Сейчас Хайрулло составил и внедряет в жизнь еще один бизнес проект. Он касается рекламной продукции и включает в себя разработку и распечатку рекламных баннеров. Он уже заказал 12-ти цветный плоттер. Сейчас приглашен специалист который будет настраивать работу этого плоттера. Хайрулло слышал про КИВУ и для восполнения нехватки денежных средств решил обратиться за займом.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Rous

texts.en: Rous S., 48, is a single man, living with his elderly father in the Prey Veng province. He sells ice cream, typically making US$10 each day. He has asked for a loan of US$800 to purchase some farmland to grow rice. Many families in Cambodia have struggled with the rising inflation and are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. Rous S. believes that a new rice field will allow him to have two sources of income to support his family. He has seen how profitable rice fields have become in his area and would like the opportunity to increase his daily income and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Rous

texts.en: Rous K., age 50, is married and lives with six of her children. She and her husband have a business selling fish in a busy market, earning around $5 profit per day. They are supported by two of their children who work in a garment factory, each earning $120 per month. To facilitate greater access to transportation, they would like to request a loan to help purchase a motorbike. They believe this will reduce the cost that the family spends on motor-taxi to transport fish to the market. (Husband is pictured because Mrs. Rous was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang K., 38 years old, lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband and two children. Chheang works as a farmer making US$3 per day, while her husband, Hao Chang, raises ducks for US$6 each day. Farming has been difficult in Cambodia over the past year and many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. She has asked for a loan of US$700 to purchase more ducks to raise. She hopes this will help expand her husband’s business, consequently raising the family’s daily income and improving their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase ducks

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng S. is a 29 year old widow living in the Siem Reap province with her elderly mother and two children. Leng provides care and support for her 72 year old elderly mother, Oung Phliv.
