She sells roast beef in the local market, making US$3 per day. She is also supported by her children who help her sell roast beef, as well as work in construction. She has asked for a loan of US$200 to invest in her roast beef business. With some capital, she believe she can increase her customer base, raise her daily income and eventually purchase a larger stall. She thinks that there is great potential for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: Invest in roast beef business

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S. R. is a 41 year old widow living in the Siem Reap province with five of her children. She is supported by two of her children: one is a chef in a local restaurant and another is a car mechanic (pictured above). In recent times, inflation has raised prices in Cambodia and many families are seeking loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. She has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. Gas prices have made public transportation too costly and she believes that this investment will save money for the family in the long run, as well as improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon P., 44 years old, lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband, Pa Saroeun, and six children. She raises pigs at her home, making US$7 each day, while her husband works as a farmer in the fields, earning US$5 per day. The family is also supported by two of their children who work in the local garment factory. Mrs. P. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a small tractor for her husband in order to help him plow his land. Moreover, it is common for Cambodians to rent out their tractors to make extra income. Through this investment, Chhuon P. believes that her family’s daily income can be increased and her standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: Purchase small tractor

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem R., 54 years old, lives in the Prey Ving province in Cambodia with her husband and four children. She and her husband sell rice to support their family. In addition, her children also work to support the family: two are garment workers; one is a blacksmith; and one also helps with the rice business. The Roeuns are now seeking to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase a small truck to transfer their rice in a more efficient manner. They hope this will help them grow their business and help them earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck to use for transport of rice

loans.name: Choub

texts.en:
Choub S., 44, is married to Chen Korn, and lives in the Prey Veng province with her two children. Choub S. and her husband work together operating a generator which recharges batteries for local villagers. Their income is approximately $13 each day. The two children work in the local garment factory and they are able to generate a small amount of income to support the family as well.

The family has asked for a loan of $800 to replace their old generator. They have been struggling to meet the demands of the village and they feel that a replacement generator will allow them to increase their income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a new generator to charge batteries

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean Y., 34, is married and resides with her four children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. All the children are students. Sean and her husband have a business selling chickens in the local market, earning approximately seven dollars per day. The family's standard of living has improved since they started this business.

They want a loan to sell larger amounts of poultry. This will provide the family with more income and will allow the children to enroll in a higher class at school. (Mrs. Sean is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To purchase more chicken.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban M., 44, lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband, Van Vuth, and their four children. Two of their children are students in the local school and two are able to help support the family by working at the garment factory.

Ban M. sells vegetables in the market each day, making three dollars, while her husband makes five dollars each day as a farmer. She has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a tractor that she can both use and rent to other farmers for some extra income. It is common in Cambodia for people who own a tractor to rent it out to other farmers and it can turn into a profitable business venture. She believes that this will be a good investment for her family to improve its standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lous

texts.en:
Mrs. Lous K. is a widow who lives in Cambodia with her only son. She and her son sell corn and fresh water clams to support themselves and can earn up to $11 in revenue per day.

Mrs. Lous is requesting a loan of $600 in order to grow her business. She would like to apply $300 towards purchasing additional inventory and $300 towards renovating her house.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory and to renovate a house

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan S., 35, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She has worked as a garment worker since 2007, typically earning around three dollars each day. Her husband also works in a garment factory, also earning three dollars per day. This couple has three children and all of them are students.

They would like to apply for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike. This will be used for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch H., 21, is employed at a garment factory as a tailor and typically makes around two dollars per day. For the last 10 years, plenty of garment factories have been built in Cambodia and employ a number of Cambodian people, especially women. The garment sector is classified as the main Cambodian export. In late 2004, Mrs. Touch H. was luckily employed by the garment factory located near her house.

Her husband has been working as a carpenter building houses, as well as designing and making various kinds of furniture. He contributes about three dollars per day to support his whole family. The two sources of income have sustained their daily expenses including food and other utilities.

Mrs. Touch H. has requested for a loan from KIVA to purchase more carpentry tools for her husband so that this will make his job easier and shorten the time it takes him to make his furniture and improving his customer satisfaction. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Touch H. was not available)

loans.use: TO purchase a carpentry's tools for her husband to operate a business.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S. is 29-years-old and lives in Cambodia with her only child. To support her family, S. sells roast beef, pork, and chicken in her town. With hopes of growing her business and making it more efficient, she is now applying for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike.  With this motorbike, she will be able to have her own means of transportation and increase the sales area for her food products. S. is pictured here preparing some of those products.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike in order to transfer and sell food products

loans.name: Kvan

texts.en:
Kvan S., 47, is married to Yur Sakun and lives in the Prey Veng province with their four children. She works in construction making three dollars each day, while her husband also works in construction making five dollars each day. The family is also supported by one of the daughters who works in the local garment factory.

She has asked for a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her commute to work. High gas prices have made public transportation costs a difficult expense for the family, so they have seen an opportunity for savings through this investment.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Gf Dioubo Group

texts.fr:
To fight against hunger and poverty, five women from the Mbour suburb neighborhood united into a group called Dioubo. With a first loan of 2,500,000 CFA, they started a small business of selling fruits and vegetables in their neighborhood. Today, each woman manages her own business activities and the income from the business helps them take care of themselves and their families.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Pour lutter contre la pauvrete fiminime cinq femmes d'un quartier de la banlieu de mbour se sont réunies au sein d' un groupe dénommé dioubo entante en wolof .Avec un premier pret de 2500000f cfa,elles ont démarré une activité de vente de fruits et légumes dans leur quartier.Ajourd'hui chacune d'elle gere ses propres activités de commerce.Les revenus tirés de l'activité leur perttent de se prendre en charge .

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Teth

texts.en:
Teth N., 24, is a mother of one little child and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is a garment factory worker and earns around $3.30 each day. Her husband, Seth Visal, has had a business running a motor-taxi since 1999. In one day, he makes $3.50. This couple also takes care of an old father and mother.

To increase their income to help support their extended family, they are requesting a loan to help purchase a small tractor. They will then rent the tractor to other famers.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor for rental.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mr. Neang C. lives in Cambodia with his wife and four of their six children. To help support his large family, Mr. Neang works two jobs, one selling coffee and the other as a land dealer. His wife also works in their coffee business. The children also contribute to the household expenses. One is a garment worker, one a driver, and one works in a computer company.

Mr. Neang is requesting a loan of $1,200 to improve his business. One thousand dollars would go towards setting up a shop from which to run the coffee business. He has already begun construction on this shop. Additionally, he would like to use $200 to purchase a generator as lengthy blackouts are a common occurrence in many parts of Cambodia. Mr. Neang is pictured here with four of his children at the construction site of the coffee shop.

loans.use: To set up a coffee shop and purchase a generator

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en: Yoeun P., 34, is a farmer in Prey Veng province. She is married with four children; two of whom are employed as garment factory workers, the others are students. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning around two dollars each day. She also makes two dollars each day. The couple would like a loan of $300 to purchase a grinding mill. (Mrs. Yoeun is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill.

loans.name: Aniba

texts.fr:
Born on December 31, 1983 in the village of Kassou in Bassar Prefecture in the northwest of Togo, Mr. Aniba T. is married and is a water well driller. His business consists of drilling wells and installing water pumps. Usually he works together with other professional teams of engineers to complete projects.

Presently, he has a project that he has to complete with his own money and be repaid only upon completion. With this end in mind, he is requesting this loan to buy 30 bags of cement, rebar, and pipe for water conduit. All the income from this project will come back to him alone, since he is not doing the project with a team.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 31 décembre 1983 dans le village de KASSOU dans la préfecture de Bassar au Nord ouest du Togo, Monsieur T. Aniba est marié et est un foreur. Son activité consiste à faire le forage et à construire des châteaux d’eau. Habituellement, il se joint à d’autres équipes professionnelles de génie civil pour exécuter les chantiers.

Actuellement, il a reçu un chantier qu’il doit exécuter avec son argent et récupérer après la finalisation. A cet effet, il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 30 paquets de ciments, de fer à béton et des tuyaux de canalisation. Le revenu de cette activité lui reviendra seul car il n’exécutera pas ce chantier en équipe.

loans.use:
Purchase of 30 bags of cement, rebar, and pipe for water conduit

Achat de 30 paquets de ciment, de fer à béton et des tuyaux de canalisation

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Brak

texts.en:
Brak S., age 53, is married and lives with her husband and five of her children in the town of Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is a professional tailor, normally making seven dollars each day from her fashion design business. Three children are married and two are employed.

Brak’s husband has a small shop, where he has been selling used computers since 2006. He earns around $15 per day. He would like to have a loan to purchase more computers for resell. (Mrs. S. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To purchase more used computers.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amélé H. was born on June 10, 1972 in Sévagan in the Vo Prefecture. She is married, and her principal business is the sale of grocery staples in the Tokoin neighborhood of Lomé.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to stock up by buying 20 tins of oil, 2 cases of milk, and 2 cases of wine.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée, madame H. Amélé est née le 10 juin 1972 à Sévagan dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier de Tokoin à Lomé.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat 20 bidons d’huile, 2 cartons de lait et 2 cartons de vins.

loans.use:
purchase of staple grocery items

Achat des produits de premières nécessités

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Tak

texts.en:
Mrs. Tak Savoeun, 56, is a farmer in the Prey Vang province of Cambodia. She lives with her husband who is also a farmer, and five of their six children. Two of their children are garment workers and the rest are students who help their parents with the farm work.

Mrs. Savoeun is now seeking to enhance and grow her family’s farming business. She is requesting a loan for $1,200 in order to purchase two cows, fertilizer, and rice seeds. With these purchases, she believes her farm can grow and be more efficient and productive.

loans.use: To purchase two cows, fertilizer, and rice seeds

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru:
Maruf is 26 years old, married and lives with his parents. After graduating from the university three years ago he started his own business. He started out with renting out of a small kiosk where he provided services in cellular phone activation, sales of prepaid phone cards and printing of documents. By gradually increasing business cash flow he expanded his business. He bought another printer and scanner. He uses parts of the profits to support his family and the rest of it invests into his business. When he heard of Kiva, Maruf has decided to apply for a loan which he will use to buy wholesale SIM cards and prepaid phone cards.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Маруфу 26 лет, он женат и живет вместе с родителями. 3 года назад он закончив университет стал заниматься предпринимательством. Начал с аренды маленького киоска, где занимался подключением к сотовым операторам, продавал карточки пополнения счета, распечаткой текстов. Постепенно увеличивая свой оборотный капитал расширил свою деятельность. Приобрел дополнительно принтер и ксерокс. Получаемый им доход частью он использует для содержания семьи, другую использует для дальнейшего расширения бизнеса. Узнав про КИВА Маруф решил обратиться за займом который собирается использовать для оптового закупа симкарт и карточек пополнения счета.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Adjérétou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjérétou A., 39, was born in Sotouboua. She is married and is the mother of 4 children. She has built up a little store selling staple foodstuffs in the Attiégou district of Lomé. In her store, “ETS AICHA” certain products are missing, especially rice and vegetable oil and, in fact, this is what people in her neighborhood especially want to buy.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 20 sacks of rice and 6 tins of vegetable oil so as to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 39 ans, madame A. Adjérétou est née à Sotouboua. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle a crée un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé. Dans son magasin « ETS AICHA », il manque certains produits surtout le riz et l’huile végétale ; or c’est ce qui est plus acheté dans le quartier.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 sacs de riz et 6 bidons d’huile végétale afin de pouvoir mieux servir ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 sacks of rice and 6 tins of vegetable oil

Achat de 20 sacs de riz et de 6 bidons d'huile végétale

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Mr. Hout R. is a 24-year-old sculptor who lives in the Kandol province of Cambodia with his wife, Rith Savny, who works as a hairdresser. The couple works hard to support their young child.

Mr. R. is now seeking a loan of $1,000 in order to help his wife open a “pretty salon shop” so that she can start her own business. He would also like to invest the remainder of the money into purchasing gas to resell. Rith Savny is pictured here in the space she currently uses for her business.

loans.use: To open a beauty salon and to purchase gas

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Mrs. Morm H. is 51-years-old and sells porridge in the Prey Vang province of Cambodia, earning up to four dollars in revenue a day. Her husband, Sou Seoun, works as a motorbike-taxi driver. Together the couple lives with their two children, both of whom are garment workers. Although all four family members work, money is still tight. Thus, Mrs. H. is requesting a loan for $1,000. She hopes to use a small portion of the loan to invest in her porridge business, and the rest of it to renovate the family home. In the future, she has hopes of owning a large stand from which she can sell her porridge.

loans.use: To invest in a porridge business and renovate the family home

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan P. is a farmer in the Prey Vang province of Cambodia. Her husband is also a farmer, and together they earn about one dollar per day. The couple lives with five of their six children; three of whom are garment workers earning around $70 per month.

In order to enrich their farming business, the P.'s are seeking to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase a cow, beans and corn seeds to produce crops. They hope that these additional purchases will greatly help their farm to increase production.

loans.use: To purchase a cow, beans and corn seeds

loans.name: Séanté

texts.fr:
A trained hairdresser, Mrs. Séanté Tchamssi-Wuitta was born on November 2, 1983 in Lomé. She is married to Mr. Abalo Badjake who is a construction electrician and she has 4 children. She also sells charcoal in her Agoè neighborhood. She would like to acquire a freezer for her beauty parlor so as to be equipped to sell fruit juice and iced water.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to achieve her goal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Coiffeuse de profession, madame TCHAMSSI-WUITTA Séanté est née le 2 novembre 1983 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur BADJAKE Abalo qui est un électricien bâtiment et à quatre enfants. Elle exerce aussi le commerce de charbon de bois dans son quartier Agoè. Elle désire acquérir un congélateur, pour équiper son salon de coiffure afin de pouvoir vendre aussi des jus de fruits et de l’eau glacée.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de réaliser son projet.

loans.use:
Purchase of a freezer

Achat d'un congelateur

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Mr. Noun S., 38, is a motor-taxi driver in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Each day he can earn up to three dollars. He is not married, but lives with and supports his elderly parents. He is requesting a loan for $150 to go towards replacing his old motorbike. In the future, he hopes he can save enough money to purchase a car to run a taxi business instead of a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Mandjonéwé-Nessé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mandjonéwé-Nessé K., the wife of Mr. Alfa Lebgaza, was born on December 31, 1957 in Yadeboi in the north of Togo and has 6 children. Trained midwife, she also sells charcoal and cereals in the Agoè neighborhood. She also sells firewood and that is presently her principal business. She is requesting this first loan for the purchase of 37 sacks of charcoal for re-sale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame K. Mandjonéwé-Nessé, femme de monsieur LEBGAZA Alfa, est née le 31 décembre 1957 à Yadeboi au nord du Togo et à six enfants. Accoucheuse de profession, elle exerce aussi une activité de vente de charbon de bois et des céréales dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle vend aussi du bois de chauffe et c’est ce qui constitue son activité principale actuelle. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour l’achat de 37 sacs de charbon de bois destinés à la vente.

loans.use: Achat de 37 sacs de charbons de bois

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Doka

texts.fr:
A bachelor with no children, Mr. Lawoété Doka was born on May 28, 1982 in Agoé. He is a cook and has been in business since 2005, opening a mini-restaurant in the Agoé district.

He serves spaghetti, rice and salad. He has quite a number of customers because he is a really good cook.

After a first loan that was very helpful for his business, he is now requesting a second loan to purchase 15 cases of spaghetti, 4 cases of milk, 3 sacks of rice, and 2 cases of mayonnaise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Célibataire sans enfant, monsieur DOKA Lawoété est né le 28 mai 1982 à Agoé .Il est cuisinier et exerce son activité depuis 2005.

Il a crée un mini restaurant dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il fait la restauration de spaghetti du café, du riz et de la salade. Il accueille beaucoup de client car il applique sa connaissance dans le domaine de la gastronomie.

Après un premier crédit qui lui a été très bénéfique, il souhaiterait un deuxième crédit pour acheter 15 cartons de spaghetti, 04 cartons de lait, 03 sacs de riz et 2 cartons de mayonnaise.

loans.use:
Purchase of spaghetti, milk, and rice for restaurant

Achat de spaghetti, de lait, de riz pour la restauration

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Nandu

texts.fr:
Mrs. Nandu L. is married to Richard Mensah and is the mother of three children of whom two are twins. She was born around 1976 in Togo. She has lived for 8 years in Xwlacodji, a very densely populated area of Cotonou, and ran a business selling corn porridge and charcoal. Since she had the impression that her fellow citizens needed a place to obtain peanut oil, she came to Alidé to request her first loan which was to allow her to begin selling a third product, peanut oil. She is presently requesting her fourth loan in the amount of US$ 250 to further bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva voluneer

Mariée à MENSAH Richard, dame L. Nandu est mère de trois enfants dont deux jumeaux. Elle est née vers les années 1976 dans la république du TOGO. Elle réside à Xwlacodji un quartier populaire de COTONOU depuis 8ans et exerce l’activité de vente de bouillie faite à base de maïs et de charbon. Lorsqu'elle a senti que ses cohabitants avaient des besoins en huile d’arachide ; elle s’est adressée à ALIDé pour obtenir son premier crédit afin de créer sa troisième activité qu'est la vente d’huile d’arachide. Elle vient solliciter son quatrième crédit d’un montant de 100000F CFA pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 sacks of charcoal, 50 liters of peanut oil, and 25 kg of corn

Achat de 10 sacs de charbon, de 50 litres d’huile d’arachide, de 25kg de maïs.

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr:
Married to Mr. Yawo Agbeko Akouete who works in an office, Mrs. Adakou S. was born in Afagnan in 1969 and began her retail business in 2003.

She sells primarily necklaces and perfume. She has her stand near the Agoè market and has a satisfactory turnover.

After a first loan of 300,000 francs CFA (US$725) which she reimbursed appropriately, she would like to have a second loan to purchase 60 necklaces and 2 cases of perfume.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée à monsieur AKOUETE Yawo Agbeko employé de bureau, la revendeuse madame S. Adakou née a Afagnan en 1969 a commencé son activité en 2003.

Elle a pour activité principale la vente de colliers et de parfum. Elle a son étalage proche du marché d’Agoè et réalise un bon chiffre d’affaires.

Après un premier crédit de 300 000 fracs CFA qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle désire prendre un second crédit pour acheter 60 colliers de femmes et 2 cartons de parfum.

loans.use:
Purchase of necklaces and perfume

Achat de colliers et de parfum

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr:
Mrs. Elise K., a widow, was born around 1951 in Cotonou. She is the mother of four children of whom the oldest is deceased, leaving her responsible for three children. She lives in Xwlacodji, a suburb of Cotonou, and her business is the sale of seafood. Since her husband's death, she is the sole breadwinner for the family. Concerned about the future of her children, she realizes that she needs to add to her capital so as to increase her income and stop buying small quantities on credit, something the loan will permit her to remedy. As a first loan she received the sum of US$ 45 on April 12, 2000 and was able to reimburse it without difficulty. As her business has evolved thanks to the loans, she is now requesting her 13th loan in the amount of US$ 775.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame K. Elise est née vers les années 1951 à COTONOU. Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont l’aîné est décédé et les trois autres sont à sa charge. Elle réside à Xwlacodji une banlieue de Cotonou et exerce comme activité la vente des produits de la mer. Depuis le décès de son mari, toutes les charges du foyer lui sont revenues. Soucieuse de l’avenir de ses enfants, elle voit la nécessité d’augmenter son capital en vu d’accroître son revenu et cesser aussi de s’approvisionner en petite quantité et à crédit et ceci grâce au prêt. Elle a obtenu pour son premier crédit le 04/12/2000 un montant de 15000 F CFA qu’elle a remboursé sans difficulté. Ayant beaucoup évolué dans son activité grâce aux crédits elle sollicite pour son treizième crédit un montant de 320 000F CFA.

loans.use:
Purchase of fresh fish and shrimp

Achats de poissons et de crevettes fraiches

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kayi A. was born on June 6, 1962 in Tsévié. She is married to Mr. Maye Dara and she has 6 children. Her business since 2006 is selling various foodstuffs and cosmetics. To satisfy an ever-growing clientele, she is presently requesting her first loan to purchase 20 sacks of rice, 30 bottles of wine, and 46 bottles of liqueurs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Kayi est née le 06 juin 1962 à Tsévié. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur DARA Maye et elle a 06 enfants. Comme activité elle vend de divers produits d’alimentation et de produits cosmétiques depuis 2006. Pour satisfaire une clientèle grandissante, elle sollicite aujourd’hui son premier crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de riz, 30 bouteilles de vin et 46 bouteilles de liqueur.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 sacks of rice and 30 bottles of drinks

Achat de 20 sacs de riz et de 30 bouteilles de boissons

loans.name: Naouton Rachelle

texts.fr:
Mrs. Naouton Rachelle Houkanrin is the mother of 5 childen. She is responsible for 6 grandchildren. She has lived in Yagbe, a neighborhood of Cotonou, since birth and is married to Zachée Zannou, who is a mason. She was born around 1961 in Cotonou and has sold cakes since around 1978. To diversify her business, she chose to sell liquor. The demand from her clientele has grown and she is not entirely able to satisfy her customers, due to her financial resources. She is requesting her fifth loan in the amount of US$ 475 which will bolster her capacity to satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame H. Naouton Rachelle est mère de 5 enfants. Elle a à sa charge 6 petits fils. Elle réside à YAGBE, un quartier de COTONOU depuis sa naissance et a épousé ZANNOU Zachée, technicien en maçonnerie. Elle est née vers les années 1961 à COTONOU et exerce comme activité la vente de gâteaux depuis les années 1978. Pour diversifier son activité elle a opté pour la vente de liqueurs. La demande de sa clientèle a augmenté et elle ne pouvait plus satisfaire pleinement ses clients, faute de ressources financières. Elle sollicite pour son cinquième crédit un montant de 200 000 F CFA qui serviront à renforcer ses capacités à satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 50 kg of wheat flour, 5 cases of liquor, and 10 liters of peanut oil

Achat de 50 kg de farine de blé, de 5 cartons de liqueurs et de 10 litres d’huile d’arachide.

loans.name: Kokouvi Messanvi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokouvi Messanvi F., born in 1958 in Attitogon, has been retailing honey and corn in Bé-Kpota since 2004. He is married to Ablavi Akakpo and they have four children. His honey-selling business is going really well because his customers have confidance in the quality of his product.

He has already received a loan from WAGES and paid it back appropriately.

This second loan that he is requesting will allow him to purchase 5 tins of honey and 5 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Revendeur de miel et de maïs, monsieur F. Kokouvi Menssanvi, né en 1958 à Attitogon, exerce son activité à Bé-Kpota à Lomé depuis 2004. Il est marié à AKAKPO Ablavi et ils ont quatre enfants. Cette activité de vente de miel marche très bien pour lui car ses clients ont la confiance en la qualité de son produit.

Il a une fois béneficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé.

Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 bidons de miel et 5 sacs de maïs.

loans.use:
Purchase of honey and corn

Achat de miel et de maïs

loans.name: Ndeye Mama

texts.fr:
NDEYE MAMA F. is a married woman who lives with her children in the Lazaret neighbourhood. She is a seamstress by profession, but in order to diversify her business, she started selling fabrics and cosmetic products in the past 5 years. This is her second loan and with this money she would like to go to the town of ROSSO to buy additional supplies.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

NDEYE MAMA F. EST UNE FEMME MARIEE QUI VIT AVEC SES ENFANTS AU QUARTIER LAZARET .c'est une couturière de profession mais c'est dans le but de diversifier ses revenus qu'elle s'est lancé dans le commerce de tissus et de produits cosmétiques depuis presque 5 ans .elle est à son deuxième pret et avec l'argent elle compte aller à ROSSO pour s'approvisionner en marchandises.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetic products and fabrics

loans.name: Albertina Paulino

texts.pt:
Albertina is 36 years old and was born in the district of Namaacha, a district bordering with Swaziland. She is divorced and the mother of 4 children. Her oldest is 15 and is in the 9th grade, her second is 13 and in the 6th grade, her third is 9 and in the 3rd grade, and her last is 22 months.

Albertina supports only her family of 4 children, but sometimes she sends money to her mother to help her with the bills. Albertina studied until the 6th grade and stopped because of the war and because her family did not have the ability to send her to the city to study. In 1993 she left the district of Namaacha with her marriage and went to the district of Boane where she lives today. She lives in her own home. She is an instructor in a small school in Mafuiane, an administrative post in the district of Boane, with an indeterminate contract. She has worked 16 years at this school.

Albertina learned in this same school accumulating experience and was later enabled to improve her teaching techniques. She has a monthly salary of 2,500MT and saves 1,500MT. This is Albertina's second loan in her life and the first through Kiva. The first was with GGLS and was obtained through the group system. She discovered Hluvuku from some conversations with neighbors and friends. She has the dream to see her house finished and her children educated.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Albertina tem 36 anos e nasceu no distrito de Namaacha, distrito fronteriço com Swazilandia. Divorciada e mãe de 4 filhos com idades entre 15 anos o primeiro e estuda na 9ªClasse, 13 anos o segundo e estuda na 6ª classe, 9 anos o terceiro e estuda na 3ªclasse e 1 ano e 10 meses o ultimo. Albertina sustenta apenas a sua família que são os seus 4 filhos as vezes manda algum dinheiro para sua mãe para ajudar nas despesas. Albertina estudou até 6ªclasse e parou por causa da guerra e por não ter condições a sua família para lhe deixar na cidade para estudar. Albertina saiu do distrito de Namaacha através do seu casamento até o distrito de Boane onde vive até hoje em 1993. Vive numa casa própria. Albertina é monitora numa escolinha em Mafuiane um dos posto administrativo do distrito de Boane com um contracto indeterminado e trabalha a 16 anos nesta escola. Albertina aprendeu nesta mesma escola acumulando experiencia e mais tarde foi capacitada para melhorar as técnicas de ensino. Tem um salário mensal de 2500,00mt e poupas 1500,00mt. Para Albertina este é o segundo empréstimo na vida e primeiro na Hluvuku e Kiva, o primeiro foi na GGLS obtido no sistema de grupos. Albertina conheceu a Hluvuku a partir de conversas com vizinhos e amigas. Albertina tem como grande sonho ver a sua casa concluída e formados os seu filhos.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Mablé

texts.fr:
Ms. Mablé D. was born in Lomé on September 12, 1973. Married to Mr. Afantchao AGBOSSON, she has three children who go to school. Since 1998, her commerce has been in pagne (traditional print cloth), shoes, and bags in the Agoè district in the north of Lomé. Sometimes she sells her merchandise from district to district as a traveling saleswoman. She is a good entrepreneur who is on her sixth loan and who makes good on her payments. The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 20 bolts of pagnes, 2 boxes of shoes, and 15 tote bags.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame D. Mablé est née à Lomé le 12 septembre 1973. Mariée à monsieur AGBOSSON Afantchao elle à 03 enfants qui vont à l’école. Depuis 1998, elle exerce le commerce de pagne, de chaussures et de sac dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Parfois elle vend ses marchandises de quartier en quartier et donc ambulante. Elle est un bon entrepreneur qui est à son 6ème prêt et rembourse bien. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 pièces de pagne, 2 cartons d chaussures et 15 sacs de sortie.

loans.use: To buy pagnes, shoes, and tote bags

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Amisse Mahomed

texts.pt:
Amise was born in the province of Cabo Delgado in the city of Pemba in the northern part of Mozambique. He is 60 years old. He has been married for 20 years. He has 6 children and all of them still go to school. He supports his children plus one nephew who lives with him.

Amisse studied until the 9th grade in the old system until he geared up for the obligatory military service. He lives in his own home. Amisse receives a pension and has worked for the AMDE of Mozal for 2 years. He works from 7:00am until 3:30pm. He does not have employees at home. Amisse trained as a counselor in the ADPP in Matola, a course that lasted one year in 2002. He has 3 bank accounts and saves some money whenever he can. This is his third loan. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who were already clients, and he will use this loan to purchase construction materials. Amisse intends to finish his home so he can later open a commercial establishment.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Amisse nasceu na província de Cabo Delgado na cidade de Pemba ao Norte de Moçambique, tem 60 anos de idade. Vive maritalmente fazem 20 anos. Tem 6 filhos e todos ainda vão a escola. Sustenta os seus filhos mais um sobrinho que mora com ele. Amisse estudou até 9ªclasse do antigo sistema e para quando engrenou no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive numa casa própria. Amisse é pensionista e trabalha na AMDE da Mozal fazem 2 anos e tem horário que entra as 7:00h e despega as 15:30h. Não tem empregados em casa. Amisse é formado em matéria de conselheiro na ADPP da Matola curso que durou um ano em 2202. tem 3 contas bancaria que poupa algum dinheiro sempre que poder. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo e conheceu Hluvuku através de amigos que já eram clientes da Hluvuku e o empréstimo usará para compra de material de construção. Amisse pretende concluir a sua casa mais cedo para tarde abrir um estabelecimento comercial.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Luganda Kulya Women's Group

texts.en:
34-year-old Aisha N. is the leader and secretary of Luganda Kulya women’s group. She is a tailor and has a shop selling clothes made by her as well as those bought from Kampala, the capital city of Uganda. She has had the business for 9 years and now she has opened up a learning section where she has six girls as students whom she is teaching the same trade. All the girls are school drop-outs due to lack of school fees, and she has divided them into two sections; a day class of three students and an evening class of three students. This she does because of the lack of enough sewing machines to cater for all of them. Right now she is faced with a challenge that four more girls very badly want to join, and she hopes to at least buy two extra machines once given a loan.

Her dream, if she could get enough money, would be to buy as many machines as she wants because in Kasangati, her village, many children, especially girls, are dropping out of school due to poverty. Hence, some fathers favor boys over girls for education and most girls end up in early marriages. If one gets a chance, she learns tailoring, and this has saved so many from the deadly disease, AIDS.

The biggest challenge Aisha is facing is all her students left school because of lack of school fees, yet they have to pay some small amount to study at her place. Getting this small amount of money out of them is a problem, and the only thing she can do is be patient with them to the extent that even one had to pay her after completing the course and starting to work for herself. It is determination and hard work that are driving Aisha. She is married with 3 children aged 12, 9, and 5. She needs a loan to buy another two sewing machines.

loans.use: Aisha Namirimu needs a loan to buy two more sewing machines for her students.

loans.name: Francisco Tomás

texts.pt:
Francisco is 51 years old and a native of Manjacaze, a district of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. He is married and the father of 5 children, 2 are already adults, and the the 3 younger ones live with him. Two are in school and are 15 and 5 years old respectively. The youngest is 3. Besides his family he supports two stepchildren and his mother who lives in the province of Gaza.

Francisco studied until the 7th grade and did not continue because there were no more classes in the district where they lived. As soon as he stopped his schooling he was submitted to obligatory military service that lasted from 1974 through 1987. Francisco married for the first time in 1983 and separated in 1987 with 3 children. He married again and has 2 children with his second wife.

Francisco works for the Olympic Committee. He lives in his own home. He has worked for the Olympic Committee since 1999 as security and works 16 hour days with 2 days off. Francisco learned the security service while in the army. He has a monthly salary of 2,151MT and an army pension of 3,258MT. He is not saving any money because he is investing in the construction of a house. He has given himself the challenge of finishing his house.

This will be his third loan through Hluvuku and his first loan with Kiva which he intends to use to purchase construction materials for his home. The first two loans were also used to buy materials for construction since only one did not allow him to finish.

Francisco says thank you for the loan that is going to help him realize his dream. In the future he intends to build a home for his children and improve the condition and well being of his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco tem 51 anos de idade e é natural de Manjacaze um distrito da província de Gaza no sul de Moçambique. Casado e pai de 5 filhos, sendo dois ja maiores os três últimos vive com eles e os dois mais velhos já vão a escola de 15 e 5 anos respectivamente e o menor de 3 anos. Para alem da sua família sustenta mais dois enteados e a sua mãe que se encontra na província de Gaza. Francisco estudou até 7ªClasse e não continuou por que no distrito que vivia não tinha as classe seguintes. Logo que ficou sem estudar foi submetido ao serviço militar obrigatório que durou desde 1974 até 1987. Francisco casou-se pela primeira vez em 1983 e veio a separar desta mulher em 1987 e tiveram 3 filhos e casou-se novamente e tem com esta nova esposa 2 filhos. Francisco trabalha no Comité Olímpico. Francisco vive numa casa própria. Francisco é trabalhador do Comité Olímpico desde 1999 como segurança e trabalha 16 horas e sujeito a folgas de 2 dias. Francisco aprendeu o serviço de segurança na tropa. Francisco tem um salário mensal de 2151,00mt e pensão reforma de tropa de 3258,00mt e não poupa nenhum dinheiro porque está investindo na construção da casa. Francisco coloca como desafio a conclusão da casa. Este será o terceiro empréstimo do Francisco na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o qual pretende comprar material de construção para sua casa. Os dois primeiros também usou o dinheiro para compra de material de construção uma vez que uma só vez não seria capaz de concluir. Francisco diz graça ao empréstimo que está vendo o seu sonho a realizar-se. Francisco pretende futuramente construir uma casa para seus filhos e melhorar as condições de bem estar da família.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a 45-year-old hard-working lady and a mother of one son. She has been in business for the past ten years. She runs  a restaurant. . She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Luis Bulane

texts.pt:
Luis is 41 years old and he is from Mopeia, in the province of Zambeia, located in central Mozambique. He is married and has 6 children. The oldest is 15 years old and she is in the 6th grade; then there are the twin brothers who are 12 years old and attending the 3rd grade; the fourth child is 6 years old and enrolled in the 2nd grade and finally the youngest is 3 years old. He supports his children and his wife. Due to financial problems, Luis went to school only until the 9th grade. Luis left Mopeia to attend IAB (Boane´s Agrarian Institute), located in Boane in the province of Maputo. There he was able to purchase a piece of land where he is building his home. Luis is an agrarian technician and he has been working as a permanent employee for 10 years. His shifts are from 7:30am to 2:00pm. He learned his skill at the agrarian technical school. His monthly wages are 2713,00mt and he cannot save anything from it. This will be his second loan from Hluvuku and his first through Kiva. He found out about it from friends and he has never requested loans from other institutions. His major projects are to make improvements to his home and to buy furniture for it.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Luis de 41 anos de idade e natural de Mopeia na província da Zambezia no Centro de Moçambique, casado maritalmente e pai de 6 filhos com idades entre primeira 15 anos e anda na 6ª classe, os segundos (gémeos) 2 rapazes com 12anos andam na 3ªclasse, a terceira com 9 anos anda na 3ªclasse, a quarta com 6 anos anda na 2ªclasse e a ultima com 3 anos. Sustenta apenas a sua família que são os filhos e sua esposa. Luis estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por dificuldades financeiras. Luis saiu de Mopeia província da Zambezia para IAB (instituto Agrário de Boane) distrito de Boane província do Maputo por causa de estudos onde chegou a comprar um terreno onde está a construir a sua casa. Assim Luis vive numa casa própria. Luis é técnico Agrário e funcionário permanente a 10 anos e trabalha das 7:30 as 14:00h. Aprendeu a fazer o seu trabalho na escola de formação agraria. Tem como salário mensal de 2713,00mt e não consegue poupar nada. Este é o segundo empréstimo para Luis na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. E nunca pediu empréstimo noutras instituições. Conhece a Hluvuku a partir de amigos. Tem como projecto melhorar a sua casa e mobilar a mesma.

loans.use: Purchase Construction Material

loans.name: Maria Inês De Sousa

texts.pt:
Maria is 24 years old and she is from the city of Matola, an urban district of the province of Maputo. She is a single mother of a 2-year-old son and she does not support anybody else. Maria completed a high-school program with focus in teaching skills. She spent part of her childhood -- until she was 11 years old, in a live-in school called Agrarian Institute of Umbeluze. Then she moved to the 16th Kilometer where she lived until 2006. Afterwards, she relocated to her own home in Boane´s zone #3. Maria has been teaching for the past 5 years. A graduate from the IMAP (Instituto de Magistério Primário da Manhiça, Elementary School Education Institute of Manhiça), she has been working since 2003 as a teacher and her working hours are Mondays through Fridays from 12:30pm to 5:40pm. She has not been able to save any money because she spends it all on home improvements. This will be Maria's third loan from Hluvuku and the fourth in her life. The first one was obtained from the credit corporation Tchuma in the amount of 18.000,00mt which was used to purchase home appliances. The first two loans from Hluvuku were in the amount of 15.000,00mt each and they were used to purchase construction materials for her home. This third loan will be applied to buy additional construction material. She is doing major work to her home and it needs to be done in phases. Maria wants to pay the loan early so that she can request another loan to finalize the construction work to her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Maria de 24 anos, natural da cidade da Matola distrito urbano da província de Maputo. Solteira e mãe de um filho de dois anos e não sustenta mais ninguém. Maria fez o ensino médio em professorado, a sua infância passou vivendo no lar escolar do Instituto Agrário de Umbeluze até aos 11 anos de idade depois passou para Km 16 até 2006 onde saiu para Boane no bairro 3 e vive numa casa própria. Maria é professora a cinco anos, onde trabalha das 12:30 as 17:40H da segunda a sexta-feira, foi formada no Imap da Manhiça e desde 2003 trabalha como professora. Não consegue fazer poupança por que sempre está investindo na melhoria da casa. Maria este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e o quarto na vida, o primeiro foi na cooperativa de credito Tchuma no valor de 18.000,00mt qual usou para compra de eletrodomésticos. Na Hluvuku os dois primeiros foram de 15.000,00mt ambos usou para compra de material de construção para sua casa. O terceiro no valor de 23.000,00mt pretende comprar ainda o material de construção uma vez que a sua obra é grande e está a construir por fases. Assim Maria pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo para a conclusão da sua casa. Maria de 24 anos, natural da cidade da Matola distrito urbano da província de Maputo. Solteira e mãe de um filho de dois anos e não sustenta mais ninguém. Maria fez o ensino médio em professorado, a sua infância passou vivendo no lar escolar do Instituto Agrário de Umbeluze até aos 11 anos de idade depois passou para Km 16 até 2006 onde saiu para Boane no bairro 3 e vive numa casa própria. Maria é professora a cinco anos, onde trabalha das 12:30 as 17:40H da segunda a sexta-feira, foi formada no Imap da Manhiça e desde 2003 trabalha como professora. Não consegue fazer poupança por que sempre está investindo na melhoria da casa. Maria este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e o quarto na vida, o primeiro foi na cooperativa de credito Tchuma no valor de 18.000,00mt qual usou para compra de eletrodomésticos. Na Hluvuku os dois primeiros foram de 15.000,00mt ambos usou para compra de material de construção para sua casa. O terceiro no valor de 23.000,00mt pretende comprar ainda o material de construção uma vez que a sua obra é grande e está a construir por fases. Assim Maria pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo para a conclusão da sua casa.

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Antonio Simião

texts.pt:
Antonio was born in Vilanculos, district of the province of Inhambane. He is 24 years old and a single father of a 1-year-old daughter. He went to school up until the 7th grade but he had to drop out so that he could work more hours, earn more money and get married to his wife. Besides his family he is also responsible for his brother that lives in his home. Antonio left Vilanculos with an uncle that lived in Namaacha, a village that borders Swaziland, to look for work. He worked for his uncle for 2 years earning only 150,00mt. This very reduced amount was not enough for much and, in 2002, Antonio decided to start his own business. Using money he had saved from his salary, he left his uncle home and rented a room where he still lives. Antonio has been in the retail business for 6 years, working between the hours of 7:00am and 9:50pm when students are dismissed from school. His best selling products are radios, cds and cell phone chargers. His monthly revenue is 2500,00mt and he is able to set aside 800,00mt from that. His business has grown because it satisfies his clients' needs. This is the second loan Antonio requests from Hluvuku and the first through Kiva. The first one was in the amount of 5000,00mt and it was used to purchase home appliances that were sold at his establishment. The loan was repaid without any problems. He is requesting 7000,00mt this time to expand his merchandise variety.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

António nasceu em Vilanculos um distrito da província de Inhambane é solteiro e pai de uma filha com 1 ano de idade, tem 24 anos de idade e estudou até 7ªclasse teve que parar porque precisava de juntar dinheiro para poder se casar com a sua esposa e o tempo de trabalho não era suficiente. Alem da sua família António responsabiliza-se pelo seu irmão mais novo que vive em sua casa. António sai de Vilanculos com o seu tio que vivia em Namaacha vila fronteriça com a Swazilandia a procura de emprego. Trabalhou para o seu tio durante 2 anos onde só ganhava mensalmente 150,00mt valor este que não chegava para nada. Em 2002 António resolve fazer o seu próprio negocio com o dinheiro que havia guardado do salário saiu em casa do tio e alugou uma dependência onde ele vive até hoje. António exerce actividade comercial a 6 anos onde tem um horário de trabalho das 7:00h as 21:50 hora em que os alunos da noite despegam. Os produtos que tem mais saída são ( Rádios, Discos e Recargas de telemóveis ). Tem lucros mensal de 2500,00mt e deste consegue poupar 800,00mt mensalmente. O negocio do António está melhorar porque consegue satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes. Este é o segundo empréstimo do António no Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro foi de 5000,00mt e uso o dinheiro para compra de electrodomésticos para revender em seu estabelecimento e conseguiu pagar sem nenhum problema e pede este de 7000,00mt para ampliar a sua mercadoria.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand stock.

loans.name: Artimiza Fabiao M.

texts.pt:
Artimiza was born in Gaza, is 42 years old, is married, and went to school until fourth grade in the old system, when conditions did not permit her to continue her studies. Mother of one 14-year-old child who is in ninth grade, she is also responsible for her nephew and her parents, who live in Gaza. She sends them 500mt [meticals] every three weeks. In 1980 she moved from the Gaza province to Maputo's Namaacha district to live with her brother who works in the district. In 1992 she married a man who lives with her brother in his own house.

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Artimiza decided to run her own business. Today she rents two stalls, one in the Namaacha town market and the other in the Boane market. She has two employees who work from 8:00am to 10:00pm and each earn 800mt monthly. The most popular products are 2M national beer, purchased for 230mt per box and sold for 300mt, and box wine stocked at 960mt and sold at 1200mt. Her monthly earnings range from 3000 to 4000mt depending on the seasonal weather and weekends. This allows her to save 1000mt per month.

This is her second loan with Hluvuku [MFI Field Partner] and first with Kiva. The first loan was for 10,000mt that was used to buy merchandise for her stall. She paid back the loan early and requested this second one for the same purpose. As soon as Artimiza finishes this loan, she intends to request a third to build a new stall and make a wall for her home.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Artimiza nasceu em Gaza, tem 42 anos de idade e é casada, estudou até 4ªClasse do antigo sistema teve que parar pois as condições já não lhe permitiam continuar mais com os estudos. Mãe de 1 filho de 14 anos de idade que esta frequentar 9ªclasse, responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho e seus pais que vivem em Gaza mandando-lhes 500,00mt em cada 3 meses. Em 1980 mudou se da província de Gaza para Maputo distrito de Namaacha para viver com o seu irmão que trabalha neste distrito e em 1992 ela casou se com o marido que vive com ele em sua casa própria.

Artimiza para poder ajudar o seu marido as despesas da casa decide fazer negocio hoje aluga duas barracas, uma cita no mercado da vila da Namaacha e outra no mercado de Boane. Tem dois empregados e trabalham das 8:00h as 22:00h e auferem mensalmente 800,00mt por pessoa. Os produtos com mais saída são as bebidas nomeadamente: 2M Cerveja nacional adquirida por 230,00mt a caixa e vende a 300,00mt, vinho a caixa adquire por 960,00mt e vende por 1200,00mt. Tem rendimento mensal de 3000,00mt a 4000,00mt dependendo da estação do tempo ou final de semana, consegue poupar por mês 1000,00mt.

Este é o segundo empréstimo da Artimiza na Hluvuku e o primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro empréstimo foi de 10000,00mt qual usou para compra de mercadoria para sua barraca e conseguiu pagar antes do prazo estabelecido e pede este segundo para o mesmo fim. Assim que Artimiza concluir pretende pedir o terceiro para construir a sua barraca e fazer um murro em sua casa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to increase her inventory

loans.name: Julio Malaulane

texts.pt:
Júlio was born in Namaacha, on the border with Swaziland. He studied through ninth grade, when conditions did not permit him to continue. He is single and the father of seven children: the oldest are 16-year-old twins, the second is 12, the third 9, the fourth 7, the fifth 5, and the youngest only 1 year old. Júlio is responsible for even more, sending food and money to his parents monthly, as he lives with their first two children.

Júlio began working in 1986 as a driver at the Hotel Pequenos Libombo, holding that position for eight years. The salary was low and did not manage to cover the household expenses. He therefore decided to quit working for his employer and to start his own business of selling fish in the informal market. He was able to buy a car which has helped him greatly, even today. Júlio moved out of his parents' house when he was able to do so. Now he has his own business at his house and an employee who makes 1500 meticals (mt) per month working from 7:00am to 3:00pm. Júlio earns 8400mt per month, making 420mt per sack and using up 20 sacks per month. He is not able to save anything because there are many expenses.

This is Júlio's second loan with Hluvuku [MFI Field Partner] and his first with Kiva. The first was for 10,000mt and was used to buy construction material to finish his work. He succeeded in paying off the loan before it was due. Júlio then returned and requested this loan of 20,000mt which he will use to buy brick-building material. Júlio believes that this loan will improve his business because it will allow him to meet the needs of his clients. For Júlio, his big dream is to increase his business and to send his children through school.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Júlio nasceu em Namaacha uma que faz fronteira com a Swazilandia, solteiro, estudou até 9ªClasse, teve que parar de continuar com os estudos pois as condições não permitiam para que ele continuasse. É pai de 7 filhos sendo os primeiros gémeos e tem 16 anos, segundo tem 12 anos, o terceiro 9 anos, o quarto 7 anos, o quinto 5 anos e o mais novo tem 1 ano apenas. Júlio responsabiliza-se mais ainda pelos seus pais enviando comida e dinheiro mensalmente pois este vivem com os seus dois primeiros filhos.

Júlio começou a trabalhar em 1986 como motorista no Hotel Pequenos Libombo tendo exercido a função durante 8 anos. O salário era pouco não chegava para cobrir com as despesas da casa dai decide deixar de trabalhar no patrão abrindo o seu próprio negocio de venda de peixe no mercado informal e conseguiu comprou um carro que lhe vem ajudando muito até hoje. Julio saiu da casa dos pais quando se juntou e hoje tem seu próprio estaleiro em sua casa e tem um trabalhador que aufere mensalmente um valor de 1500,00mt trabalhando das 7:00h as 15:00h. Tem lucrado mensalmente 8400,00mt sabendo que num saco ganha 420,00mt e gasta 20 sacos por mes, não consegue poupar nenhum valor pois tem muitas despesas.

Este é o segundo empréstimo do Júlio na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro foi de 10000,00mt e usou para comprar material de construção para concluir a sua obra. Ele conseguiu pagar o empréstimo antes do prazo determinado. Assim o Júlio volta a solicitar este empréstimo de 20000,00mt que usara o dinheiro para comprar material para fabrico de Blocos de cimento. Júlio acha que com este empréstimo vai melhorar o seu negocio porque vai conseguir satisfazer as necessidades da sua clientela. Para Júlio constitui grande sonho ter mais estaleiros e formar os seus filhos.

loans.use: Sale of construction material and production of cement bricks

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married and earns income running a small business where he sells seeds, flowers, plants and fertilizers in the local market of Vasilyevka. Vitalyi is a skillful manager who knows how to survive in an aggressive market environment. He has been in this business for over 4 years, and his current income is about US$2,000. 

Vitalyi’s consistency, perseverance in work and commitment to his business have ensured the growth and success of his small venture. He always treats people with respect which is one of the most effective methods of providing his business with customers which Vitalyi has a unique ability to reach and maintain. Moreover, Vitalyi is always willing to help his clients with business tips which oftentimes is something much needed. He is very hard-working and finds time not only to do his business, but also to take care of his beautiful garden which is his hobby. At the moment, Vitalyi is requesting a loan of US$875 to increase the stock of goods for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya sells leather goods in one of the markets in Mukachevo, Western Ukraine. She has always wanted to be self-employed and decided to try her luck in commerce 7 years ago. Nataliya’s business has grown since then, and she is now making about US$500 a month.  

Nataliya is married and has two children. She manages to balance her business and family responsibilities quite successfully. Currently, one of her main goals is to expand her venture by purchasing a new vending facility and stocking it with inventory. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$1,075.

loans.use: Purchase of a new vending facility

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has a little daughter. She owns a business selling food products in a store called “ABC”. Her business is growing fast, and Irina is able to sell large volumes of groceries that are always in demand. Doing her best to succeed in the business, she is now able to make about US$300 of net profit each month. 

Irina started her venture two years ago and, ever since, has been working hard to develop her business. Still, she would like to further increase the efficiency of the business and believes that additional financial assistance will help her in achieving this goal. Irina is therefore asking for a loan which she will use to increase the stock of goods for the current busy summer season.

loans.use: Purchase of a stock of groceries for sale

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is a widow. She has raised two sons, Alexander and Vasilyi, all by herself. Oksana works hard to provide for the needs of her family. Sometimes, she has to work long hours, running her men and women’s clothing sales business in the central market of Pavlograd. Oksana has been in this business for 15 years and presently is able to make about US$600 in net profit, as well as has goods in the inventory worth US$4,000.

Oksana has a flawless credit history with Nadiya Ukraine - she has always been very reliable in paying back her loans. Oksana also has talent in dealing with clients. She is cheerful and friendly to every potential buyer who comes to her kiosk. Currently, one of her business goals is to purchase summer footwear for sale. The profit that Oksana hopes to make she will invest in a much needed remodeling of her house.

loans.use: Purchase of summer footwear

loans.name: Isidra De La Concepc

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega, Ms. Isidra Gonzáles has been making and selling tortillas for a living for 10 years.

She is a single-mother with one son under her care. Despite the fact that the tortilla business is her sole source of income, she has managed to give her son everything that is necessary for him to grow up properly. Now, however, she needs to invest in purchasing the ingredients needed to make her tortillas. For this reason, she is seeking Ceprodel’s support so that she can obtain a loan, thus allowing her to continue to raise her son and cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Isidra Gonzáles se dedica a su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales las comercializa en su tramo propio dedicándose a este negocio desde hace 10 años.

Es madre soltera de un pequeño hijo y a pesar de que su único ingreso es el obtenido por la venta de las tortillas, ha logrado brindarle a su hijo las condiciones necesarias para su propio desarrollo. Hoy en día la necesidad que ella atraviesa es que necesita invertir en la materia prima para elaborar las tortillas. Por esta razón busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimiento de su hijo y las necesidades de su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients needed to make tortillas

loans.name: Nicolaza De La Conce

texts.es:
Mrs. Nicolaza A. owns her own mini market in the city of Chinandega, where she offers her customers all types of groceries.

She is the mother of two school-age children for whom she works arduously in order to provide them with an education and better living conditions.

Now she urgently needs to obtain funds in order to purchase goods. For this reason, she is turning to Ceprodel in order to receive a loan that will allow her to continue selling groceries in her market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Nicolaza A. se dedica al negocio de pulpería teniendo su propio establecimiento en la ciudad de Chinandega donde atiende a sus clientes ofreciéndole todo tipo de de productos de pulpería.

Es madre de dos hijos en edades escolares y su arduo trabajo es para brindarles mejores condiciones de vida y desarrollo en sus estudios.

La necesidad que ella atraviesa hoy en día es la urgencia de obtener el recurso económico para la compra de los productos . Por esto es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito para que de esta manera continúe comercializando sus productos en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es:
Mrs. Sandra G. runs a general store inside the Santa Ana market in Chinandega. Ever since she started her business, she has focused on improving it in order to pay for the household expenses.

She now needs to invest in purchasing goods, so she is looking for Ceprodel’s support so that she can obtain a loan in order to buy those goods. It is important to note that she has been a responsible member of Ceprodel, having repaid all her previous loans on time and according to the terms established by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sandra Gonzáles se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en la ciudad de Chinandega en el mercado Santa Ana de esta localidad. Desde que inició su negocio se ha preocupado por mejorarlo para llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

Hoy en día con la necesidad de invertir en los productos, busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de sus productos. Es de necesidad destacar que ella ha sido fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo cancelado todos los créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido en la institución.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Adama Moussa

texts.fr:
Mr. Adama Moussa Koné, 38, lives with his two wives and his child in the Hérémakono North neighborhood of Bougouni (Sikasso Region in Mali). He was the manager of the transit house for Save the Children USA Mali for 5 years. Having lost his job to a reduction in force, he decided to open a little campground for a clientele composed of travelers and missionaries coming from elsewhere in Mali. In order to equip his campground, the loan will permit him to buy three mattresses, 1 gas cooker, and 8 chairs. He is expecting a monthly profit of about US$ 200. With this profit, he intends to make the payments on the loan, upgrade his business, and also cater for his needs and the needs of his family.

In future, Mr. Koné foresees that he will expand his campground so as to provide room for more customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Adama Moussa Koné est agé de 38 ans et vit avec ses deux femmes et son enfant dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni ( Région de Sikasso Republique du Mali). Il a été gestionaire de la case de passage de Save the Children USA Mali pendant cinq ans. Ayant perdu son emploi pour des raisons structurelles, il décida d’ouvrir un petit campement de logement pour une clientèle composée de voyageurs et de missionnaires venant des autres localités du Mali. Afin d’équiper son campement, le crédit lui permettra d'acheter d' achéter 3 matelas,1 cuisinière à gaz et 8 chaises. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il compte payer les interêts du prêt, améliorer son entreprise mais aussi subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille.

Dans l’avenir Monsieur Koné envisage d’aggrandir son campement afin d’accueillir plus de clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of mattresses, chairs, and gas cooker

Achat de Matelas, Chaises et Cuisinière à gaz.

loans.name: Yanixia María

texts.es:
Ms. Yanixia S. is from Chinandega. She has been selling used clothing at the El Bisne market for 2 years. She has managed to improve her business space thanks to her efforts. Furthermore, she has also managed to cover the household expenses.

Ceprodel has been a pillar in the development of her business because the institution has provided her with loans that have improved it. It is important to note that she is now requesting a loan so that she can purchase clothing from her suppliers, thus allowing her to continue maintaining her household, which so needs her support to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Yanixia es originaria del departamento de Chinandega y labora en el Mercado El Bisne en su negocio de venta de ropa usada la cual posee desde hace 2 años. Ha logrado mejorar su local gracias a sus esfuerzos y además ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su desarrollo por lo que le ha proporcionado créditos para el mejoramiento de su negocio. Es necesario destacar que hoy en día solicita un crédito para comprar su mercadería a sus proveedores y así continuar manteniendo su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Flor De Retama Group

texts.es:
The Comunal Bank of Flor D. Retama is a bank recently started with 17 members. Some of them are friends, some only recently met, but all are very happy about starting their Comunal Bank. The members have different business such as the sale of groceries, cheese, clothes, pottery, glassware, drinks, plastic products, haberdashery, candy, food and also offer cosmetic services.

The members need different loan amounts, some of 300 soles (around $102 USD), some of 600 soles, making a total of 9,600 soles in loans for the Comunal Bank.

They will use their loans to purchase sugar, rice, vegetable, milk, meat, cheese, sodas, beer, noodles, sweaters, shirts, jackets, bags, candy, dyes and cosmetics. The members dream of having a fixed premises, expanding their businesses, of their children becoming professionals and of owning their own homes..

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Flor D. Retama es un banco que recién inicia con 17 socias, algunas D. ellas son amigas, otras recién se conocen, pero todas están con mucha alegría D. iniciar su Banco Comunal.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta abarrotes, quesos, ropas, locería, cristalería, bebidas, productos plásticos, mercería, golosinas, comida, también brindan servicios D. cosmetología.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,600 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, verduras, leche, carnes, quesos, gaseosas, cerveza, chompas, camisas, casacas, bolsas, galletas, caramelos, tintes, cosméticos.

Los sueños D. las socias es tener un local estable, ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una vivienda propia.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, vegetable, milk, meat, cheese, sodas, beer, noodles, sweaters, shirts, jackets, bags, candy, dyes and cosmetics

loans.name: Djidia ( Perseverance ) Group

texts.fr:
The women of Djidia Group, between 24 and 30 years of age and all married, live in polygamous families with an average of 4 children in the village of Koumantou, Bougouni Prefecture. The members of the group made each other 's acquaintance because they are neighbors and particpate in traditional group tasks together. As they trust each other, they decided to become members of the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. Djidia Group is on its third loan with Soro Yiriwaso and the preceding loans were reimbursed correctly.

They retail various small items (cocoyams, yams, cereals, locally manufactured soap, etc.), buying their inventories at the Koumantou market. They buy wholesale from providers coming from Sikasso. With this loan, each of them intends to buy 5-10 sacks of various yams and 4 sacks of cereals. Their sales, to an essentially female clientele, are made either at the Koumantou market or out of their homes. They plan on substantially increasing their profit with this loan, but also on diversifying their supply sources.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les femmes du groupe Djidia, agées de 24 à 30 ans et toutes mariées; vivent dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 4 enfants au village de Koumantou Préfecture de Bougouni . Les membres du groupe se sont connus en raison du voisinage et la participation commune aux activités associatives traditionnelles. Se faisant mutuellement confiance, elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le groupe Djidia est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prets précédents ont été bien remboursés.

Elles exercent le pétit commerce d’articles divers (Ignames, patates, céreales, savon local etc) et s’approvisoinnent dans le marché de Koumantou. Elles achètent en gros auprès des forrains venant de Sikasso. Avec ce prêt elles comptent achéter chacune 5 à 10 sacs de divers tubercules, 4 sacs de céreales. Les ventes sont effectuées soit au marché de Koumantou soit à la maison à une clientèle locale feminine. Elles envisagent augmenter substantiellement leur profit avec ce prêt mais aussi diversifier leurs sources d’approvisionnement.

loans.use:
Purchase of yams, cereals, and various other articles for re-sale

Achat de Tubrecules de Céreales et de divres autres articles

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kadia D., 40, lives with her husband, his seven children, and her co-spouse in a polygamous family in the Hérémakono North neighborhood of Bougouni (Bougouni Prefecture, Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

Her business consists in selling cream of millet and she learned it from her grandmother. With 7 years' experience, she is very good at making this product and has a faithful and regular clientele. Cream of millet (locally known as "dèguè") is generally sold in the market of Bougouni, but also door-to-door. Millet flour is steamed then sieved to obtain little grains that are delicious to eat. These grains are mixed with milk and sugar to obtain cream of millet (Dèguè). Her clientele is generally made up of neighbors, tradespeople, and some folks who love the dish and come from other neighborhoods in the city.

She is on her fifth loan through Soro Yiriwaso and all the preceding ones were correctly reimbursed. Her present loan will be used to buy 1 ton of millet, 100 kg of sugar, and 15 liters of fresh milk daily. These items will be purchased in Bougouni. She hopes to make a profit of US$ 120 per month with which she will make the payments on the loan and help her husband to cover family living expenses (education, food, health, etc.).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Kadia D. a 40 ans et vit avec son mari, ses 7 enfants et sa coépouse dans une famille polygame au quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni (Préfecture de Bougouni Région de Sikasso République du Mali)

Elle mène l’activité de préparation de vente de la crème de mil et l’ a appris avec sa grande mère. Avec une expérience de 7 ans, elle maîtise bien cette activité et dispose d’une clientèle fidèle et regulière. La vente de la crème de mil(dèguè) se fait generalement au marché de bougouni mais aussi de facon ambulante. La farine de mil est soumise à la vapeur et tamisée pour obtenir des petits grains delicieux à la consommation. Ces grains sont mélangés avec le lait, le sucre pour obtenir la crème de mil (Dèguè). Sa clientèle est généralement composée de voisins, de marchands, et de certains gourmets venant des autres quartiers de la ville.

Elle est à son cinquième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Son prêt actuel sera utilisé pour achéter une tonne de mil, 100 Kilos de sucre et 15 litres de lait frais quotidiennement.. Ces articles sont achétés à Bougouni. Elle compte realiser un bénéfice de 50 000FCFA par mois avec lequel elle paiera les intérêts du prêt et aidera son mari à assurer les dépences de la famille (Education Nourriture Santé etc)

loans.use:
Purchase of fresh milk, sugar and millet

Achat du lait frais, sucre et mil.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is forty-four years old. She is married and has three children currently in school.

Christiana sells kenkey with sauce, made from pork meat in her neighborhood. Kenkey is one of the most popular local Ghanaian dishes. It is served in restaurants and drinking bars. This is the meal that Christiana proudly serves to her customers.

She wants to use the loan to buy more maize, pork, and vegetables to overcome the price hikes and the current food crisis. She believes this will provide her with an adequate income to finance her children’s education.

She belongs to a community group called "Blessing Trust Group" where group members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

Christiana is in this photograph wearing a brown and white striped top. The photo was taken at a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy food in bulk: maize, pork, and vegetables.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Mr. Moussa Koné, 28, is single and has no children. He lives with his uncle in the Hérémakono-North neighborhood of Bougouni. He stopped school at a very young age to learn photography with his cousin for 5 years.

With 7 years' experience, Mr. Moussa Koné is very knowledgeable in this business. Since he has a photography studio on the side of the international road between Mali and the Ivory Coast, his clientele is continually growing. Besides photography, there is also a lot of demand for Play Station. To acquire this equipment, Mr. Koné decided to look into additional financing through the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan of US$ 475, he intends to buy a professional camera and a television for pay-as-you-go Play Station.

His clientele is composed of city people and rural folks, in as far as photography is concerned. For Play Station, the clientele is school-age children.

He expects to make a monthly profit of US$ 180 with which he will make payments on the loan and contribute to family living expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Moussa Koné est un célibataire sans enfant de 28 ans qui vit chez son oncle dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni. Il abandonna l’école dès son jeune âge au profit de la Photographie qu’il a appris avec son cousin et cela pendant 5 ans.

Avec une experience de 7 ans, Monsieur Moussa Koné maîtrise cette activité dans son détail et dans sa specificité. Disposant d’un studio photo au bord de la route internationale reliant le Mali à la république de Cote d’Ivoire, sa clientèle est en forte croissance. En plus de la photo, la demande de Jeux Play Station est forte.
