Talbi N. lives in Vahdat. She is married and has 7 children. Despite the large family size they live together very happily. Talbi raises her children and runs her household. She own a dairy cow and would like to purchase another one in order to produce more milk and to sell the extra milk. This will help her to earn an additional income and to help her husband in supporting the family. Talbi would like to take out an 8 month loan to purchase the cow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Назарова Талби жительница города Вахдат . Замужем имеет семерых детей. Занимается воспитанием детей и разводит домашнее хозяйство. То есть она имеет корову и хочет купить еще одну , чтобы получать молоко и продавать лишнее. Это поможет получать дополнительный доход и помогать мужу в обеспечении семьи. Для этого она планирует получить кредит со сроком в 8 месяцев.Не смотря на то , что у них очень большая семья они живут очень дружно и весело.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ashurmo.

texts.ru:
Ashurmo Z. lives in the city of Vahdat. She lives with her family and is 43 years old. She has a husband and has 3 children. She is a housewife and is engaged in animal sales, like many other citizens in the countryside. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She wants to buy another bull to fatten up and to sell it closer to Autumn for more money. This will give her additional and her family additional earnings. To buy this bull she needs to receive a loan and that is why she has asked Kiva for help. She plans to extinguish the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Зиеева Ашурмо жительница города Вахдат . Живет со своей семьей. Ей 43 года , она замужем и имеет троих детей. Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством , как и многие жители сельской местности. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже пять лет. Хочет купить еще одного бычка , для того , чтобы откормить и ближе к осени продать по более высокой цене. Это даст дополнительный заработок для нее и ее семьи. Для того , чтобы купить бычка ей нужно получить кредит и поэтому рна обратилась к нам. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Saiali.

texts.ru:
Saiali G. is 36 years old and is married with 3 children. She is involved in the sewing of the traditional dress. Saiali works from home, and lives in the city of Vahdat. For the past time being she has had a lot of orders and has many students, therefore she needs to buy another sewing machine. For this reason she has planned to receive a loan. This loan will help her increase production and increase revenue for her business. She plans to extinguish the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Гаюрова Сайали 36 лет , замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Шьет на дому. Живет в городе Вахдат. Последнее время у нее много заказов и много учеников, поэтому ей требуется купить швейную машину дополнительно. Для этого она решила получить кредит . Это поможет ей увеличить объем продукции и увеличить доход своего дела. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Hikmatrullo.

texts.ru:
Hikmatrullo M. lives in the Gissar area. He is involved with the trading of food. He owns a store a the local area market. He has been involved with this type of business for 25 years. He wants to increase commodity circulation so that he can change the assortment of his goods. To accomplish this he has planned to take out a loan and repay it within 12 months. Hikmatrullo is married and has 4 children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Мирзоев Хикматулло прожвает в районе Гиссар. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет магазин на рынке района . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 25 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборот для того , чтобы изменить ассортимент товара. Для этого он запланировал получить кредит со сроком в 12 месяцев. Хикматулло женат и имеет 4 детей.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Koy

texts.en: Koy O., age 39, works as a housewife looking after her children and cooking food for her whole family. Her husband raises pigs for resale. His business has been around for about eight years and he makes approximately $4 per day. The couple has eight children, two of whom are married and no longer stay at home; two others are employed by a garment factory, earning around $3 each per day. The family needs to purchase a motorbike to use as transportation and is requesting a loan to cover the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nurbibi

texts.ru:
Nurbibi Rajaabova lives in the area Gissar. She lives with her family and is married with 3 children. Her husband has traveled to Russia to earn money. Nurbibi works as a waitress in the dining room/ restaurant area. Other than this Nurbibi trades eggs in her free time. She brings the goods from the Shakhrinau area, buying them from a factory. For this business she plans to receive a loan. She wants to develop her business a little. She plans to extinguish the loan within the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Раджабова Нурбиби проживает в районе Гиссар. Проживает со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки. Сама же Нурбиби работает официанткой в столовой района. Кроме того в свободное от работы время занимается торговлей яиц. Привозит товар из района Шахринау , покупая на фабрике . Для этого бизнеса и планирует получить кредит. Хочет немного развить свой бизнес. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Chhen P., age 53, has a business arranging the wedding ceremonies in the village. She knows local singers and has all the equipment and supplies needed to celebrate, such as tables and chairs. Her business has been operating for five years and on average she makes around $5 per day of profit. Her husband of 25 years works as a teacher in the village and makes $2 per day. This couple has nine children, six of whom are married and no longer live at home; the rest are employed and sometimes help their parents with work. To allow Mrs. Chhen’s business to handle larger parties or wedding ceremonies, she is requesting a loan to help her purchase more tables and chairs.

loans.use: To purchase more tables, chairs, plates and etc...

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em N., aged 27, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province. She runs a business which sells a variety of vegetables in the local market. On average, she makes $2.50 per day. Her husband, Chan Sothear, pictured with the old motorbike he going to change, is a motor-taxi driver, normally earning around $5 each day. They have two children, both of whom are students. The old motorbike uses a lot of gas and often needs repair, so he would like a loan help to replace an old and unreliable motorbike.

loans.use: To replace an old and unreliable motorbike

loans.name: Path

texts.en: Path H., age 41, is a true entrepreneur working in the Prey Veng province. She sells firewood, typically making $3 each day, and she is supported by her husband who works as a policeman. She has seven children, three of whom are married and don't live at home; the other four children are not married and do different work to help support the family. To expand Mrs. Path’s business, she would like to take out a loan of $500 to purchase more firewood for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood for resale

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch C. works at a garment factory, earning $3 per day. Her husband, Mrs. Kheav Sokhon, 34, works for a mobile phone company and earns about $5 per day. They have one child and live in Kork Khleang Village, Phnom Penh City.

They would like to attempt new ventures to increase their income. They request a loan of $1,000 to purchase oxen to breed and sell. The loan will allow them to increase their household income and thereby improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase oxen to breed and sell

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem S., age 45, lives in Prey Veng province with her husband and four young children. She and her husband work selling stone to the villagers, which they purchase from the workers who take stone from the mountains. Their customers then make the stones into different kinds of basic equipment, for example, a small grinding mill. On average, this couple makes $5 each day. To ensure a steady supply of stones for resale, they are requesting this loan to allow them to purchase more stones.

loans.use: To purchase more stone for resale

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Ms. N’Diaye Fatoumata A. is a 60-year-old married women and the mother of eight children. She resides in the 2nd district of Ségou with her husband (retired) and her children.

Never having attended school, Ms. N’Diaye Fatoumata A. was initiated into commerce at a tender age by her grandmother. She has a good sense for business, thanks to this long accumulated experience. After six loans (in groups) with Soro Yiriwaso that were all paid back correctly, she is on her first individual loan. She gets her inventory locally in Ségou and intends to use this loan to buy raw materials: 10 boxes of powdered juice, 5 fifty-kilo sacks of sugar, 1 packet of plastic bags, 1 sack of dah (dried hibiscus flowers), 1 sack of tamarind, 11 packets of vanilla, and 1 sack of ginger.

She enjoys a great reputation in her business and receives orders especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, etc....) In addition, she makes sales from home to a diverse customer base.

With this loan, she expects to realize a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA that she intends to use to bolster her business and to initiate another business (the stocking up and marketing of cereal products).

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mme N’Diaye Fatoumata A. est une femme mariée de 60 ans, mère de 8 enfants et résidant au 2ème quartier de Ségou avec son mari( à la retraite) et ses enfants.

N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Mme N’Diaye Fatoumata A. a été initié aux activités commerciales depuis sa tendre enfance par sa grande mère. Elle a un grand ses des affaires grâce à cette longue expérience accumulée. Après 6 prêts (en solidaire de groupe) avec Soro Yiriwaso tous correctement remboursés ; elle est à son premier prêt individuel Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou et compte utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat de matières premières : 10 cartons de jus en poudre, 5 sacs de sucre de 50 kg ,1 paquet de sachet plastique, 1 sac de dah ,1 sac de tamarin 11 paquets de vanille et 1 sac zinzimbre .

Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit des commandes surtout lors des cérémonies (Mariages, baptême etc.…). En plus elle vend quotidiennement chez elle à domicile à une clientèle variée.

Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour renforcer son activité et initier une autre activité (Stockage et commercialisation des produits céréaliers).

loans.use: To buy raw materials and packaging for juice

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Ms. Toni Fatoumata K. is a 45-year-old wife and the mother of four. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband (driver-mechanic) and her children in the Bougoufié district of Ségou.

Born into a family of merchants, she has been learning about commerce since her childhood. She became specialized in selling second-hand clothing (worn clothing from developed countries), this for fifteen years. She gets her inventory locally in Ségou and sometimes in Bamako. She intends to use this loan to diversify her sources of inventory by buying a bale of brassieres, a bale of clothing, and a bale of bedsheets in BURKINA FASO (supposedly of the best quality and inexpensive).

She runs this business in the grand marketplace of Ségou and sells daily to a customer base composed of the inhabitants of Ségou and shopkeepers at the Ségou market each Monday. Sales are done in cash and often on credit. She expects to realize a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA, which will be used to pay the loan interest and to address family needs. Her main concern is paying for a plot of land to live on.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mme Toni Fatoumata K. est une mariée de 45 ans, mère de 4 enfants et vivant dans une famille monogame avec son mari (chauffeur mécanicien) et ses enfants dans le quartier bougoufié de ségou.

Née dans une famille de commerçant elle a appris le commerce dés son enfance. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente de friperie (Habits usagés provenant des pays développés) depuis 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou et des fois à Bamako. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour diversifier ses sources d’approvisionnement en achetant une balle de soutien gorge, une balle d’habillement, et une balle de draps de lit au BURKINA FASO (supposée de meilleure qualité et de bon prix).

Elle mène cette activité au grand marché de Ségou et vend quotidiennement à une clientèle composée d’habitants de Ségou et de forains fréquentant le marché de Ségou chaque lundi. Cette vente est faite au comptant et souvent à crédit. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 CFA. Qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux besoins de la famille. Son souci majeur est de payer un lot à usage d’habitation.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mr. Uch T. raises pigs and makes wine from his house in Toul Chambak Village, Kampong Cham Province. He can earn on average $1.20 per day from these activities. T. also purchases piglets to raise and sell for profit twice per year.

T. is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase pig feed. He will use the remainder of the loan to purchase rice to make wine. The loan allows him to expand his businesses and increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed. He will use the remainder of the loan to purchase rice to make wine.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en:
Teng T., age 35, makes and sells fermented fish in a local market, typically earning around $2 each day. In the rainy season, she purchases fish in large quantities to make her fermented fish. She purchases many kinds of fish for her business, the price of which is dependent on the fish. She works alone and provides for her family along with her husband, a teacher in the village who makes $3 per day. This couple has two children, both of whom are students.

She is requesting a loan of $1000 to stock up on fish so she can make fermented fish in large amounts to resell this next season.

loans.use: To purchase fish to make fermented fish for retail sale

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Mr. Ousmane Cissé is a 22-year-old young man, single, and without children. He lives with his parents and his five brothers and sisters in the Sécoura district of the city of Ségou. Despite attending school regularly, he used to work in small-scale commerce at the same time with his brother. Tending towards commerce, he quit school to become specialized in selling various goods, something he has been doing for almost 13 years.

Familiar with Soro Yiriwaso through his mother, Mr. Cissé is on his first loan. Already having operating capital, he intends to use this loan to buy three sacks of sugar, two boxes of tea, two boxes of pasta, five boxes of soap, and other different articles for his shop located along an easily accessible boulevard. He gets his inventory locally and in a few rare instances in Bamako, from specialized wholesalers. His great experience, the look of his shop, and the diversity of articles has resulted in Mr. Cissé earning loyal customers and realizing significant sales. He expects to increase his monthly profit with the support of this loan and to earn 60,000 francs CFA.

For the future, he expects to have another shop in another district and to invest in hydrocarbons.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mr Ousmane Cissé est un jeune homme de 22 ans célibataire sans enfant et vivant avec ses parents et ses 5 frères et sœurs dans le quartier Sécoura de la ville de Ségou. Malgré sa fréquentation de l’école, il faisait du petit commerce parallèlement en compagnie de son frère. Ayant eu le goût du commerce, il abandonna les études pour se spécialiser dans la vente d’articles divers depuis bientôt 13 ans.

Ayant connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers sa mère, Monsieur Cissé est à son premier prêt. Disposant déjà d’un fonds de commerce, Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat de 3 sacs de sucre,2 cartons de thé ,2 cartons de pâtes alimentaire 5 cartons de savon et différents autres articles pour sa boutique située au bord d’un boulevard avec un accès facile. Il s’approvisionne sur place et quelques rares fois à Bamako auprès de grossistes spécialisés. Sa grande expérience, la présentation de sa boutique et la diversité des articles font que Monsieur Cissé fidélise sa clientèle et réalise des ventes importantes. Il compte augmenter son bénéfice mensuel avec l’apport de ce prêt et atteindre 60 000 CFA.

Pour l’avenir il compte avoir une autre boutique dans un autre quartier et s’investir dans l’hydro carbure.

loans.use: To buy boxes of different articles

loans.name: Djénèba

texts.fr:
Ms. Djénèba B. is 20 years old and lives in her father's home in Mancourani, one of the suburbs the city of Sikasso. After secondary studies punctuated by a diploma, "Brevet de Technicien en Sécretariat de Direction" (office and clerical trades), she decided to work to generate some income, notably from commerce in women's clothing that she has been practicing now for four years.

Because of limited financial means, she joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program through her mom, who is also one of this institution's loyal clients. She is on her first loan. With this this loan of 150,000 francs CFA, she intends to buy 10 lengths of Wax-brand pagne (colorful print cloth) and 20 suits of men's fabric. She gets her supplies in Bobo Dioulasso (a city in the Republic of Burkina Faso in West Africa), then she sells them in bulk to shopkeepers who sell beauty products in the city of Sikasso. This business is run year-round without major difficulty. The turnover is very high, and she realizes a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA. Thanks to this profit, Ms. Djénèba B. will ensure that she will cover certain expenses and help her mom.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle Djénèba B. a 20 ans et vit chez son père à Mancourani I un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. Après des études secondaires ponctuées par un diplome de Brevet de Technicien en Sécretariat de Direction, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce d’habits feminins qu’elle exerce depuis maintenant quatre (4) ans.

En raison de la faiblesse de ses moyens financiers, elle intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso à travers sa maman également une des fidèles clientes de cette Institution. Elle est à son premier pret . Avec ce pret de 150.000 FCFA, elle compte acheter 10 Pièces de pagne Wax et 20 complets de tissus d’homme. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (une ville de la République de Burkina Faso en Afriquede l’ouest), ensuite elle les vend en gros aux detenteurs de boutique de produits de beauté de la ville de Sikasso. Cette activité est menée durant toute l’année sans difficultés majeures. La rotation est très élévée et elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA. Grâce à ce bénéfice Mademoiselle Djénèba B. assurera certaines de ses dépenses et aider sa maman.

loans.use: To buy lengths of Wax-brand pagnes

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. Tha T., age 28, grows cucumbers in her plot of farmland and sells them to a nearby market. Tha gets up early in the morning to pick cucumbers from her field, clean them, and send them to the market to sell, all of which generates around $3 per day. Her husband also contributes about $6 per day to the household by working as an electrician. The amount of income she and her husband make is just enough for her entire family, of which there are six members in total (her two little children, her mother and her brother).

Because inflation in Cambodia is out of control, everything is very expensive now, even the motor-taxi her husband uses to commute to work every day. (Gasoline has risen to $1.40 per liter from less than $1 per liter).

In order to save money on transportation each day, Mrs. Tha would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work and save paying for a motor-taxi each day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Gumchagul

texts.ru:
Gumchagul R. livest in the area Rudaki. She works in one of the dining rooms/restaurants of the city Dushanbe. She is the cook there. She wishes to receive a loan to update her stock in the kitchen. She also wants to buy products that would not spoil, such as flour, sugar, etc. This will help to improve the quality of the service and to involve new clients. Gumchagul is not married, and lives with her elderly mother and young son. She is the main supporter of her family, but not looking at her hardships she is very kind and happy.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Рахимова Гумчагуль проживает в районе Рудаки. Работает в одной из столовых города Душанбе. Работает поваром. Хочет получить кредит и обновить инвентарь на кухне. Кроме того хочет закупить непортящиеся продукты. Такие как мука , сахар и др. Это поможет улучшить качество обслуживания и привлечь новых клиентов. Гумчагуль не замужем. Живет со своей старой мамаой и маленьким сыном. Она одна является кормильцем семьи , но не смотря на это она очень добрая и веселая .

loans.use: To buy products and create an inventory

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Ms. Korotoumou S. is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and their children, in Wayerma, one of the suburbs of the city of Sikasso. She started off earning money very early on because she did not attend school. After having run numerous businesses, she became specialized in selling local beverages (juices) and ice. In order to acquire a refrigerator, she decided to join the SORO YIRIWASO loan program discovered through a neighbor, who is a client of this institution. She is a on her first loan with this institution.

With this loan, she intends to buy a refrigerator in order to better serve her customer base that is growing and growing. She makes local beverages in her home, puts them in small plastic bags, and then cools them. She generally makes sales near primary schools in the city of Sikasso each day, except Saturdays and Sundays. Still, she makes sales at home to customers in the neighborhood. With this refrigerator, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 42,000 francs CFA. Thanks to this profit, Ms. Korotoumou S. expects to come to her husband's aid because he only has a custodian's income.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Korotoumou S. est une femme mariée de 37 ans, mère de 7 enfants et vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et leurs enfants à Wayerma I, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. Elle entama les activités économiques très tot en raison de sa non scolarisation. Après avoir mener maintes activités économiques, elle se spécialisa dans la vente de boissons locales (Jus) et de glace. Afin d’acquérir un réfrigerateur, elle décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de SORO YIRIWASO dont elle fut la connaissance à travers une voisine également une cliente de cette Institution.Elle est à son premier pret avecl’institution.

Avec ce pret, elle compte acheter un réfrigérateur afin de mieux servir sa clientèle.de plus en plus croissante. Elle fabrique les boissons locales chez elle, les met en sachet pour ensuiter les rafraichir. Elle vend généralement aux abord des écoles fondamentales de la ville de Sikasso tous les jours sauf Samedi et Dimanche. Cependant elle effectue des ventes à la maison à une clientèle voisine. Avec ce réfrigérateur elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 42 000 FCFA par mois. Grâce à ce bénéfice Madame Korotoumou S. compte venir en aide à son mari qui ne dispose que d’un revenu d’agent de gardiennage.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Ms. Mariam S. is a 51-year-old woman and the mother of seven children (7 boys and 1 girl) who lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her three co-spouses, and their children, in Sanoubougou, one of the suburbs of the city of Sikasso. Because of conflict in the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire, the family decided to return to Mali. As soon as she arrived in Mali, she dedicated herself to commerce in clothing, notably the sale of damask and Wax-brand cloth (highly prized fabrics in West Africa). Because of the sudden departure from Cote D'Ivoire, she had difficulty running her business the way she wished. She joined the SORO YIRIWASO loan program and is on her first loan.

She gets her inventory in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and then gives damask cloth to her dyer to have them dyed. Damask that is dyed in this way is sold locally or in Bouaaké in the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire. With this loan, she expects to buy two bales of damask and ten bolts of Wax-brand 'pagne' (colorful print cloth). She makes a lot of her sale during the holidays (Tabaski, Ramadan, etc....). Her business turnover is very high, and she realizes a monthly benefit of 45,000 francs CFA. With this loan, she envisions realizing a profit of 100,000 francs CFA per month. Thanks to this profit, Ms. Mariam S. expects to pay the loan interest and to help her husband feed this large extended family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Mariam S. est une femme de 51 ans, mère de 7 enfants (7 garçons et une fille) et vit dans une famille polygamme avec son époux, ses trois coépouses et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. En raison du conflit en République de Cote d’Ivoire, la famille a décidé de retourner au Mali. Dès son arrivée au Mali elle se consacra au commerce d’habits notamment la vente de Bazin et de Wax (Tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest). En raison du départ précipité de la Cote d’Ivoire, elle avait des diffiultés à mener à souhait son activité. Elle intégra le programme de crédit de SORO YIRIWASO et est à son premier pret.

Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (la capitale du Mali) et donne ensuite les Bazins à sa teinturière pour les colorer. Les bazins ainsi teint sont vendus localement ou à Bouaaké en République de Cote d’Ivoire. Avec ce pret elle compte acheter 2 balles de basin et 10 pièces de pagne Wax. Madame Mariam S. est aujourd’hui très expérimenté dans l’achat et vente des basins et de pagne Wax. Ses grandes périodes de vente se situent au moment des fetes (Tabaski, Ramandan etc...). La La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA mois. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 100 000 FCFA par mois. Grâce à ce bénéfice Madame Mariam S. compte payer les interets du pret et aider son mari à nourrir cette famille élargie.

loans.use: To buy bales of damask fabric and lengths of Wax-brand pagnes

loans.name: Sokona

texts.fr:
Ms. Sokona S., age 22, is the mother of two and currently lives with her children in her aunt's home in Sanoubougou, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). At a young age, she started earning money because she quit school due to social reasons. Two years ago, she became specialized in a sector where there is a strong demand, that is, the sale of clothing and articles for women.

Because of difficulty obtaining sufficient financial resources, she joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and is on her first loan.

She gets her inventory in Bobo Dioulasso (a city in the Republic of Burkina Faso, in West Africa). Then she displays her goods in her shop in Sikasso. She sells retail as much as she does wholesale. With this loan, she intends to buy two lengths of Wax-brand, one length of men's fabric, three dozen of Gel, four dozen of beauty cream, one dozen women's hair extensions, and one box of bath soap. This business is run year-round. Her high business turnover enables her to realize a monthly benefit of 100,000 francs CFA. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA. Thanks to this profit, she will pay the loan interest, ensure covering her own expenses, and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle Sokona S. agée de 22 ans est mère de 2 enfants et vit actuellement avec ses enfants chez sa tante à Sanoubougou I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). Elle a commencé très jeune les activités économiques en raison de l’abandon de l’école pour des raisons sociales. Elle s’est spécialisée dans un secteur ou il ya une forte demande à savoir la vente des habits et articles feminins il ya de cela deux ans.

En raison des difficultés d’obtenir des ressources financières suffisantes, elle intégra le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et est à son premier pret .

Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (une ville de la République de Burkina Faso en Afrique de l’ouest). Ensuite elle expose ses produits dans sa boutique à Sikasso. Elle vend aussi bien en détail qu’en gros. Avec ce pret elle compte achéter 2 Pièces de Wax, 1 pièce de tissus pour homme , 3 douzaines de Gel, 4 douzaines de crème de beauté 1 douzaine de Mèche pour femmes et 1 carton de savon de toilette. Cette activité est menée durant toute l’année . La rotation de son activité élévée, lui permet de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA.. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA par mois. Grâce à ce bénéfice elle paiera les interets du pret; assurera certaines de ses propre dépenses et investira le reste dans son activité..

loans.use: To buy cloth and various items for her shop

loans.name: Tereko

texts.fr:
Ms. Tereko D. is 43 years old, the mother of five children (3 boys and 2 girls), and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-spouse, and their children, in Médine, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso. She is specialized in making and selling an edible local powder called 'djafarana'. This red powder is used to make sauces and is made of millet, the seed of the djafarana plant, and shea nut butter. The seeds of millet and djafarana are pounded, made into powder, and mixed with shea nut butter to produce the said powder itself. She learned this business about 15 years ago with a citizen of the Cote d'Ivoire.

She is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She gets her supply of djafarana and millet seeds and shea butter in the towns near Sikasso. With this loan, she intends to buy five sacks of millet, five sacks of djafarana, and six packages of shea butter. Very experienced in making and selling djafarana, Ms. Tereko is recognized and appreciated in the city of Sikasso. Her business turnover is very high, and she realizes a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA with 75,000 francs CFA of capital. With this loan, she envisions realizing a profit of 35,000 francs CFA each month.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Tereko D. est agée de 43 ans, mère de 5 enfants (3 garçons et 2 filles) et vit dans une famille polygamme avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants à Médine, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. Elle est spécialisée dans la fabrique et la vente d’une poudre alimentaire locale appelée “Djafarana”. Cette poudre de couleur rouge est utilisée dans la préparation des sauces alimentaires. Elle est faite à base de mil, de la graine de la plante de “Djafarana” et du beure de karité. Les graines de mil et de “Djafarana” sont pilées, transformées en pouydre, mélanger avec le beurre de karité pour donner par la suite la poudre proprement dite. Elle a appris cette activité il y a environ 15 ans avec une ressortissante de la Cote d’Ivoire.

Elle est à son premier pret avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elle s’approvisionne en graines de “Djafarana” de mil et de beure de karité dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso. Avec ce pret, elle compte acheter 5 sacs de mil, 5 sacs de “Djafarana” et 6 colis de beurre de karité. Très expérimenté dans la fabrique et vente de “Djafarana”, Madame Tereko est reconnue et appréciée dans la ville de Sikasso. La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA avec un fonds propre de 75 000 FCFA. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA par mois.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Mr. Abdoulaye S. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and only child in an extended family household in the Médine district of Ségou, Republic of Mali.

After the death of his mother, Abdoulaye, the eldest of her children, quickly abandoned his studies after the basic level to become an apprentice tailor with the aim of helping his younger siblings.

After 13 years of experience, he has become a master tailor known throughout Ségou with a clientele composed of different socio-professional groups in the area.

In order to meet the increasing and pressing demands of his customers, he decided to take part in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first individual loan, and whom he learned about through friends.

He intends to use this loan to buy a sewing machine of the brand CORNA in Ségou.

With this new loan, he intends to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA, which will allow him to pay off the interest on his loan and sell sewing materials..

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Abdoulaye S. est âgé 32 ans, il vit avec son épouse et son unique enfant dans une famille élargie au quartier Médine de Ségou République du Mali.

Après le décès de sa mère, Abdoulaye ; l’aîné de cette dernière a très vite abandonné l’école depuis l’enseignement fondamental pour faire l’apprenti tailleur dans le dessein de venir en aide à ses cadets.

Après 13 ans d’expériences, il devient un maître tailleur connu de tout Ségou avec une clientèle composée de différentes catégories socio professionnelle de la place.

Afin de faire face aux demandes de plus en plus croissantes et exigeantes de sa clientèle, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est a son 1er prêt individuel ;et qu’il a connu à travers de ses amis.

Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter une machine à coudre de marque CORNA à Ségou.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 50 000 CFA qui lui permettra de payer les intérêts du prêt et de faire du commerce de matériels de couture.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Mr. Bakary C. is 31 years old, married to two women, has 3 children, and lives in the Dugu district, Cora de Pelengana, Ségou, in a polygamous household.

He abandoned his studies very early on due to socio-economic reasons. He quickly entered the economic world by helping his parents in their business. Bakary himself opted for the sale of gas-oil (fuel oil) next to his parents.

After more than 15 years of experience in this field, he has a heightened business sense and specifically a mastery of the sale of hydrocarbons.

He supplies himself generally on the spot in Ségou, and sometimes in Togo (a neighbouring country in West Africa).

He makes his sales next to the main road in the town of Ségou, and his clientele is composed of taxi and minibus drivers and of retailers in the neighbouring villages.

To obtain financial resources in order to meet the demands of his customers, he took part in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso by asking for an individual loan.

He intends to use this loan to buy 4 barrels of gas-oil, 5 metres of piping, and 10 empty barrels.

Thus, with this new loan, he intends to realize a monthly profit of 300,000 CFA. With this profit, he will contribute to the running expenses of his family.

In the future, he hopes to open a service station (to sell gasoline, gas-oils, lubricants, etc.)

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Bakary C. est âgé de 31 ans marié à deux femmes, père de 3 enfants ; et résidant au quartier Dugu cora de pelengana Ségou dans une famille polygame.

Il abandonna très vite l’école pour des raisons sociales .Il s’insère rapidement dans le tissu economique en aidant ses parents à faire du commerce. Bakary lui, opte pour la vente du gas-oil à côté d’un de ses parents.

Après plus de 15 années d’expérience dans ce créneau, il a un sens élevé des affaires et surtout la maîtrise de la vente des hydrocarbures.

Il s’approvisionne très généralement sur place à Ségou et quelques fois au TOGO (un pays côtier de l’Afrique de l’ouest).

Il effectue ses ventes au bord de l’avenue principale de la ville de Ségou et sa clientèle est composée de chauffeurs : de taxis, de minibus ; et de boutiquiers (revendeurs) des villages environnants

Pour obtenir des ressources financières afin de faire face aux demandes de la clientèle, il adhère le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso en demandant un prêt individuel.

Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 4 barils de gas-oils, 5 mètres de raccord et 10futs vide.

Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 300 000 CFA. Avec ce bénéfice, il contribuera aux dépenses courantes de la famille. Dans l’avenir il compte ouvrir une station service ( : vente d’essence, de gas-oils, de lubrifiants, etc.)

loans.use: To buy barrels of gas-oil

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ramata D. is a 60 year old widow who lives with her four children in Secoura, a district located in the periphery of the town of Ségou.

She was never schooled due to socio-economic reasons. In order to have a lucrative business, she decided to enroll in a training centre to learn the technique of Bogolan.

With more than 15 years of experience in the production of Bogolan cloth, she is highly sought after by NGOs in the area of training young promoters geared towards filling this gap.

To obtain financial resources for her business, she decided to take part in the solidarity loan association in her district. After 10 rounds of solidarity loans (group loans) with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, she is on her second individual loan after repaying all her previous loans without incident.

She supplies herself in the villages near Ségou and sells her products very generally within the Sinignasigui Cultural Centre.

She intends to use this loan to buy 100 bolts of indigo cloth, 20 bags of "n'galama" leaves, 20 bags of "Pékou" bark, 45 loads of clay, 20 litres of bleach, 1 packet of powdered soap, and 1 box of soap.

She hopes to realize a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA. With this profit, she will contribute to the family expenses (health, education, and food), and she intends to enter the transport business in the future.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Ramata D. est une veuve de 60 ans qui vit avec ses quatre enfants à Secoura un quartier situé à la périphérie de la ville de Ségou.

Elle n’a jamais été scolarisée pour des raisons socio-économiques. Afin d’avoir une activité lucrative, elle décida , de s’inscrire dans un centre de formation pour l’apprentissage de technique du Bogolan ..

Avec plus 15 ans d’expériences dans la confection des tissus Bogolans, elle est beaucoup sollicitée par les ONG dans le cadre de la formation des jeunes promoteurs orientés vers ce créneau porteur.

Pour obtenir des ressources financières pour son activité elle décida d’intégrer une association de crédit solidaire de son quartier. Après 10 cycles de prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.

Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Ségou et vend sa production très généralement dans l’enceinte du Centre Culturel Sinignasigui de Secoura.

Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter : 100 pagnes de tissu indigo ; 20 sacs de feuilles « n’galama » ; 20 sacs d’écorce de « Pékou » ; 45 baignoires d’argile ; 20 litres d’eau de javel ; 1 sachet de savon en poudre et 1 carton de savon.

Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 75 000 CFA. Avec ce bénéfice, elle contribuera aux dépenses de la famille (santé éducation nourriture) et envisage dans l’avenir s’insérer dans le domaine du Transport.

loans.use: To buy raw materials used in the production of "Bogolan" cloth

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a fifty year old widow with five children. She lost her husband fifteen years ago through a car accident. As a single parent, the entire responsibility for the children rests upon her shoulders. Through hard work, she has been able to support three children to finish school.

For the past twenty years, Leticia has been trading in dry fish and vegetables. Dry fish is suitable for preparation of fish meals, soup and sauces. She obtains her supply from a town called Yeji on the eastern side of Ghana.

Leticia wants to use the loan to buy bulk stock of dry fish and vegetables to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay for her children’s educational fees.

She belongs to the community group called, "God is Able Trust Group." In this group, group members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

The photograph of Leticia was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk stock of dry fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is 43 years old. She is married with five children. She is a very busy woman who balances motherhood and business pressures. She admits, ‘it is very challenging’.

Dora started trading in both dry fish and garment clothes ten years ago. They are two entirely different commodities. Dora sells clothes for additional income. The dedication and zeal she attaches to her work has made her one of the most successful traders in Obuasi.

Dry fish is suitable for preparation of fish meals, soup and sauces. She obtains her supply from a town called Yeji on the eastern side of Ghana.

Dora wants to use the loan to buy bulk stock of dry fish and garment clothes to meet the needs of her customers. She hopes to use part of the profit to pay for her children’s educational fees.

She belongs to the community group called, "God is Able Trust Group." In this group, group members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

Dora is the one standing in this photograph. The photo was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk stock of dry fish and garment clothes.

loans.name: Agbénossi Edem

texts.fr:
Mr. Agbénossi Edem D. was born on march 3, 1980 in Lomé. He is single, and works selling second-hand clothing in the Adidogomé district in Lomé. Since he quit school, he started in this commercial venture to be on his own. He began this business in the year 2000 with some unique pieces of men's clothing; but over the course of time, his business changed, and he included the sale of clothing for women and children. Presently, lacking enough inventory, he would like to prepare for the vacations, which is when he realizes a good turnover according to past experience. To get his supplies, he is requesting this initial loan to buy 3 bundles of second-hand clothing for women, men, and children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur D. Agbénossi Edem est né le 03 mars 1980 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et a pour activité la vente de friperie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Depuis qu’il a quitté les bancs d’école, il s’est lancé dans ce commerce pour pouvoir se prendre en charge. Il a commencé cette activité en l’an 2000 avec quelques vêtements d’hommes uniquement ; mais au fil des temps son commerce voit une évolution et il ajoute la vente des vêtements de femmes et d’enfants. Présentement, elle n’a pas assez de stock mais il désire préparer les vacances pendant lesquelles il réalise de bon chiffre d’affaires par le passé. Pour se réapprovisionner il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 3 ballots de friperie pour femmes, pour hommes et pour enfants.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is thirty-five years old. She is married with three children, ages 17, 13, and 8 respectively. She is a petty trader who supplies vegetables and spices such as tomatoes, cabbage, pepper, onion, etc, to food vendors and local restaurant operators. She obtains her supplies from the local farmers in the surrounding villages to sell to food vendors at a wholesale price.

Adwoa wants to use the loan for the sale of foods like plantain, cassava, maize, etc, and increase her income. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education.

She belongs to the community group called, "God is Able Trust Group." In this group, group members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

loans.use: for sale of foods like plantain, cassava, maize, etc.

loans.name: Holmurod

texts.ru:
Holmorud A. is a pensioner. He is 60 years old and is engaged in the business of sales of large-horned livestock. He has been engaged in this type of business for 20 years. He buys steers, fattens them up and resells them in the same markets from which he bought them. The business provides income, but to develop the business Holmurod needs additional financial assets. Therefore he has decided to request a loan to buy another steer. He wants to repay the loan within the current 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Аламуродов Холмурод пенсионер. Ему 60 лет.Занимается бизнесом по продаже крупно-рогатого скота. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Скупает бычков , откармливает и перепродает на тех же рынках. Бизнес дает доход , но , чтобы развивать бизнес Холмуроду нужны дополнительные финансовые средства. Поэтому он решил получить кредит и купить еще одного бычка. Погасить кредит его бизнес позволит ему в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a steer

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a 40 year old business woman. She is a divorced mother with five children. She has been a single parent for seven years, and has to be very resourceful for her children. Two of the children have completed senior high school.

Helen trades in clothing. She buys clothing materials at wholesale price and retails them to her customers.

She wants to use the loan to include the sale of sponges and towels for additional income. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school.

She belongs to the community group called, ‘Nyame Nnae’ (meaning God is not asleep) Trust Group, where members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments. In case of default by a member, the other members contribute to make up the repayment amount.

This is Helena in the photograph.

loans.use: for the sale of sponges and towels.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Born on January 12, 1971 in Adéta in Kloto prefecture, Mr. Komla A. is married and the father of two. A tailor by profession, he also sells boutique items in his design shop "Tailleur Shalom". He started this business in 2004 with a simple sewing machine. And so he subcontracts out other types of sewing to other tailors who have 'plinthe' and overcasting machiness. To be able to sew any kind of clothing, he is requesting this initial loan to acquire a 'plinthe' machine and some thread.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Né le 12 janvier 1971 à Adéta dans la préfecture de Kloto, Monsieur A. Komla est marié et père de deux enfants. Tailleur de profession, il vend aussi les articles de mercerie dans son atelier de couture « Tailleur Shalom ». Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2004 avec une machine à coudre simple et donc sous traite les autres type de couture auprès des autres tailleurs qui disposent de machine à plinthe et à surfilage. Pour pouvoir coudre tout type d’habits, il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acquérir une machine à plinthe et des fils à coudre.

loans.use: To buy a new machine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is forty-five years old. She is married with six children. She is a petty trader who supplies vegetables and spices like tomatoes, cabbage, pepper, onion, etc, to food vendors and local restaurant operators. She obtains her supplies from the local farmers in the surrounding villages and sells to food vendors at wholesale prices.

Cecilia wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of tomatoes, onions, eggplant, pepper, etc, to serve her customers. She believes this will help her to raise more income. She hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children’s education.

Cecilia belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ (God is not asleep) Trust Group where members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

This photograph of Cecilia was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of tomatoes, onions, eggplant, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Djima

texts.fr:
Unmarried with one person in his care, Mr. Djima O. was born on January 29, 1979 in Lomé. Since the year 2003, he has had a store selling pagnes (traditional print cloth) in the grand marketplace of Lomé. He accommodates his customers well and earns their loyalty. Itinerant saleswomen come to him to buy merchandise to resell. This initial loan that Mr. Djima O. is requesting will enable him to buy 30 bolts of GTP-brand pagne.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Célibataire avec une personne à charge, Monsieur O. Djima est né le 29 janvier 1979 à Lomé. Depuis l’année 2003, il a ouvert un magasin de vente de pagne dans le grand marché de Lomé. Il accueille bien ses clients et les fidélise. Les revendeuses ambulantes viennent chez lui pour acheter et revendre. Ce premier crédit que Monsieur O. Djima sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 30 pièces de pagne de marque GTP.

loans.use: To buy 30 bolts of pagnes

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru:
Olimjon M. is a resident of Yavan city. An agriculturist with a higher education, he has a farm. He would like to take out a loan to stock up on seeds and fertilizers for the next planting season. In addition, he needs to rent tractors and pay tractor operators for the wheat harvest. Olimjohn lives with his family – he is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Махмадраджабов Олимджон житель города Яван. Агроном с высшим образованием. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения для посева. Кроме того нужно оплатить аренду и плату трактористам после сбора урожая пшеницы. Олимджон живет со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 67 year old widow with two children currently in school.

Comfort started trading in dry fish and yams twenty years ago. Dry fish is a fresh fish that is preserved through sun drying to make it last longer. It is suitable for preparation of fish meals, soup and sauces. She obtains her supply from a town called Yeji. It is one of the major fishing areas in Ghana due to the proximity to Volta Lake.

Comfort wants to use the loan to buy bulk stock of dry fish and yams to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay for her children’s educational fees.

Comfort belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

Comfort is seen standing in this photograph wearing a yellowish 'kaba and slit' outfit. The photograph was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk stock of dry fish and yams.

loans.name: Soumba

texts.fr:
Mrs. Soumba Koné is 58 years old and lives with her husband and her 7 children in an extended family household in the 1st district in the town of Ségou.

Since her youth, she has been interested in business activities, notably commerce. It was her husband who gave her the idea of specializing in the purchase and sale of fruits 10 years ago.

She supplies herself in the villages of Gara and Baguineda and sells her fruits at the market in Ségou everyday. It is on Mondays, the town fair days, that she realizes the most sales.

In order to increase her working capital, she decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso by taking part in a solidarity loan association in her district. After 7 rounds of solidarity loans, all repaid without problems, she is on her first individual loan.

She intends to use this loan to buy 10 loads of mangoes and 5 loads of zaban and thereby realize a monthly profit of 150,000 CFA. With this profit, she will pay off the interest on her loan and contribute to the family expenses (education, health, food, etc.)

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Soumba Koné a 58 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 7 enfants dans une famille élargie au 1er quartier de la ville de Ségou.

Dès son jeune age elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce .C’est son mari qui lui a donné l’idée de se spécialiser dans la l’achat vente des fruits et cela depuis 10 ans.

Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages de Gara,de Baguineda ;et vend ses fruits au marché de Ségou tous les jours.C’est le Lundi, jour de foire de la ville, qu’elle réalise le plus de vente.

Afin d’accroître son fonds de commerce elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso en intégrant une association de crédit solidaire de son quartier. Après 7 cycles de prêts solidaires, tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel.

Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 10 chargements de mangues ; 5 chargements de « Zaban » et ainsi réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 150 000 CFA. Avec ce bénéfice, elle paiera les intérêts du prêt et contribuera aux dépenses de la famille (éducation santé nourriture etc.)

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Awogan

texts.fr:
Awogan DADZIE-ADJALLE, age 37, was born in Lomé and is currently single. Her main business is the sale of prepaid phone cards in the Adidogomé district in Lomé. She started this business in 2004 and is signed up with three telecommunication services in Togo, namely Togotélécom, Moov, and Togocell. This initial loan that she is requesting will enable her to buy 3 small boxes of prepaid cards.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 37 ans, Mademoiselle DADZIE-ADJALLE Awogan est née à Lomé et est à présent célibataire. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des cartes de recharge dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2004 et est abonnée auprès des trois services de télécommunication du Togo à savoir Togotélécom, Moov et Togocell. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 3 petits cartons de cartes de recharges.

loans.use: To buy prepaid cards

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar N. is a nurse by training, but isn’t practicing nursing. She works in her own store where she sells food products. Yavan, the city where she lives, is far from Dushanbe city, and products are available only in Dushanbe or in the center of Yavan. Her store is located in her village – and is the only store in the region. For this reason, Dilbar decided to increase her stock turnover and change her assortment of products. But this can only happen if she gets a loan. She expects to be able to repay her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Нуриддинова Дилбар медсестра. Но по специальности не работает. Работает в собственном магазине. Продает продукты питания. Яван расположен далеко от города Душанбе , а продукты можно купить только там или в центре Явана. Магазин Дильбар расположен в их кишлаке . Он является единственным магазином в округе. Поэтому Дильбар решила увеличить товарооборот и изменить ассортимент товара. НО это возможно лишь после получения кредита. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a 72 year old widow with four children. Though old and quite weak, Adwoa refuses to give in to her ailments and continues to be a resourceful mother. She has supported three children to finish vocational school.

Adwoa is a retailer of charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Adwoa obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Obuasi and retails them to her customers.

Adwoa wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to retail to her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her last child in school.

Adwoa belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ (meaning God is not asleep) Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

Adwoa is seen standing in the photograph wearing a black top. This photograph was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of charcoal.

loans.name: Komla Mensah

texts.fr:
Komla Messah A. was born on June 21, 1977. He is single, and his main business is the sale of a local beverage made from palm wine. He started this business in 2002. He imports this beverage from the village of his birth, MESSIWOBE. This initial loan that he is requesting will enable him to buy ten drum of the local beverage and one box of non-alcoholic beverages.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Komla Messah est né le 21 juin 1977. Il est célibataire et a pour activité principale la vente de boisson locale préparée avec du vin de palme. Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2002. Il importe cette boisson depuis son village natal MESSIWOBE. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 bidons de boisson locale et 1 carton de boisson non alcoolisée.

loans.use: To buy the local beverage

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Gulbahor A. lives in Yavan city. She is divorced, without children, and lives with her parents. She has a secondary school education and works as a teacher in a secondary school. In addition, she helps her parents on their farm. She sows vegetables and other grain crops. She has been farming for 10 years. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. Her harvest is partially used for her family’s subsistence, and they sell the rest to turn a profit. She expects to pay back her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизова Гульбахор проживает в городе Яван. Разведена. Живет с родителями. Детей не имеет. Имеет среднее образование. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того , чтобы помогать родителям занимается земледелием. Сеет овощи и различные злаковые культуры. Занимается земледелием уже 10 лет. Обратилась за кредитом для того , чтобы закупить удобрения и семена. Получаемый урожай частично используют в хозяйстве для своей семьи, а часть продают и получают прибыль. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Akofa Bayi

texts.fr:
Ms. Akofa Bayi G., age 24, was born in Lomé and come from a modest family. She is an energetic girl who started trading in charcoal in 2007. At first, she used to sell grain but thought well to leave it behind and to embrace commerce in charcoal, which not anyone can do. Even though this is a tough business, especially when it comes to getting inventory, she would like to do it because she found a location to make rapid sales. She is going to get her supplies five times a week up north. She has wanted to buy more than in the past and is requesting this loan to buy 50 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 24 ans, Mademoiselle G. Akofa Bayi est née à Lomé et vient d’une famille modeste. Elle est une fille dynamique qui a commencé le commerce de charbon de bois depuis l’année 2007. Entre temps elle vendait les céréales mais elle a jugé bon de laisser ce commerce et d’embrasser le commerce de charbon de bois qui n’est pas connu par tout le monde. Bien que l’exercice de cette activité soit difficile surtout au moment de l’approvisionnement, elle désire le faire car elle a trouvée un bon emplacement pour pouvoir les écouler rapidement. Elle va s’approvisionner cinq fois par semaine au nord du pays. Elle voulait en acheter plus qu’elle le faisait avant et sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 50 sacs de charbons de bois.

loans.use: To buy 50 sacks of charcoal

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Oimgul

texts.ru:
Oimgul B. is a resident of Khuroson distrct. She’s married and has two children. She has a higher education and works as a teacher in a secondary school. To supplement her income, she runs a small stall near her home where she sells food products. She has been doing this for three years now and would like to expand her stall and stock turnover. To do so, she decided to take out a loan that she expects to repay within 10 months. This will enable her to increase her business and income which she needs to support her family.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоева Оимгуль жительница района Хуросон. Замужем мать двоих детей. Имеет высшее образование. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того подрабатывает торговлей. Имеет небольшую торговую точку рядом с домом , где продает продукты питания. Занимается этим делом уже три года. Теперь хочет увеличить торговую точку и товарооборот. Для этого она решила получить кредит со сроком на 10 месяцев. Это поможет увеличить бизнес и увеличить доход , необходимый для ее семьи.

loans.use: Increase of stock

loans.name: Roukéyétou

texts.fr:
Roukéyétou O. was born on September 1, 1973 in Sokodé, a city located in the middle of Togo. She is married and the mother of three. Her main business is selling beauty products and jewelry at the grand marketplace in Lomé. This initial loan that she is requesting will enable her to buy 28 bags of bracelets, 12 bags of necklaces, and 12 bags of earrings.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame O. Roukéyétou est née le 1er septembre 1973 à Sokodé, ville située au centre du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale, la vente des produits de beauté et de bijoux au grand marché de Lomé. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 28 sachets de bracelets, 12 sachets de colliers et 12 sachets de boucles d’oreilles.

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Mohiston

texts.ru:
Mohiston R. lives in Qurgan-Tube. She is a widow with 2 children. She has a higher education. She has worked as a bookkeeper for about 30 years. Now she plans to buy a refrigerator and satellite dish for her house. To do this, she must get a loan. This will improve living conditions for the family. She is the sole support for the family, and therefore it is not possible for her to save money. Once she gets the loan, she will be able to partially repay it in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer.

Риоева Мохистон жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Вдова , имеет 2 детей. Имеет высшее образование. Работает бухгалтером около 30 лет. Сейчас планирует купить холодильник и спутниковую антену для дома . Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит. Таким образом она улучшит условия жизни для своей семьи. Она является единственным кормильцем семьи поэтому собрать сбережения ей не удается . А получив кредит она сможет частично погашать его в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing household appliances

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr: Born around 1979 in Dangbo in the valley in Ouémé Prefecture in the southeast of Bénin, Ms. Geneviève  Y. comes from Porto-Novo. She is married and the mother of two children, Alain (7) who is in 2nd grade and Rosaline (3). Ms. Geneviève Y. sells toothpaste and cosmetics. She goes through the streets and door-to-door. She is requesting this loan to bolster her little business.Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer Née vers 1979 à DANGBO dans la vallée dans de l'Ouémé au Sud-Est du Bénin, dame Y. Geneviève est originaire de Porto-Novo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants, Alain, âgé de 7 ans est en classe de CI et Rosaline âgée de 3 ans. Dame Y. Geneviève est revendeuse de pâtes dentifrices et de produits cosmétiques. Elle est ambulante. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cases of ointments, 1 case of perfume, and 2 cases of toothpasteAchat de 02 cartons de pommades, de 1 carton de Parfum et de 2 cartons de pâtes dentifrices.

loans.name: Roukiatou

texts.fr:
Married to Mr. Bidabignawé, a plumber for the company Togolaise des Eaux in Lomé, Mrs. Roukiatou S. was born on 31 December 1968 in Pagala-gare in the Prefecture of Blitta. She has two children who are in secondary school. In 2006, she started a large store selling rice, soap, oil, and macaroni in the Agoè-Zongo district in Lomé. She has suppliers in Nigeria and in Ghana who deliver the soap. She is a wholesaler and sells to retailers.

This first loan she is asking for will allow her to resupply her stock by buying 20 bags of rice and 22 boxes of soap.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée à Monsieur ABRESSI-TOURE Bidabignawé qui est un plombier à la Togolaise des eaux à Lomé, madame S. Roukiatou est née le 31 décembre 1968 à Pagala-gare dans la préfecture de Blitta. Elle a deux enfants qui fréquentent et qui sont au collège. En 2006, elle a crée un grand magasin de vente de riz et savons, d’huile et de macaroni dans le quartier Agoè-Zongo à Lomé. Elle a des fournisseurs au Nigeria et au Ghana qui lui livre les savons. Elle est grossiste et vend aux détaillants.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock par l’achat de 20 sacs de riz et 22 cartons de savons.

loans.use: To buy rice and soap

loans.name: Amavi Joséphine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi Joséphine G. was born on 1 May 1971 in Lomé. She is married and has 3 children. For more than 12 years, she has run a 'pagne' cloth business in the Agbalépédo district in Lomé. She also sells fruit juice and ice cubes.

She is asking for her first loan in order to buy 12 rolls of pagne cloth and 1 bag of sugar for the production of fruit juice.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame G. Amavi Joséphine est née le 1er mai 1971 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Depuis plus de 12 ans elle exerce le commerce de pagne dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo à Lomé. Elle vend aussi des jus de fruits et du glaçon.

Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 12 rouleaux de pagnes et 1 sac de sucre pour la fabrication du jus de fruits.

loans.use: To buy 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Abra Amétowoyo

texts.fr:
Miss Abra Amétowoyo E. was born on 8 August 1972 in Kpélé in the Prefecture of Kloto. She is unmarried with two children. She is a retailer of mineral water and rechargeable phone cards in the Wuiti district in Lomé.

With this loan she is asking for (her first), she would like to buy 2 small boxes of rechargeable phone cards and 30 packets of mineral water.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle E. Abra Amétowoyo est née le 08 août 1972 à Kpélé dans la préfecture de Kloto. Elle est célibataire avec deux enfants. Elle est revendeuse d’eau minérale et de cartes de recharge dans le quartier Wuiti à Lomé.

Avec ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle désire acheter 2 petits cartons de cartes de recharge et 30 sachets d’eau minérale.

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr:
Born on September 16, 1971 in Cotonou in Littoral County in the south of Benin, Ms. Estelle Y. is married to Mr. Lambert Landedji and the mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. She sells staples such as rice, corn, sugar, milk, peanut oil, and the like. Ms. Estelle Y. is requesting this loan in order to bolster her business and deal with the enormous procurement difficulties she faces so as to better respond to the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 16 Septembre 1971 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au sud du BENIN, dame Y. Estelle est mariée à Monsieur LANDEDJI Lambert et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Elle revend des produits de grande consommation tels que du riz, du maïs, du sucre, du lait, de l'huile d'arachide et autres. Dame Y. Estelle sollicite ce crédit dans le but de renforcer son activité et de faire face aux énormes difficultés d'approvisionnement afin de répondre plus favorablement à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 2 tins of peanut oil, 1 sack of corn, 2 cases of soap, 2 cases of concentrated milk, and 1 case of sugar

Achat de 2 bidons d'huile d'arachide, de 1 sac de maïs, de 2 cartons de savons, de 2 cartons de lait concentré et de 1 carton de sucre.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Fotima R. is a resident of Varzob. She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has degree in bookkeeping. She has not worked in her specialty for more than 15 years because the wages are very low. Since her house is near the Varzob River, Fotima has opened a small café, called Tamanno, at her home. She has regular clients who rest at her place for several days at a time. Fotima buys meat for cooking at the market, but it is very expensive for her. Therefore she has decided to buy lambs and fatten them. She needs money to do this, and therefore has decided to take out a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимова Фотима жительница района Варзоб. Возраст 45 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности бухгалтер.Более 15 лет по специальности не работает, так как заработная плата очень маленькая.Так как дом клиентки находится возле реки Варзоб ,Фотима при доме открыла небольшое кафе «Таманно».У ней есть постоянные клиенты,которые отдыхают у нее по несколько дней. Фотима для приготовления пищи покупает мясо на рынке.Но мясо обходится ей очень дорого,поэтому она решила купить барашкев и откормить их. Для этого ей нужны деньги ,поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchasing sheep.

loans.name: Kocouvi

texts.fr:
A native of Atakpamé, Mr. Kocouvi T. was born on 28 May 1987. He is unmarried and lives with his little brother in Lomé. In 2004, he started a store selling cellphone accessories and rechargeable phone cards in the Totsi district in Lomé.

He has not obtained a loan previously through WAGES, but is asking for this first loan to buy 2 small boxes of recharge cards and some cellphone accessories.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Originaire d’Atakpamé, Monsieur T. Kocouvi est né le 28 mai 1987. Il est célibataire et vit avec son petit frère à Lomé. En 2004, il a crée un magasin de vente d’accessoires de portables et des cartes de recharge dans le quartier de Totsi à Lomé.

Il n’a jamais bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES mais sollicite ce premier crédit pour achat 2 petits cartons de cartes de recharges et quelques accessoires de portables

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone cards and cellphone accessories

loans.name: Qumri

texts.ru:
Qumri S. lives in the Varzob region. She is 35 years old, is married and has 3 children. Qumri has a secondary-vocational education and is an accountant by profession. Her husband owns a truck. He uses it to transport charcoal which he resells in his village. This business is the sole source of income for their large family. Right now, Qumri would like to increase their working capital and has applied for a loan. She will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Кумри жительница района Варзоб. Возраст 35 лет , замужем , имеет 3 детей.Образование средне-техническое , по специальности бухгалтер. Муж Кумри имеет грузовую машину. На ней он привозит уголь и перепродает его в своем кишлаке . Этот вид деяетльности является единственным источником дохода их большой семьи. В данный момент клиентка хочет увеличить денежный оборот .Для чего ей нужны деньги , поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Aku Viviane

texts.fr:
Unmarried with one child, Miss Aku Viviane S. was born on 3 August 1983 in Yikpa Dzigbé in the Prefecture of Daye in the plateau region. In 2002 she opened a store selling basic need goods in the Adidogomé district in Lomé. She has already benefited from one loan through WAGES and repaid it without incident.

This second loan she is asking for will allow her to buy 15 bags of rice and 20 boxes of laundry soap to supply her store "HORISON MAO."

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Célibataire avec un enfant, Mademoiselle S. Aku Viviane est née le 03 août 1983 à Yikpa Dzigbé dans la préfecture de daye dans la région des plateaux. Elle a ouvert en 2002 un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé.

Ce second prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 15 sacs de riz et 20 cartons de savon de lessive pour alimenter sa boutique « HORISON MAO ».

loans.use: To buy rice and laundry soap

loans.name: Dialia

texts.fr:
Miss Dialia B. is 32 years old and has been living with her brothers, sisters, and daughter at her late father's home since her divorce in Sanoubougou I, a district in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali)

After having run several business activities since her youth, she decided 15 years ago to specialize in the sale of clothing for children. To obtain supplementary financial resourrces in order to meet the needs of a constantly increasing clientele, she decided to take part in the program by asking for a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan.

She has been making voluntary deposits at Soro Yiriwaso for about 2 and a half years. With this loan, she intends to buy 60 outfits (pants and shirt made of the same cloth), 28 bedcovers, 5 dozen containers of powder for children's skin, and 5 dozen containers of children's perfume in Cotonou and in Lomé (Republics of Benin and Togo, respectively, in West Africa). To reach Lomé and Cotonou, she rents a bus for 40,000 FCFA, and arranges her lodging and daily food. She re-sells her merchandise for cash in her shop located hear the Sikasso bus station. With this loan, she intends to a realize a monthly profit of 600,000 FCFA, which will allow her to contribute to the family's expenses, repay the interest on her loan, and invest in her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle Dialia B. a 32 ans , et vit avec ses frères , ses soeurs, et sa fille chez son feu père depuis son divorce à Sanoubougou I, un quartier de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali).

Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus dès son jeune age, elle décida de se spécialiser dans la vente d’habits pour enfants depuis maintenant 15 ans. Pour obtenir des ressources financières supplémentaires afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elle décida d’intègrer le Programme en demandant un prêt à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel .

Elle effectue des depots d’épargne volontaire à Soro Yiriwaso depuis environ deux 2 ans et demi . Avec ce prêt, elle compte achéter 60 complets (pantalon et chemise de meme tissu ), 28 couvres lits, 5 douzaines de poudre de peau pour enfant et 5 douzaines de parfum pour enfant à Cotonou et à Lomé (Républiques du Benin et de Togo en Afrique de l’Ouest). Pour se rendre à Lomé et à Cotonou, elle emprunte des bus pour 40.000 FCFA, assure son hebergement et sa nourriture quotidiennement. Elle revend ses marchandises au comptant dans sa boutique située à la gare routière de Sikasso. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 600 000 FCFA qui lui permettrons de contribuer aux charges familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: To buy clothing for children and others

loans.name: Yakpadan Stéphane

texts.fr:
Mr. Yakpadan Stéphane P. was born in Bolou on 29 May 1985. He lives with his wife Mawussi AKPO, who is a seamstress. In 2006, he opened a store selling Fan brand milk in the Adidogomé district in Lomé.

The first loan he obtained from WAGES allowed him to establish himself in the district as a seller. After quickly repaying his first loan, he is asking for this second one to supply himself by buying 3 bags of Fan milk.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur P. Yakpadan Stéphane est né à Bolou le 29 mai 1985. Il vit avec sa femme AKPO Mawussi qui est une couturière. Depuis 2006, il a ouvert un magasin de dépôt de fan milk dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé.

Le premier prêt qu’il avait obtenu auprès de WAGES lui a permis de s’installer dans le quartier en tant que opérateur économique. Après un prompt remboursement de son premier prêt, il sollicite ce second pour faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de 3 sacs de fan.

loans.use: To buy "Fan" brand milk

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 68 years old. She is divorced with four children. Currently three of them have completed school and are working. She prepares and sells pastries to the working community and bus stops at Obuasi, a busy mining town in Ghana. She wants to use the loan to buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock to avoid price hikes. This, she believes, will decrease her cost very significantly to enable her raise good income to support her last child in school.

She is a member of the trust group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ (meaning God is Not Asleep). In this group, members guarantee one another's loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan. Hannah is in the photo, taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 41 years old. She is married with four children. At the moment, they are all in school. She buys clothing, jeans and jewelry at wholesale prices and distributes them to her customers at retail prices at their door step.

Georgina would like distribute higher quality merchandise to meet the preference of her customers but needs a loan to pursue that.
