With the loan, she wants to purchase gold and diamond jewelry and top-quality jeans to serve her customers. She hopes to save more income to open her own container shop.

She is a member of the trust group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ (meaning God is Not Asleep). In this group, members guarantee one another's loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loan. Georgina is in the photo, taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase gold and diamond jewelry and top quality jeans.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Tobatí Group

texts.es:
This committee is formed by 15 hard-working women from the San Blas neighborhood in the city of Tobatí. The group is currently in the third cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) program, and to date, they all manage a line of credit of approximately 667.000 guaranis per member.

The committee was formed after Rosa Gómez, acting president of the committee, learned of the program through her brother who is a client of Fundación Paraguaya. In no time, Rosa gathered the 15 women, which is the minimum required to form a committee, and thereafter started the training cycle. Today, they tell us they are very happy to be part of an organization whose goal is the development of humble and hard-working people, and of course, even more satisfied for the fact that their committee is formed by their own neighbors.

The loans they receive will be invested in the purchase of ingredients necessary for the elaboration of chipas (typical dish from Paraguay) such as starch, oil and cheese, as well as herbs, sugar, sodas, meat and noodles. Those that sell clothing will purchase used clothing wholesale, which will allow them to acquire it a lower price.

The committee’s objective for the month of June is to hold typical dish fairs to raise funds for their savings, being that the celebrations in honor of San Juan are in proximity and in which dishes such as mbeyú (starch tortilla with cheese), madi´o (yucca turnover) and other dishes are commonly consumed.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio San Blas de la ciudad de Tobatí, el grupo se encuentra actualmente en el 3er. Ciclo del programa Mujeres Emprededoras, y a la fecha todas manejan una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 667.000 por cada integrantes.

El comité fue formado gracias a que la señora Rosa Gómez, actual presidenta del comité, tuvo conocimiento del programa a través de su hermano quien es cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya. La señora Rosa en poco tiempo llegó a juntar las 15 señoras, que es el mínimo del requisito exigido para formar el comité y así se inicio el ciclo de capacitación, hoy día manifiestan que están muy contentas de ser parte de una organización que tiene como finalidad el crecimiento de la gente humilde y trabajadora y por su puesto mucho mas satisfecha por el hecho de que la misma están conformadas por sus propias vecinas.

Los préstamos que recibirán lo invertirán en la compra de productos para la elaboración de chipas (comida típica del Paraguay) como ser almidón, aceite, queso, como así también para la compra de yerba, azúcar, gaseosas, carne, fideo, gaseosas, las que se dedican a la venta de ropa, compraron ropas usadas en forma mayorista esto le permitió obtener un precio mas bajo.

El comité tiene como objetivo este mes de junio la de realizar ferias de comidas típicas para recaudar fondos para sus ahorros, considerando que se aproxima las fiestas de San Juan, dónde es muy común el consumo de estos tipos de comidas como el mbeyú (tortilla de almidón con queso), pastel madi´o (empanada de mandioca), entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as sugar, herbs, starch, vegetable oil, cheese, milk, cookies, beef, sodas, beer and other types of beverages as well as men's, women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Djénèbou

texts.fr:
Miss Djénèbou D. is 29 years old, unmarried with no children, and lives with her aunt in a traditional family in Sanoubougou I, a district in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Since her youth, she has been interested in business activities, notably commerce. At the end of her studies 6 years ago, she decided to dedicate herself completely to the business of selling clothing for women and men.

In order to satisfy a growing clientele, she decided to obtain a loan from the institution, with whom she has been involved for 2 months. This additional resource will help her to meet the growing demand of her customers.

This loan will allow her to buy 30 outfits of embroidered cloth (highly prized in West Africa) in Bobo Dioulaso (Republic of Burkina Faso in West Africa). She resells these goods for cash in her boutique not far from the Sikasso bus station. Her customers comprise Malians and nationals from the Republic of Ivory Coast. She intends to realize a monthly income of 150,000 FCFA, of which she intends to use a large portion for her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle Djénèbou D. a 29 ans, célibataire sans enfant elle vit chez sa tante dans une famille traditionnelle à Sanoubougou I, un quartier de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali).

Dès son bas age elle s’est interessée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce .A la fin de ses études, elle décida de se consacrer totalement aux activités de vente des habits pour femmes et hommes. depuis 6 ans.

Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance elle décida de prendre un pret auprès de l’Institution avec qui elle est en rélation depuis 2 mois. Cette ressource additionnelle l’aidera à faire face à la demande de plus en croissante de sa clientèle.

Ce prêt lui permettra d’achéter 30 complets de tissus brodés ( tissus très prisés en afrique de l’ouest ) à Bobo Dioulasso (République du Burkina Faso en Afrique de l’Ouest). Elle revend ses marchandises au comptant dans sa boutique non loin de la Gare routière de Sikasso. Sa clientèle est composée de maliens et de ressortissants de la république de Cote d’Ivoire. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA. Dont elle compte utiliser une grande partie dans son activité.

loans.use: To buy wax-printed pagnes (West African cloth)

loans.name: Odinabibi

texts.ru:
Odinabibi S. lives in the Varzob region. She is 53 years old, is married and has 4 children. Odinabibi has a high school education. For the last 15 years she has purchased and sold fabrics. She purchases fabrics from wholesale suppliers and resells them in her community. This business is the sole source of income for her family. Odinabibi’s husband is disabled and she has to support her family by herself.

Right now Odinabibi would like to increase her product assortment and has applied for a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Одинабиби жительница района Варзоб .Возраст 53 года, замужем ,имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка вот уже более 15 лет занимается куплей продажей ткани.Она покупает у оптовых поставщиков ткань и перепродает в своей махалле. Этот вид деятельности является единственным истоником дохода его семьи. Муж клиентки инвалид,поэтому ей приходится содержать семью самой. В данный момент Одинабиби хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, поэтому клиентка хочет взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fabric for sale

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is forty-five years old. She is a widow who lost her husband seven years ago through illness. She has four children. By dint of hard work, she has supported two of the children to senior high school. Another one has successfully completed a learning apprenticeship, and the last one is in school.

She sells food like maize, plantain, cassava and rice in the community market. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk stock of maize, plantain, cassava and rice to avoid price hikes, especially in this time of food crisis in the country. This, she believes, will decrease her cost very significantly to enable her make a good income to support her last child in school.

She is a member of the trust group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ (meaning God is Not Asleep). In this group, members guarantee one another's loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loan. Afia is in the photo, taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To bulk stock of maize, plantain, cassava and rice.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina relies on a small shop that is her only source of income. She has two children, and her husband helps her with the store. They use their income from the store to send their two children to school. They live in a small dwelling in the Bajo Llojeta region made of adobe. She is responsible with her credit as she wants to demonstrate responsibility to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La sra. Cuenta con una pequeña tienda que su único ingreso tiene 2 hijos su esposo le ayuda con la tienda con lo que financia el estudio de sus hijos, vive en una pequeña construcción en la zona de Bajo LLojeta hecha de adobe, es responsable con su crédito ya que ella quiere demostrar responsabilidad a sus hijos.

loans.use: Increase of cash for her general store

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina is a married woman with two children. She has a small sewing shop in her home, located in the Jardín neighborhood of the city of Caacupé, for more than eight years. She learned the skills and art of weaving fabrics from her mother, who taught her. Today, this activity is the most important source of income for her and her family as her husband is a bricklayer, and only works seasonally.

Saturnina told us that her specialty is sewing "ñandutí", a type of weaving typical to her country that is done entirely by hand and decorates skirts, blankets, decorative pictures, among other things. The weavings are made with multicolored thread and look like spiderwebs, which is what "ñandutí" means in Guaraní, the aboriginal language in Peru. In the photo, Saturnina hangs one of her ñandutís that is well-liked by tourists that come to our country and always take one home as a souvenir.

The previous loans she has requested from the Fundación Paraguaya were used to purchase a good amount of thread, needles and accessories that permitted her to save some money now that she sells wholesale.

She was thinking of using her savings in the future to buy a new type of Overlock sewing machine since the one she is using now is on loan from her mother and has some technical problems, which makes it hard to complete her works.

Mrs. Saturnina is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for trusting her and affirms that it is one of the few organizations that help simple, hard-working people. She is asking for a loan today because she wants to invest in purchasing needle, thread, buttons, and clasps now that the requests for jackets and pants have increased with the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Saturnina, es una señora casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella posee un pequeño taller de costura en su domicilio, en el Barrio Jardín de la ciudad de Caacupé, el negocio lo tiene ya hace más de 8 años, y las habilidades y el arte de tejer las telas lo adquirió de su madre, quien le enseño este oficio. Hoy día esta actividad es la fuente de ingreso mas importante para ella y su familia, ya que su marido es constructor albañil y solo trabaja por temporada.

Saturnina nos cuenta que su especialidad es la de tejer "ñandutí" que es un tejido típico de nuestro país que se hace totalmente a mano y sirve para decoración de prendas, manteles, cuadros decorativos, entre otros. Las tramas se hacen con hilos de distintos colores y se asemeja a la "tela de la araña" que es lo que significa ñandutí en guaraní. En la fotografía, Saturnina, sostiene uno de sus ñandutís que es muy apreciado por los turístas que vienen a nuestro país y siempre llevan uno de recuerdo.

Los préstamos que le otorgó anteriormente la Fundación Paraguaya los invirtió en la compra de una buena cantidad de telas, hilos, accesorios, esto le permitió ahorrar unos guaraníes ya que le venden al por mayor.

Tiene pensado más adelante comprar con unos ahorros una máquina de coser nueva tipo Overlock debido a que la que esta usando actualmente la tiene préstamo de su madre, y además ya presenta algunos problemas técnicos, lo que le dificulta realizar en forma sus trabajos.

La señora Saturnina, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el hecho de confiar en su persona y afirma que es una de las pocas instituciones que apoya a gente humilde y trabajadora. Ella hoy solicita un nuevo crédito pues quiere invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y cierres pues sus pedidos de sacos y pantalones ha aumentado en esta temporada de invierno.

loans.use: Purchase needles, thread, and accessories for her sewing

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina runs a prosperous clothing and footwear kiosk in the city market in Vasilyevka, Ukraine. She decided to start her own business about seven years ago and has done very well. She sells a variety of womens' blouses, dresses and shoes. Income from the business help her and her husband, Valeryi, provide for the needs of their family of four. Valentina is typical in that she is one of many women entrepreneurs who desire to earn extra income to provide a better living for their families.

Valentina has requested a loan of $3000 to help her purchase additional inventory to sell. She typically buys clothes and footwear from her suppliers for further retail sale. This allows her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and allows her the flexibility to easily update her product selection if an item is selling well or not moving quickly enough. Valentina’s business has benefited much from loans she has received in the past.  This loan will continue to help her business be successful and provide much needed income for Valentina and her family.

(Note: this is a short term “seasonal” loan that will be paid back in two months.)

loans.use: to increase her operating capital

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina works in a very successful womens' clothing business. She operates a sales location where she offers a selection of trendy knitted womens' apparel that is always in demand. Galina’s business has a long history.  She was able to start this new venture by accessing a loan. Since that time, her business has done quite well. She earns approximately $500 of profit each month. 
Galina has requested an additional loan to give her more working capital. 
(Note: this is a short term “express” loan that will be paid back in one month.)

loans.use: to purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Kossiwa Nicole

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kossiwa Nicole A. was born in Lomé on 14 January 1970. She is married and has four children. To meet the needs of her family, she started a business selling pagne cloth and jewelry. She buys pagne cloth and jewelry at wholesale prices at the grand market in Lomé, and re-sells them in the district where she lives, Adidogomé.

Her clientele has grown, and to meet this increasing demand, she is asking for her first loan in order to enlarge her stock with 50 sets of pagne cloth and 10 sets of jewelry.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Kossiwa Nicole est née à Lomé le 14 janvier 1970 à Lomé. Elle est mariée est mère de quatre enfants. Pour subvenir au besoin de sa famille, elle se lance dans le commerce de pagne et de bijoux. Elle achète des pagnes et des bijoux au prix du gros au grand marché de Lomé qu’elle revend dans son quartier de résidence Adidogomé.

Sa clientèle a grandi et pour faire face à cette demande croissante elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour accroître son stock de 50 pièces de pagnes et 10 bijoux.

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth and jewelry

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married and has one daughter. They live in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. Sergei owns a vending business at a local market where he sells seeds and pesticides. He has been in this trade for 15 years. Presently, he earns approximately $700 each month. 

Sergei has an entrepreneurial mind that is always active.  He is constantly calculating and always on the lookout for the next big opportunity. His business is profitable and stable. However, Sergei would like to expand it even more. He is requesting a loan of 2500 grivnas to increase his stock and meet the growing demand during the upcoming summer season. 

(Note: this is a short term “seasonal” loan that will be paid back in two months.)

loans.use: to purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has three children. It has always been hard for her to meet the needs of her family of four in Ukraine. To provide for her family, Svetlana decided to start her own small business selling clothing for children and women. Loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped her purchase a kiosk in the market and expand her clothing sales business. Through persistence, hard work, and further loans, Svetlana has had the opportunity to increase her income. 

Svetlana has been in this trade for 6 years. Currently, she would like a loan to purchase summer dresses for women and clothing for kids. This loan will not only help Svetlana’s business grow, but also generate additional income and help her children financially.

loans.use: to increase turnover capital

loans.name: Mulikat

texts.fr:
At 41 years of age, Mrs. Mulikat A. is married and has five children. She is a businesswoman who is constantly adapting to the needs of her environment. This is how she came to specialize in the sale of various products : medicines, jewelry, and beauty products. Her business runs essentially in a very busy commercial zone. Thus, it is necessary for her to diversity her products.

This first loan will allow her to increase the range of her medicines, jewelry, and beauty products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

A 41 ans, madame A. Mulikat est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. C’est une commerçante qui s’adapte toujours au besoin de son milieu. C’est ainsi qu’elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente de divers produits : médicaments, bijoux, produits de beauté. Son activité se déroule essentiellement dans une zone commerciale très animée. Ainsi il est nécessaire pour elle de diversifier ses produits.

Ce premier crédit lui permettra d’augmenter la gamme de ses médicaments, bijoux et produits de beauté.

loans.use: To buy medicines and beauty products

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has two grown daughters. She runs a small business in the market of Novaya Kahovka. Tatyana sells childrens' clothing items. There are very few other people who are engaged in the trade in this marketplace. Tatyana has been in this business for eight years. She is a true entrepreneur and reality has been her teacher. Tatyana is very enterprising, decisive and determined. 
“Nadiya Ukraine” has provided consistent help to her business, making it a successful venture.

Tatyana has approximately $3000 invested in merchandise. She is a typical entrepreneur striving to make a better life for her family. “Nadiya Ukraine” has provided consistent help to her business, making it a successful venture. She is currently requesting a loan of 5000 grivnas to increase her seasonal inventory. One of Tatyana’s long-term plans is to purchase another vending facility. Tatyana’s natural ability to assess the business environment and take advantage of it will help her achieve independence and security in her business and life.

loans.use: to increase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga has operated a cosmetics sales business for five years. She has a son and raises him by herself. The business provides the sole source of income for her family. Olga has received and successfully repaid all her loans from Nadiya Ukraine. She earns approximately $500 each month. 

In addition to her marketing skills, Olga is efficient and focused and is able to provide affordable and high quality merchandise. She is friendly and gracious, always seeking opportunities to meet the needs of her clients. Olga is requesting a loan of 5000 grivnas to purchase additional inventory including facial creams, body lotions, cleansers and shower gels for further retail sale. With the increased profits, Olga plans to rent more vending facilities and expand her business.

loans.use: to Increase her inventory

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
This committee is formed by 15 hard-working women from the Santa Ana neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. The group is currently in the 7th cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) program, and to date, they all manage a line of credit of approximately 953.000 guaranis per member.

The first meetings for this committee took place in the home of Liliana H., and more than 15 women interested in being a part of this committee of hard-working women were present. Due to the occupation of most of its members, which is selling chipas (a typical dish from Paraguay), the first meetings took place very early in the morning. Liliana says that after the first few gatherings, the 15 women interested in taking part in the program were left, and since that is the minimum amount of members required, they were able to formally begin the committee, which is named Mujeres Emprendedoras de Santa Ana (Entrepreneurial Women of Santa Ana) and today is one of the longest-standing committees.

Currently, they find themselves in the middle of a project for the month of June due to the San Juan festivities, where they hold fairs with typical dishes and traditional games, such as the one with the guaraní name of “Tata ari jehasa,” with the objective of raising funds to strengthen the committee’s internal savings.

The loans they will receive will be invested in the purchase of ingredients used in the making of chipas such as starch, oil and cheese, as well as the purchase of herbs, sugar and sodas. Some of the women, especially the ones in the business of dressmaking, will purchase fabric, thread, a variety of buttons, zippers and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Santa Ana de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo se encuentra actualmente en el 7to. Ciclo del programa Mujeres Emprededoras, y a la fecha todas manejan una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 953.000 por cada integrante.

Las primeras reuniones del comité se realizó en el domicilio de la señora Liliana H. y estuvieron presentes mas de 15 señoras interesadas en formar parte del comités de mujeres trabajadoras, debido a la actividad que desarrolla la mayoría de las integrantes, que es la de vender chipas (comida típica de Paraguay), las primeras reuniones se realizaron a primeras horas de la mañana. Liliana cuenta que al final de las primeras charlas quedaron las 15 señoras interesadas en integrar el programa y como esa es la cantidad minima exigida, pudieron empezar formalmente el comité que lleva por nombre Mujeres Emprendedoras de Santa Ana y que hoy día es uno de los comités más antiguos.

Actualmente se encuentran en un proyecto de realizar una actividad en este mes de junio por las festividades de San Juan, en donde se realiza una ferias de comidas típicas y juegos tradicionales como el que lleva por nombre en guaraní “ Tata ari jehasa” con el objetivo de recaudar fondos para fortalecer el ahorro interno del comité.

Los préstamos que recibirán lo invertirán en la compra de productos para la elaboración de chipas como ser almidón, aceite, queso, queso, como así también para la compra de yerba, azúcar, gaseosas, también algunas señoras compraron especialmente las que se dedican al rubro de la confección telas, hilos, variedades de botones, cierres entre otros productos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as starch, vegetable oil, cheese, sugar, herbs, milk, cookies, beef, sodas, beer and all kinds of beverages, as well as fabric, thread and clothing for men, women and children.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married and has two daughters. After graduation from railway staff college she decided to launch her own small business in one of the local malls in Nikopol. Today Alla sells cosmetics, hair dye and perfumes. All her inventory is of very high quality. Alla’s key to success is her perseverance and diligence.  

Alla has been a market entrepreneur for about eight years. Currently, her turnover capital is about $1600. Her income is approximately $800 a month. Alla is now requesting a loan of 3000 grivnas to purchase eyeliner, lip gloss, face toner and other cosmetic items. She believes all this will make her business more profitable as a result. We believe Alla’s hard-work and responsible nature will help her repay the loan on time and achieve even more success in her trade.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Sekou

texts.fr:
Mr. Sékou K., 31, comes from a little village in Togo, Nzérekoré. He is married and the father of one child. After carefully studying his surroundings, he opened a sales point for cassettes, DVDs, and televisions in Anagokomé in Lomé. It was a success since he has had good sales receipts there. He is thinking of opening a shop in a different location, and this is what is pushing him to request this first loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur K. Sékou est originaire d’un petit village du TOGO qui est Nzérekoré. Agé de 31 ans il est marié et père d’un enfant. Après une bonne étude de son milieu, il a implanté à Anagokomé à Lomé, un point de vente de cassettes, de DVD, et de télévision. Ce fut une réussite car il y fait de bonnes recettes. Il compte ouvrir un autre point de vente dans un autre milieu, c’est ce qui le pousse à demander ce premier crédit.

loans.use:
Purchase of cassettes and opening a sales point

Achat de cassettes et decréation point de service

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kokoè G., who comes from Glidji, was born on December 2, 1966, is married, and has two children. To serve her area which is located quite far from the center of town, she has been running a general store selling groceries since 2006. To better satisfy her customers, she is requesting this first loan to add to her stock of various staple goods such as 10 cases of soap, 12 cases of canned goods.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Originaire de Glidji, madame G. Kokoè est née le 02 décembre 1966, s’est mariée et a 02 enfants. Pour desservir son milieu qui est assez éloigné du centre ville, elle a implanté un établissement de vente de divers produit d’alimentation générale depuis 2006. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients elle demande ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock en divers produits d’alimentation générale tels que 10 cartons de savon, 12 cartons de boite de conserve.

loans.use:
Purchase of groceries for re-sale

Achat des produits d'alimentaton générale

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Miss Oumou B. is 32 years old and lives with her brothers and sisters at her late father's home in Wayerma I, one of the peripheral districts in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After having tried several revenue-generating activities over the years, she decided 4 years ago to specialize in the purchase and sale of clothing and wax-printed pagnes (a cloth highly valued in West Africa). To obtain additional financial resources, she decided to turn to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to ask for an individual in order to better meet the needs of her growing clientele. She is on her first loan and intends to buy 30 sets of wax-printed pagnes in Bamako. Miss Oumou B. has combined two businesses : the direct sale of wax-printed pagnes and also stitching and sale to a more specific clientele. The sales are normally on credit for one month.

With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA and intends to contribute to the family expenses, pay off her loan, and invest in her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle Oumou B. a 32 ans, vit avec ses frères et soeurs chez son feu père à Wayerma I, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. (troisième région administrtive de la République du Mali).

Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus pendant des années, elle décida il y a maintenant 4 ans de se spécialiser dans l’achat vente des habits et pagnes Wax (Tissus très apprécié en Afrique de l’ouest). Pour obtenir des ressources financières additionnelles, elle décida de faire recours à l’Institution Soro Yiriwaso en demandant un prêt indivuduel. afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Elle est à son premier prêt et compte achéter 30 pièces de pagnes Wax à Bamako. Mademoiselle Oumou B. combine deux activités notamment la vente directe de pagne Wax mais aussi le fait de coudre et de vendre à une clientèle spécifique. La vente se fait généralement à crédit pour une durée d’un mois.

Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA et compte contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: To buy wax-printed pagnes (West African cloth)

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dédé D. was born on 16 April 1954 in Kéta in GHANA. Married to a hotelier, she has 2 children. She has a job which has impassioned her for 16 years. This consists of buying poultry and fruit in the villages near Lomé and re-selling them at the markets in Lomé.

She would like to increase her capital to make larger purchases (40 hens) in order to minimize her costs, which is why she is asking for this first loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

p>Le 16 avril 1954 madame D. Dédé naissait à Kéta au GHANA. Mariée à un hôtelier, elle a 02 enfants. Elle exerce un métier qui la passionne depuis 16ans. Cela consiste en l’achat des volailles et des fruits dans les villages environnants de la ville de Lomé qu’elle revend dans les marchés de Lomé.

Elle voudrait augmenter sont capital pour faire des achats plus importants (40 poules) afin de minimiser ses charges c’est pourquoi elle demande ce premier crédit.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ramatou O. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and 6 children in a monogamous household in Hamdallaye, one of the districts in the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

From the age of 7, she has engaged in revenue-generating activities, notably the sale of condiments, with her mother. With 32 years of experience, she enjoys a reputation and renown unequalled in the town of Sikasso.

To deal with the frequent stock shortages at the level of the grand market in Sikasso, she decided to take part in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso in order to create a sufficient stock for a longer period of time.

In 5 years of collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, she has obtained 3 solidarity loans and is on her second individual loan. With the current loan, she intends to buy 10 boxes of canned tomato concentrate, 2 bags of dried onions, 2 bags of pepper, 2 bags of Lorié leaves, and 5 boxes of food cubes from the grand market in Sikasso. She sells her wares in bulk for cash or on credit at the new market in Hamdallaye where she runs this business. The products are displayed on a large table and retailed to a clientele composed essentially of females. She intends to realize a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, with which she will pay off the interest on her loan, contribute to her family's expenses, and invest in her business.

Mrs. Ramatou O. intends to become a wholesaler able to supply the resupply the retailers in the market in the town of Sikasso.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Ramatou O. a 41 ans et vit avec 6 enfants et son époux dans une famille monogame à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali).

Dès l’age de 7 ans elle a commencé les activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente de condiments auprès de sa mère .Avec 32 ans d’expériences elle jouit d’ une réputation et d’une notorieté sans égale dans la ville de Sikasso.

Pour faire face aux ruptures de stock fréquentes au niveau du grand marché de Sikasso, elle décida d’integrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir constituer un stock suffisant pour une période un peu plus longue.

En 5 ans de collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso, elle a obtenu 3 prêts solidaires et est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Avec le prêt actuel, elle compte achéter 10 cartons de concentré de tomate en boite, 2 sacs d’oignons sèchées, 2 sacs de poivre, 2 sacs de feuilles de Lorié, 5 cartons de cubes alimentaires au grand marché de Sikasso. Elle vend en gros au comptant ou à crédit au nouveau marché de Hamdallaye où elle mène cette activité .Les produits son étalés sur une grande table et vendu en détail à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100000 FCFA. avec lequel elle payera les intérêts de son prêt, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, et investir le reste dans son activité.

Madame Ramatou O. envisage devenir une grossiste pouvant ravitailler les détaillants du marché de la ville de Sikasso.

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Born in Agou Gare in the plateau region on April 24, 1975, Mr. Komi A. is married and the father of 2 children. He lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé and since 2006, he has been selling beauty products and cosmetics. His business is booming because the neighborhood is quite far from the center of town and there is not a lot of competition. He is requesting this first loan to expand his range of cosmetic products by buying a case of crème and a case of perfume.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né a Agou Gare dans la région des plateaux le 24 avril 1975, monsieur A. Komi est marié et père de deux enfants. Il habite le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé et vend depuis 2006, des produits de beauté et des produits cosmétiques. Son commerce est florissant à cause de l’éloignement de leur quartier du centre ville où la concurrence est rude. Il demande ce premier crédit pour augmenter sa gamme de produits cosmétiques par l’achat d’un carton de crème et d’un carton de parfum.

loans.use:
Purchase of a case of creme and a case of perfume

Achat d'un carton de crème et de parfum

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sanata S. is 60 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Banconi neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (the third largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). At an early age, she chose to go into the restaurant business, which she learned from her mother. Her restaurant is located in a busy area of Sikasso, near the bus station. Despite her age, she is a woman who is very active and full of energy.

She has been a Soro Yiriwaso member for four years and has obtained a total of 12 loans, including three group loans (in a women’s association) and nine individual loans. With this loan, she intends to buy a ton and a half of rice, a half ton of millet and condiments for one month. This supply is regularly replenished. She sells different dishes all day long. She makes local and regional dishes (rice with lard, rice with different sauces, couscous, porridge, etc.). Her customers include truck drivers, travelers and others. She would like to earn a monthly income of 150,000 CFA francs, which she intends to use to contribute to paying her family’s expenses and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Sanata S. a 60 ans, et vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Banconi de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali ). Elle opta dès son jeune age pour la restauration qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa mère . Son restaurant est situé dans un point nevralgique de la ville de Sikasso à savoir la gare routière. Malgré son age avancé, cette dame déborde d’energie et est très active.

Elle est en rélation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans et a obtenu en tout 12 prêts dont 3 prêts solidaires ( dans une association des femmes) et 9 prêts individuels. Avec le prêt actuel, elle compte acheter une tonne et demi de riz, une demi tonne de mil et des condiments pour une période d’un mois. Ce stock est renouvélé regulièrement. Elle vend des plats diversifiés et cela pendant tout la journée. Ainsi elle prépare des plats du terrior et de la sous région (riz au gras, riz avec differentes sauces, le cousous, la bouillie etc...).Sa clientéle est constituée de routiers, de voyageurs et divers autres clients. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA et compte contribuera aux dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans son activité..

loans.use: Purchase of rice, millet and condiments

loans.name: Essi Félicité

texts.fr:
Originally from Kpalimé, Mrs. Essi Félicité A. was born on March 7, 1966 and now lives in Lomé with her husband and her 3 children. Since 1982, she has been selling lengths of African print cloth (pagnes) and generic items. Her business does well because she is clever in the places she targets, markets and busy crossroads.

After a first loan which allowed her to meet a big order for pagnes, she would like to take out this second loan to bolster her stock by buying 20 lengths of cloth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Originaire de Kpalimé, madame A. Essi Félicité est née le 07 mars 1966 et vit aujourd’hui à Lomé avec son mari et ses trois enfants. Depuis 1982, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes et de produits génériques. Son commerce marche à cause de la perspicacité des choix de ses cibles, les marchés et les carrefours animés.

Après un premier crédit qui lui a permis de faire face à une importante commande de pagne, elle voudrait prendre ce deuxième crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 20 pièces de pagne.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 lengths of African print cloth (pagnes)

Achat de 20 pièces de pagnes

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Wilmer G. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, actividad que realizo hace 5 años, vivo en la casa de mi madre ya que tengo problemas fisicos, me negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de nuestro hogar, ya que solo mi madre y yo salimos adelante juntos en esta situacion de nuestro pais que es muy dificil conseguir trabajos fijos, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas ropa para tener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesitamos para remodelar nuestra casa de habitacion, por lo tanto les solicito ayuda monetaria para poder salir adelante con mi negocio.

loans.use: compra de fardos de ropa usada

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Ana A. me dedico a la fabricacion de fritas de yuca-elote con azucar, tengo varios años haciendo este trabajo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el suentento de mi famila, en estos momentos tengo contratadas dos mujeres para la reparticion de mi producto, pero necesito tener mayor produccion ya que las ventas se han ido arriba y no me doy abasto con las necesidas de mis clientes, por lo tanto solicito su apoyo para poder comprar mas materia prima y tener una produccion mayor, con parte de las ganancias que obtenga deseo seguir ayudando a mi nieto que esta en la escuela.

loans.use: compra de yuca, manteca, sal, aceite, leña, fosforos, azucar, elotes

loans.name: Comité Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
The formation of the group was in May of 2007. Hermogena T. learned about the Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women program) and decided to form a group with her neighbors. Looking for women she could trust, she finally managed to form the committee which they named Kuña Aty.

The committee is in its 6th cycle and is not at all behind in their payments, which makes them an excellent group. They have 16 members, and they all work together to pay for their loans. They attend their weekly meetings and have a good amount of savings, which are deposited in a bank. The women have different occupations such as the sale of items like coal, fruits and vegetables, lingerie, handicrafts, baskets, bijouterie, etc.

The group Kuña Aty is situated in a rural settlement in the city of Capiatá. They are all the kind of people who daily place great effort to attain a better quality of life. They work hard so that they do not fail Fundación Paraguaya, and they place extreme value in the funds they receive through the committee loans.

Today, they are requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for its sale in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El inicio del Grupo fue en el mes de Mayo del 2007, la señora Hermogena T. se informó sobre el Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidió formar un grupo con sus vecinas, buscando señoras de su confianza, ella logró finalmente formar el comité al que denominaron Kuña Aty.

El Comité se encuentra en el 6º ciclo cuentan con 0 (cero) días de atraso lo que las convierte en un grupo excelente, son 16 las integrantes y todas trabajan en forma conjunta para pagar sus créditos, asisten a sus reuniones semanales y cuentan con una buena cantidad de ahorro el cual lo tienen depositado en una Financiera. Las integrantes se dedican a distintas actividades como: Venta de artículos varios como carbón, verduras y frutas, lencería, artesanías, canastas artesanales, bijouterie, etc.

El Grupo Kuña Aty se encuentra localizado en un asentamiento rural de la Ciudad de Capiatá. Todas son personas que día a día se esfuerzan por lograr una mejor condición de vida, se esfuerzan para no fallar con la Fundación Paraguaya y valoran sumamente el dinero que reciben através de los préstamos de comités.

Ellas hoy solicitan un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías para la venta en sus respectivos negocios.

loans.use: Purchase food, coal, fruits and vegetables, lingerie, handicrafts, baskets, bijouterie, etc. to sell in their respective businesses.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Ana A. me dedico a la fabricacion de fritas de yuca-elote con azucar, tengo varios años haciendo este trabajo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el suentento de mi famila, en estos momentos tengo contratadas dos mujeres para la reparticion de mi producto, pero necesito tener mayor produccion ya que las ventas se han ido arriba y no me doy abasto con las necesidas de mis clientes, por lo tanto solicito su apoyo para poder comprar mas materia prima y tener una produccion mayor, con parte de las ganancias que obtenga deseo seguir ayudando a mi nieta que esta en la escuela.

loans.use: compra de yuca, manteca, sal, aceite, leña, fosforos, azucar, elotes

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Atitlan Group

texts.en:
The women from the Margaritas de Atitlan group from Santiago Atitlan enjoy their community and like working in a group. Their main business activities are weaving and embroidery. They weave some items from the traditional indigenous outfit and embroiders the colorful designs on the top, which is known as a guipil. They sell these pieces to either intermediaries, local buyers or to people who order beforehand in the markets of Santiago and Panajachel, Lake Atitlan’s largest towns. During the rainy season (these months) their sales drop substantively. Otherwise, their microenterprises are doing well.

This credit has enabled them to invest in their small businesses. However, they consistently need more capital to continually spur the growth of their businesses. The credit they have requested will help them invest in not only cloth, dyes and thread, but in larger investments such as sewing machines and equipment.

The words of Maria del Carmen sum up the general sentiment of the mothers from this group, “I desire a better future for my kids and family.” She wants to enlarge the business so that life is a little easier.

loans.use: to purchase thread to embroider and weave guipiles

loans.name: Agnoko

texts.fr:
Born December 7, 1978 in Lomé, Mrs. Agnoko P. is married and the mother of 3 children. She sells used clothing in the Nyékonakpoè neighborhood in Lomé. Ever since she opened her stall in 2006, she has only been interested in women’s clothes, being of the opinion that women pay better than men.

This first credit that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 4 bales of used clothes and 5 rolls of cloth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née la 07 décembre 1978 à Lomé, Madame P. Agnoko est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est revendeuse de friperie dans le quartier de Nyékonakpoè à Lomé. Depuis 2006 qu’elle a commencé elle ne s’intéressait qu’à la vente de vêtements de femme sous prétexte que les femmes payent mieux que les hommes.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 4 ballots de friperie et 5 rouleaux de tissus.

loans.use:
Purchase of clothing for re-sale

Achat de vêtements

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto owns a small newstand. He has 4 school-age children; the oldest also sells newspapers on the weekends in order to help out with his education. His youngest son helps him at the stand. He lives in a small building in a zone located far from the city center, and he has to get up very early in order to be at his stand. This loan will help him add CDs, magazine and books to his stock, and in this way he can increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Roberto posee un pequeño puesto de periódicos, tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, el mayor se dedica también a la venta de periódicos los fines de semana para ayudarse así con sus estudios, su hijo menor sale a vender con él, vive en una pequeña construcción en una zona alejada del centro de la ciudad, por lo que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para ir a atender al puesto. El crédito le ayuda a aumentar su mercadería con cd’s, revistas y libros y así incrementar sus ingresos

loans.use: Increase his stock.

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr:
Mrs. Félicité N. was born on February 11, 1974 in Lomé. She has three children but is a divorced woman. Back in 2006, she opened a document-processing center in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. In her center she also sells handbags.

She has already had one loan through WAGES and reimbursed it correctly. This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to acquire two new computers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame N. Félicité est née le 11 février 1974 à Lomé. Elle a trois enfants mais est une femme divorcée. Depuis l’année 2006, elle a crée un centre de traitement de textes dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Dans son centre elle profite aussi pour vendre les sacs de sortie.

Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir deux nouveaux ordinateurs.

loans.use:
Purchase of two computers

Achat de deux ordinateurs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mayi

texts.fr:
Originally from Bassar in the northwest of Togo, Mrs. Mayi K. was born on December 31, 1969 in Bassar. She is married to Mr. Kodzo Dentey who teaches driver’s education. She has 3 children and in 1998, she opened a bar in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. In her establishment, BAR LUCIOLE, she creates a welcoming atmosphere and serves her customers to their satisfaction.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 40 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Originaire de BASSAR au nord ouest du Togo, madame K. Mayi est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Bassar. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur DENTEY Kodzo qui est un moniteur d’Auto-école. Elle a trois enfants et a ouvert en 1998 un bar dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Dans son BAR « BAR LUCIOLE », elle accueille bien ses clients et leur rend un service satisfaisant.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 40 casiers de bières.

loans.use:
Purchase of 40 cases of beer

Achat de 40 casiers de bières

loans.name: Komi Egnonam

texts.fr:
Mr. Komi Egnonam A. is dynamic and interested in business related to domestic women. He sells spices and onions at the Atikpodji market in Lomé. He was born November 1, 1969 in Tsévié, a city located 35 km from Lomé. He is married and a father of three children. He started this business since 1999, which has since then, thrived and housewives like to purchase goods from him. This is the first loan that he seeks - it will allow him to buy 9 sacks of onions and 1 sack of spices.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator .

Dynamique et motivé pour exercer le commerce des femmes, Monsieur A. Komi Egnonam est revendeur d’épices et d’oignons dans le marché d’Atikpodji à Lomé. Il est né le 1er novembre 1969 à Tsévié ville située à 35 Km de Lomé. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Ce commerce qu’il a commencé depuis 1999 devient florissant et les femmes de ménage aiment acheter chez lui. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 9 sacs d’oignon et 1 sac d’épices.

loans.use: buy onions and spices

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Maria V. me dedico a la produccion y venta de reposteria como ser pasteles, tres leches, galletas, quequitos, pastelitos, pan de pan, tortas de vainilla, actividad que realizo hace 5 años, mi producto lo reparto en el mercado y diferentes mercaditos cerca de mi colinia, tengo 2 hijos, uno de 9 años y otro de 2 años de edad, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para el sustento de mi familia, el se dedica a prestacion de servicios de transporte y entre los dos hemos logrado salir adelante con nuestra familia y hogar.
ahora las necesidades de mis clientes han aumentado en un 50% por lo que necesito tener una produccion mayor, por tal razon solicito un prestamo de dinero para poder cumplir con las exigencias de mis clientes y asi poder salir adelante con mi negocio,

loans.use: compra de moldes para galletas, cajas plasticas, cajas para pasteles grandes, harina, levadura, sal, huevos, saborizantes, leche de vaca, leche condensada, leche evaporada, frutas, margarina, manteca,

loans.name: Association Adjola Group

texts.fr:
The Association DITORGUIE Agoè (l’association DITORGUIE Agoè) was formed in 2007 by three dynamic women who found it necessary to regroup. These members are involved in diverse commercial activities that range from selling pots, basic goods, and shoes. They are all married and have families. This is the group's first loan, which will allow them to buy 28 pairs of shoes, 22 pots, and 12 bottled drinks, which are local to the region.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Créée en 2007 par un groupe de trois femmes dynamiques, l’association DITORGUIE Agoè a pour objectif la satisfaction des besoins des membres qu’elle regroupe. Ses membres exercent divers types d’activités commerciales telles que la vente de marmites, la vente des produits de premières nécessités et la vente de chaussures. Elles sont tous des femmes mariées et sont des mères de famille. Le premier crédit que cette association sollicite actuellement lui permettra de faire les achats de 28 paires de chaussures, de 22 marmites et 12 bouteilles de boisson locale.

loans.use: buy basic goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anielka Lissette

texts.es:
Anielka Martínez is in the business of livestock and agriculture in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She has been in the business of breeding livestock for dairy production as well as the production of basic grains and pork and poultry farming.

She is characterized as being a very hard-working woman, having improved the condition of her home thanks to her multiple efforts in the production of basic grains and the breeding of livestock. Today, her purpose for turning to Ceprodel is to obtain the necessary funds for the purchase of livestock to produce milk and to improve her cultivation of basic grains. For this reason, she hopes that her loan is granted satisfactorily by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Anielka Martínez se dedica a la labor agropecuaria en su municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de producción de ganado lechero y la producción de granos básicos además se dedica a la crianza de ganado porcino y avícola.

Ella se caracteriza por ser una dama muy esforzada que ha mejorado la condición de su casa gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos en el trabajo de la producción de granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual acude a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra del ganado para extraer la leche y además para mejorar en el cultivo de granos básicos. Es por esto que espera que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente por la institución.

loans.use: Purchase livestock to produce milk and improve her cultivation of basic grains.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Maria R. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, con el cual he logrado ir creciendo y ahora cuento con una variedad de productos, yo solo vivo con  mi esposo y con el apoyo de el hemos logrado salir adelante ya que ha nuestra edad es bien dificil conseguir trabajo en una empresa privada o publica, en estos momentos necesito inyectarle capital a mi trabajo, pero no tengo suficiente capital para realizarlo, por eso pido a uds un apoyo monetario para poder hacer crecer un poco mas ni negocio el cual es el unico que me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi hogar.

loans.use: compra de refrescos, maiz, azucar, frijoles, churros, manteca, aceite, margarina, confites, jabones, razuradoras, pastas, salsas, chile, sal, especias, palomitas de maiz, sopas, confites, galletas, pan, mantequilla,embutidos

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer V. is in the livestock business, carrying it out in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. He breeds livestock, with which he provides sustenance for his humble home.

It is important to note that since he started his business, he has acquired an abundance of experience due to his great dedication and the knowledge he has acquired breeding his animals.

The reason why he looks for support from Ceprodel is that he needs to purchase livestock so he may sell it and in that way, continue with his arduous work with cattle in his sector.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El joven Elmer V. se dedica a la labor de la ganadería desempeñándose en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a la crianza del ganado con el cual lleva el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

Es de importancia destacar que desde que inició con este negocio ha adquirido grandes experiencias por su gran dedicación y porque ha aprendido en la crianza de sus animales.

La razón por la cual busca el apoyo en Ceprodel es porque necesita la compra de ganado para comercializarlo y así continuar con su ardo trabajo pecuario en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 28 years old and single. For the past seven years she has had a business selling clothes, slippers and dressing bags. Generally, she buys her stock on credit and pays back her suppliers after sales.

However, she is convinced that her business will grow better with increased capital and has applied for this loan in order to increase her stock. Florence believes that this will decrease her purchase cost very significantly which will increase her income and enable her to expand the business.

Florence belongs to a community group called Lydia ‘mma’ (meaning Children of Lydia) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee each others’ loans by providing social collateral for loan access and peer pressure to repay the loan. This photo of Florence was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, slippers, and dresing bags for re-sale

loans.name: Bernith

texts.es:
Mrs. Bernith A. P., partner of the Community Bank, "Santa Isabel" lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Picota, village of Nueva Union. She sells clothes and shoes, complemented by the sale of plastics, and accessories, and a few general goods. Her business is located in her own home in Jr. Union.

After trying other businesses, which she worked outside the house, Bernith decided to switch to a business where she did not have to leave home. She then decided to tackle the sale of shoes, clothes, general goods, accessories and plastics, a little bit of everything so her customers can find all they are looking for.

With a loan of $525, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy clothing, shoes for women, men, and children of different sizes and styles, as well as accessory items, such as earrings, hangers, among other things in large quantities, in addition to basic household necessities in order to keep her business well supplied.

Bernith lives with her husband and 2 children who help her assist customers. She is a secure woman, enthusiastic and continues to do well in life. One of her goals is to buy another rack to organize and display her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Translator

La señora Bernith A. P., socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Isabel” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, Caserío de Nueva Unión, se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos, complementando con la venta de plásticos, pasamanería y un poco de abarrotes, su negocio se ubica en su propia casa ubicado en el Jr. Unión s/n. Después de probar en otros negocios, en los cuales tenía que salir de casa, decidió cambiar por uno en que no dejaría su casa, y decide emprender en el negocio de venta de ropas, zapatos, abarrotes, plásticos y pasamanería, un poco de todo y así el cliente encuentre todo lo que solicite. Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1,500.00, que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará prendas de vestir, zapatos para damas caballeros y niños en diferentes tallas y modelos, además artículos de pasamanería como aretes, ganchos entre otros en grandes cantidades y productos de primera necesidad y plásticos para tener bien surtido su negocio. Bernith, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos que le apoyan en la atención de los clientes, ella es una mujer segura, entusiasta y con ganas de seguir triunfando en la vida, uno de sus objetivos es comprar otro andamio para ordenar y exhibir su mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, accessories and other goods.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jaime Will

texts.es:
Since he was a little boy, Jaime Will O. has learned to work on the farm and since has devoted himself to his agricultural business raising crops and animals.

After many years, Jaime has managed to improve his financial situation and he is now able to care more for his crops and animals. He has turned to Ceprodel for a loan to purchase inputs for his harvest, as well as for taking care of his animals. He hopes his loan application will be approved so he can continue with his agricultural business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Jaime Will O. desde que era un pequeño niño aprendió a trabajar en el campo dedicándose al negocio agropecuario o sea con la agricultura y los animales en su crianza para su respectivo desarrollo.

Hoy en día a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo ha logrado mejorar en parte su situación económica y les ha dado un mejor cuido y atención a sus animales y a sus cultivos. La razón por el cual acude a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de insumos para la cosecha y además para la crianza de los animales. Por este motivo espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar con su negocio en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase of inputs for planting crops

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina, 40, is married with five children. Two of her children have already completed senior high school and the others are still in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood and has been operating this business for the past four years. She sells many grocery items like evaporated milk, soaps, rice, sugar, biscuits, canned foods and drinks, etc.

Faustina is focused on expanding her shop and has applied for this loan in order to increase her stock of items that are most commonly purchased by her customers such as rice, sugar, soap, canned foods, and biscuits.

She belongs to a community group called Lydia ‘mma’ (meaning Children of Lydia) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee each others’ loans by providing social collateral for loan access and peer pressure to repay the loan. This photo of Faustina was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of rice, sugar, soap, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Association Lonlon Agoe Group

texts.fr:
The LONLON Agoè Association ("L’ Association LONLON Agoè") was founded in July 2006 in the Agoè district of Lomé. The members who make up this group are involved in small businesses. Three women from this association had the vision to help each other and find ways to profit each of their businesses. They are all married and have families. They are talented in their work, having had more than 7 years of experience running small businesses. This is the LONLON Agoè Association's second loan. The group requests a loan to buy 3 sacks of rice, 1 bag of chili peppers, and 6 sacks of mustard.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

L’ Association LONLON Agoè est créée en juillet 2006 dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Les activités des membres de cette association sont les petits commerces. Les trois femmes de cette association ont pour objectif l’entraide mutuelle et la recherche du profit sur leurs activités. Elles sont mariées et mères de famille. Elles sont douées dans l’exercice de leur activité car ayant des expériences de plus de 7 ans dans le petit commerce. L’association LONLON Agoè est à son 2ème cycle de près et sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de riz, 1 sac de piments et 6 paniers de moutarde.

loans.use: to buy basic goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: José Ramon

texts.es:
Mr. José Ramón C. is a man who is dedicated to his agricultural business in the municipality of Somotillo, which is in the city of Chinandega. He worked hard to stand out in the business, for he had a family to maintain - his wife and their four children who are all students.

As in all growing businesses, C.'s needs to invest in oxen for his livestock. For this reason, he approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will be used to buy the farm animals and also continue to establish his business in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

El señor José Ramón C. es un caballero que se dedica a laborar en el negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Con mucho esfuerzo se ha destacado en el negocio ya que ha logrado mantener a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en edades escolares.

Hoy en día como todo negocio en desarrollo, el negocio agropecuario del señor C. requiere invertir en la compra de bueyes para su respectiva crianza. Por este motivo es que él muy confiadamente acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de estos animales y así continuar con su negocio en su comunidad.

loans.use: to buy livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Mrs. Doris G. B. is a partner of the Community Bank, "Santa Isabel," and lives in the San Martin region, district and province of Picota, in the Nueva Union village. She has a store where she sell general goods, products of everyday needs, household cleaning and personal hygiene products.

Her business is located in her own home in Jiron Union village. She believes in order to keep her clientele it is necessary to keep her business well supplied and maintain good service towards her customers. Before she sold "agaujes" (a local fruit) and chicken, which did not go well. So she decided to try this new business, and thanks to the loan that she received, her business is now growing and doing better.

With a loan of $525, which she will return in 6 months, she will buy goods such as: rice, bags of sugar, canned goods, like milk, of different brands and sizes, canned fish in boxes, pallets of eggs, packaged bread, litres of cooking oil, packaged soda pop, sweets, household cleaning items, and personal hygiene products, so that she can supply her business and meet the needs of her customers.

Doris is a young woman of 29 years, lives with her husband and 3 children, one boy and two girls. She is very proud of herself for having achieved all that she has in such a short time, which is fruit of her constant effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Doris Guzmán B. socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Isabel” vive en la Región San Martín Provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, Caserío de Nueva Unión, ella tiene una Bodega donde vende abarrotes en general, productos de primera necesidad, aseo personal y para el hogar. su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Unión del mismo caserío. Considera que para mantener a sus clientes hay que surtir bien el negocio y tener buen trato hacia ellos, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de aguajes, pollo y no le fue muy bien, entonces decidió probar en este nuevo negocio, gracias al préstamo que le dieron, está implementando más y mejor su negocio. Con el crédito recibido de S/.1,500.00 que lo devolverá en 6 meses, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar en sacos, productos enlatados como leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, conservas de pescado en cajas, huevos en javas, panes en bolsas, aceite en litros, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas, productos para la limpieza del hogar y de aseo personal para así surtir su negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. La señora Doris, es una mujer joven de 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, un varón y dos mujeres, se siente muy orgullosa de si misma por haber logrado todo lo que tiene en poco tiempo ya que es fruto de su constante esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Compra al por mayor de productos diversos (abarrotes)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 40, is married and has one child who is in school. For the past twelve years, she has had a business selling clothing, slippers and dressing bags.

Unfortunately, Juliana has low working capital. As a result, she is not able to purchase high quality products. She believes that a loan will help her meet the tastes and preferences of her customers. She would use her loan to buy more clothing, slippers and dressing bags. She would also expand her stock to include traveling bags.

Juliana belongs to a community group called Lydia ‘mma’ (meaning Children of Lydia) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee each others’ loans by providing social collateral for loan access and peer pressure to repay the loan. This photo of Juliana was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and expand her stock to include traveling bags

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es:
Juan Santos owns a farm business producing cereal crops in the Somotillo district in the city of Chinandega. His efforts have made him known as a successful businessman and enabled him to support his wife and two children.

Currently Juan is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of crop inputs and has turned to Ceprodel for credit. With the loan he will be able to save his crops, have an excellent harvest and, in doing so, improve his financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Juan Santos es un caballero que se dedica al negocio agrícola a la producción de granos básicos en su municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Con mucho esfuerzo se ha destacado para salir adelante en su negocio y mantener a su cónyuge y dos hijos.

Actualmente el propósito por el cual solicita el crédito es para la inversión en la compra de insumos para los cultivos. Este es el motivo por el cual él acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito y de esta manera salvar sus cultivos para tener una excelente cosecha y así mejorar su condición económica.

loans.use: Purchase of inputs for planting crops

loans.name: Atanimodom

texts.fr:
Ms. Atanimodom A. was born on May 5, 1985 in Guérinkouka, north of Togo. She is single and takes care of her two younger sisters who are still in primary school. In 2002, she started a shop sold beauty products and basic goods in the Adidogomé district in Lomé. At her shop, "ATANI ESTETIQUE", basic goods are more predominant than beauty products, for she's noticed that the latter does not sell as quickly. So she sells more milk, soap, canned goods, etc. This is the first loan that she seeks; it will allow her to buy 15 sacks of rice and other beauty products.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Mademoiselle A. Atanimodom est née le 5 mai 1985 à Guérinkouka au nord du Togo. Elle est célibataire et assure la charge de ses deux petites sœurs qui sont au cours primaires. En 2002, elle a crée une boutique de vente des produits de beauté et des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Dans sa boutique « ATANI ESTETIQUE », les produits de premières nécessités dominent les produits de beauté car elle a constaté que ses derniers ne coulent pas vite et s’adonne plus à la vente de lait, de savons, de boîte de conserve et autres. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 15 sacs de riz et quelques produits de beauté.

loans.use: buy basic goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Mr. Pedro M. is dedicated to his agricultural business in the municipality of Somotillo, which is in the city of Chinandega. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. As of now, he has acquired fair experience in agriculture.

Currently, he is very happy, for his young son is the motivation for his desire to grow his business. He approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy more ingredients/seeds to sow for a good harvest and to take care of his son and his home.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Pedro M. se dedica a su negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Sus inicios fueron desde muy pequeño habiendo aprendido a trabajar en los cultivos y ahora ha adquirido basta experiencia en la agricultura.

Actualmente se siente muy alegre por su pequeño hijo siendo este el motivo por el cual se esfuerza para salir adelante en el negocio. Ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra con el propósito de obtener una buena cosecha para continuar con el mantenimiento de su hijo y de su hogar.

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is forty years old. She is married and the mother of three children; one of her children has completed senior high school and the other two are in primary school.

For the past fifteen years, Ama has worked as a trader selling clothing, lace, and slippers among other things. Her husband provided the capital necessary to start the business, but unfortunately this is not adequate for purchasing the large quantity of high quality items necessary to expand her business. Ama applied for this loan because she believes that the additional resources will enable her to meet customer demand.

She belongs to a community group called Lydia ‘mma’ (meaning Children of Lydia) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee each others’ loans by providing social collateral for loan access and peer pressure to repay the loan. This photo of Ama was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more high quality clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Hortencia R. A. is a partner of the Communal Bank "Santa Isabel," and lives in the San Martin region, in the Picota district and Province. She makes and sells "anticuchos", "tacachos", and "juanes" (typical food of the region), developing her business on one of the principal corners of the city, located between little Picota and Bolognesi, where her regulars come daily. Her customers are locals and seasonal residents from other towns. Without the support of her husband, she started selling juanes. With her first loan she bought a rotisserie, tables, chairs and pans that she needed to grow her business. Now in addition to "juanes," she sells "anticuchos," "tacachos," and grilled meat in general, having earned a substantial clientele.

With a loan of $275, that will be returned in 6 months, she will buy the materials needed to prepare foods such as, rice, bags of sugar, gallons of oil, pork fat, chicken for the "anticuchos," banana bunches, as well as large pots to cook "juanes."

Hortensia is an enthusiatic 47-year-old woman with 2 children to whom she wants to give a better future, and wants them to feel proud of the mother they have. She is a happy woman contuniung to work and excel in life.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hortencia Rodríguez A. es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Isabel”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, tacachos y juanes (comidas típicas de la zona), desarrollando su negocio en una de las esquinas principales de la ciudad ubicada entre el Jr. Picota y Bolognesi donde diariamente acuden sus comensales, que son moradores y transeúntes de la propia localidad. Al no tener el apoyo de su esposo, se inicia en la venta de juanes, con su primer préstamo compró su parrilla, mesas, sillas y ollas que necesitaba para crecer en su negocio, ahora vende demás de juanes, anticuchos, tacachos y carnes a la parrilla en general, habiendo ganado gran cantidad de clientes. Con el crédito recibido de S/ 800.00 que devolverá en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como, arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en galones, manteca de chancho, pollo para los anticuchos, plátanos en racimos además compro ollas grandes para cocinar los juánes. Hortencia, es una mujer entusiasta de 47 años, con 2 hijos a quienes quiere darles futuro mejor, que ellos se sientan orgullosos de la mamá que tienen, es una mujer feliz con ganas de seguir trabajando y sobresalir en la vida.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and cooking pots

loans.name: Diomar

texts.es:
Mrs. Diomar Rodrigues A. belongs to the Communal Bank, " El Triunfo," and lives in the San Martin region, Picota district and Province, Peru. Her business is located in littel San Martin, where she makes and sells wooden furniture such as, tables, chairs, chests of drawers, beds, display cases, shelves, and living room furniture, among other things.

She started her business 8 years ago, and due to the great finishes she puts on her furniture, she quickly gained loyal customers. Her cerpentry is some of the most sought-after in the area, and she continues to rely on the loyalty of her customers who refer others to her.

With a loan of $525, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase different varieties of wood, such as cedar, ishpingo (a local tree with yellow wood), and mahogany panels, which are the most desired materials in the region for their fine quality and durability in furniture.

Diomar is 31 years old and has 3 daughters who are her pride. She is very happy that she can count on the support of her husband and family, who take care of household work so that her business can move forward.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Diomar Rodríguez A. pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. San Martín, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de muebles de madera como: mesas, sillas, cómodas, camas, vitrinas, estantes, muebles de salas entre otros. Se inició en este negocio hace 8 años, por los buenos acabados que le da a sus muebles rápidamente se gano la preferencia de los clientes, su carpintería es una de las mas solicitadas del medio, sigue contando con la preferencia de sus clientes quienes le recomiendan a otras personas. Con el crédito de S/.1,500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará madera de diferentes variedades como cedro, ishpingo, caoba en cuartones que son los más solicitados en la zona por su buena calidad y duración de los muebles. La señora Diomar tiene 31 años, y 3 hijas mujeres que son su orgullo, ella se siente muy feliz por contar con el apoyo de su esposo y su familia, para que el negocio salga adelante, ellos son quienes le apoyan en las labores domesticas. .

loans.use: Compra de madera al por mayor.

loans.name: Mujeres Amistad Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Amistad group is from a pleasant community at the base of Lake Atitlan’s smallest volcano, Cerro de Oro. The women of this group enjoy working in a group to pay off loans because of the mutual help they provide each other and fun group activities.

These women mostly weave traditional indigenous clothing. Others sell food around their neighborhood. The weavers sell almost entirely in the largest town of Lake Atitlan, Santiago and mostly to intermediaries who add embroidery to their pieces and sell them around the lake area.

Although they face competition in Santiago, the extra capital of the loans and their ability to buy wholesale materials helps them remain competitive.

For Josefa T., increased investment leads to increased profit, which allows her to spend extra money on her family. She also maintains two employees which allow her to make about four guipiles per week.

On average the women can produce a guipil without embroidery in two days and sells it for 90 to 115 quetzales (13-15 dollars). At this rate, their only limitation is limited capital. Loans allow the women to get over this obstacle and earn enough money to live a comfortable family life and grow their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase thread to weave and embroider traditional blouses

loans.name: Zadith

texts.es:
Mrs. Zadith P.
