With the S/.700 (700 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 4 months, Lucia will buy pastas of various kinds and brands; boxes of canned foods; sacks of rice and sugar; cooking oil in liter bottles; bulk supplies of eggs, "menestras" (a local soup) and different kinds of fruit from the coast, all things that her customers demand.

Lucia, 38, lives with her husband and their 4 children. She feels free to make decisions for her business and manage it the way that she wants. Her charisma draws her customers in as surely as her well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lucia R. C., es socia del Banco Comunal Las “Flores “ vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Rioja, distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y granos, su local cuenta con una variedad de producto, está ubicado en el Mercado Faustino Maldonado puesto 20 del mismo distrito. Gracias a su perseverancia en el trabajo, el apoyo de su esposo e hijos, ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente actualmente cuenta con un negocio bien surtido, oferta variedad de productos, a sus clientes que a diario le visitan.

El préstamo recibido de S/. 700.00 que será devuelto en 4 meses, con dicho capital comprará fideos de distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botellas de litro, huevos en javas, menestras y una variedad de frutas de la costa debido a que estos alimentos son muy requeridos por sus clientes .

Tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos de edad, se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio. Por su carisma atrae a sus clientes además de atenderlas con amabilidad y tener un negocio surtido.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Charito is a member of the "El Triunfo" ("Triumph") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "region" of San Martin and earns a living as a street vendor, selling "chupetes" (a sweet "sucker"). She targets schools, the main plaza and sports fields. She started the business on her own initiative. Thanks to her hard work and perseverance, her sales of chupetes have grown.

With the S/.2000 (2000 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 6 months, Charito will buy the supplies she needs to make chupetes: gelatin, sugar by the kilo, milk, fresh local fruit and other ingredients that she will use to make her products attractive.

Charito, 27, lives with her husand and son, who she tends to and struggles for. With characteristic good nature and humility, she ultimately wants to have a business selling groceries that will provide her with a secure future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Charito López I. es socia del Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, se dedica a la venta de chupetes en su propia casa en el Jr. Ucayali en la 6 cuadra, su centro de comercialización son los Centros Educativos, la plaza principal y los campos deportivos. Se inició en el negocio por iniciativa propia , gracias a su esfuerzo y perseverancia la venta de chupetes hoy en día se ha incrementado.

El crédito recibido de S/. 2,000.00 a ser pagado en 6 meses comprará los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de los chupetes como: gelatina, azúcar en kilos, leche, frutas frescas de la región y otros ingredientes que empleara para que salga agradable su producto..

Actualmente tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo, por quien velar y luchar, con su amabilidad que le caracteriza y su humildad, tiene planes de tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes que le de en el futuro una estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Buy bulk supplies for resale.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is a member of the "El Triunfo" ("Triumph") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin and makes a living selling beauty products. For 2 years, she's sold various brands of perfumes and cosmetics, ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE, which she's ordered and bought from catalogs to sell to her friends and neighbors, her principal customers.

With the S/.1200 (1200 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 6 months, Doris will buy products such as perfumes, cremes, shampoos, foot and body powder, make-up, deodorants, lipstick, etc. She will buy products that are in good supply so that she can stock a range of merchandise.

Doris, 30, lives with her husband and their 2 children, her motive for continuing to work because she dreams of having a business selling "refrigerios" (snack foods of various kinds) so that she can help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Doris B. I., socia del Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de Picota, Distrito de San Hilarión se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza ella atiendo con pedidos en el Jr. Huallaga Nº 585. Se dedica a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos de diferentes marcas como ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE, hace 2 años, los mismos que los vende a través de pedidos y por catalogo que oferta a su vecinos y amigos que son sus principales clientes.

Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1,200.00 que será devuelto en 6 meses, comprará diversos artículos como perfumes, cremas, champús, talco de cuerpo y pies, maquillajes, desodorante, lápiz labial, etc. Comprará artículos que salen en oferta y de esa manera contará con un stock de diversos productos.

Tiene 30 años vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, por el cual es el motor para seguir trabajando ya que ella sueña con tener un negocio que se dedique ala venta de refrigerios y así poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy beauty products for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a member of the "El Triunfo" ("Triumph") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin and earns a living selling beauty products (UNIQUE). Her clients are friends who recommend her to others and that's how she's managed to build a good customer base. She started with help from her sister-in-law, to contribute to paying the family's expenses.

With the S/.2300 (2300 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy products such as perfumes, fingernail polish in different colors, cremes, shampoos, soaps, deodorants, as well as other merchandise for resale such as earrings, chains, bracelets, rings of various kinds. Having the products on hand and offering a wider range of products will allow her to meet the demands of her customers.

Gloria, 33, lives with her husband and their 3 young children. She would like to explore new avenues and she hopes to to have a well-stocked grocery business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria P. H., socia del Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de Picota, Distrito de San Hilarión, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (UNIQUE), sus clientes son sus amigos quienes le recomiendan a otras personas así ha logrado tener una buena clientela. Se inició con el apoyo de su cuñada, ya que necesitaba tener un ingreso propio que le ayude a solventar los gastos de su familia.

Con el crédito de S/. 2,300.00 que será devuelto en 6 meses, comprará diversos artículos como perfumes, esmaltes de diferentes colores, cremas, champús, jabones, desodorante y otros productos más, también artículos de bijouteria como aretes, cadenas, pulseras, anillos de diferentes modelos, para tener en stock y variar sus productos y poder satisfacer los gustos y exigencias de sus clientes.

Gloria es una mujer joven de 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 03 menores hijos, con ganas de salir delante y emprender nuevos caminos, anhela tener un negocio de abarrotes bien surtido.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Mathsah

texts.en:
Mr. Mathsah S. is a villager in Kampong Tralach Krom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is 51 years old and the father of five children, all of whom attend school. He currently owns a small restaurant where he sells Chinese noodles to the villagers.

His wife, Mrs. Slamas Heo, sells beef at the market. Since her business has improved, Mrs. Slamas Heo would like to expand it. Mr. Mathsah S. is asking for a loan to buy more beef for his wife's business.

loans.use: To buy more beef for his wife's business.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say M. and her husband, Mr. Voeurn Vin, are traditional healers who can generate a small profit in Soben (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Even though they do not have any children, they live in poor conditions because inflation has increased a lot in Cambodia.

They are currently in an old house, so Mrs. Say M. is requesting a loan to buy timber to build a new house. Mrs. Say M. used a previous loan from AMK to buy a new motorbike so they could sell their traditional medicine treatment door-to-door.

Mrs. Say M. was not available, so her husbend, Mr. Voeurn Vin, appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a new house

loans.name: Sreypoch

texts.en: Mrs. Sreypoch K. lives in Soben (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Sophal Bich, is a policeman who earns a small salary. Mrs. Sreypoch K. is 25 years old and is the mother of a young child. Although Mrs. Sreypoch K. and her husband have two different businesses, they still live in poor conditions in an old house. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Sreypoch K. is asking for a loan to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Mrs. Meng M. sells Khmer noodles in Soben (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She used a previous loan to start her business. Since her business activity has improved, Mrs. Meng M. is now requesting a loan to buy more Khmer noodles and ingredients to cook delicious food for her customers.

Her husband, Mr. Khom In, is a driver who uses his motorbike with a cart to carry goods. Mrs. Meng M. is 30 years old and is the mother of five children, three of whom attend school. The others are too young.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer noodles and ingredients

loans.name: Eourn

texts.en:
Mrs. Eourn C. lives in Samroung Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She sells vegetables. She is 46 years old and a widow with a child who is enrolled in school. Mrs. Eourn C. used a previous loan to start her vegetable business.

Because inflation has raised prices in Cambodia, Mrs. Eourn C. now lives in poor conditions. Her house is leaking because she does not have enough money to repair the roof. Thus, Mrs. Eourn C. is asking for a loan to buy zinc to fix the old roof.

loans.use: To buy more zinc to fix her leaky roof

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en:
Mr. Kuch S. grows crops on the farmland behind his house. His wife helps with the farming as well. They earn a combined $2 per day and live with four children in Tamao Village, Kampong Cham Province. Due to rising family expenses, they must both work very hard every day to grow enough crops to support the family.

Now S. is asking for a loan of $150 to support his farming business. He plans on using the loan to purchase soybean seeds for his farm.

loans.use: To purchase soybean seeds.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mr. Sim K. raises fish in a pond near his house. He tends to the fish by feeding them and then selling them once they are of adequate size. His wife also helps him with his fish business. They both live in Toul Chambak Village, Kampong Cham Province.

Because of the growing demand for his fish, he is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase small fish and additional fish food. The loan will allow him and his wife to expand their fish business, and thereby increase their family income in the future.

loans.use: To purchase small fish and additional fish food

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao L. is a villager in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She sells clothes and she has a second business making and selling desserts. She used a previous AMK loan to start her dessert business. Her husband, Mr. Im Oeun, is a motorbike-taxi driver. Mrs. Sreymao L. is 21 years old and the mother of two young children.

Mrs. Sreymao L.’s clothing business has improved, so she would like to expand it, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan to buy more fashionable clothes to sell to her customers.

Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fashion clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao K. lives in Kan Yuon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She sells fish. Mrs. Mao K. used a previous loan to start her fish business. Her business now has improved, so Mrs. Mao K. decided to ask for another loan to purchase more fish to resell at the market.

Her husband, Mr. Art Oeurn, always helps his wife with her business. Mrs. Mao K. is 36 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell in the market.

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Mrs. Kay H. sells baskets in Spork Reach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Kem Soam, is the village chief, and earns only a small salary. They have two children. One is a subsistence farmer; the other one attends school.

Even though these family members have different business activities, they cannot support and improve the family's conditions. Thus, Mrs. Kay H. decided to ask for a loan to start her own business as a "rice middlewoman," a person who buys rice to keep in stock and sell for a better price later in the year.

loans.use: To start a business as a rice middle(wo)man

loans.name: Voth

texts.en:
Mrs. Voth D. lives in Prey Leak Neng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is currently a housewife who always cooks delicious meals for her family. Her husband, Mr. Thon Prak, is a woodsman and farmer.

Mr. Thon Prak’s farm is facing a small problem because he lacks draft animals, so Mrs. Voth D. is asking for a loan to buy a cow to work with their current cow as draft animals on the farm.

Mrs. Voth D. is 47 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom works in a garment factory, while another looks after the cow. The remaining two attend school. Mrs. Voth D. used a previous loan to buy fertilizer to support their rice field.

Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to use as a draft animal

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny S. is a 53-year-old widow with two children, both of whom are employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Ny S. makes white wine in Lboeuk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodoa. In addition to this business, Mrs. Ny S. breeds pigs. She used a previous loan from AMK to start her pig-breeding business. Since this business has been revealed to be a winner, Mrs. Ny S. is asking for another loan to buy more pigs to raise and pig food to feed them.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise and pig food to feed them

loans.name: Indira

texts.en: Indira is a 28 year old woman from the town of Bilalovac.  She is married with one child, who is currently in primary school.  She and her husband support themselves mainly through their agriculture business. They have 3 cows, and have been selling milk to dairies and people in the village.  Her husband also receives a small disability pension from the military. To grow their income, Indira has started her own hair salon, and she is eager to expand her customer base.  She is requesting her first loan from Zene za Zene in the amount of $975, which she will use to buy equipment and supplies for the salon.  For the future Indira hopes to find some new clients while keeping up quality services for her regulars.

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for her hair salon

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein , 34, is a married man and the father of 2. He works as a car painter in a small village close to Nabatieh in South Lebanon. Hussein needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to buy car painting equipment. He wants to further expand his business as this will allow him to generate more revenue for his family and thereby improve their standard of living. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to buy car painting equipment

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 33, is married and the father of one child. He lives in the southern suburbs of Beirut. Ali owns a butcher shop where he sells chicken. He recently bought a second-hand car and now needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to settle the remaining amount. This is the first time Ali has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to settle the remainder owed on his second-hand car

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 24, is married and has a son. He lives in the southern suburbs of Beirut and owns a car repair shop. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 to buy a new car after his previous one was completely destroyed in a car accident. This is the first time Ahmad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Sam Orl

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Orl C. is a villager in Kraing Brosvay Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Phat Tith, are subsistence farmers. Mrs. Sam Orl C. used a previous loan from AMK to buy fertilizer when her field had sterile soil.

Mrs. Sam Orl C. is 56 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom work in a garment factory. The other child attends the local school. Although the family members have different businesses, they still cannot improve their living conditions. Among other restrictions, they live in a very old house. Thus, Mrs. Sam Orl C. is asking for a loan to buy timber to build a new house.

Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a new house.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.en: Moustapha, 52, is married and has a son. He lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is a furniture repairman and he needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 in order to bring in more equipment, so that he can expand his business and be able to repair a wide variety of furniture. This is the first time Moustapha has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to purchase furniture repair equipment

loans.name: Khey

texts.en:
Mr. Khey G. is a palm juice collector in Sre Khtom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is also a subsistence farmer. Mr. Khey G. used a previous loan from AMK to buy fertilizer for his rice field. Mr. Khey G. is 42 years old and the father of a child who attends the local school. His wife, Mrs. Chang Muong, owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup to the villagers.

Mr. Khey G. and his wife have just organized "Pachai Buon," a traditional ceremony that celebrates parents and demonstrates their children’s respect for parents. However, Mr. Khey G. does not have enough money to pay for this very important ceremony, so he is asking for a loan to pay for it. Ceremonies are very important part of Cambodian life.

His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To pay the fee for a ceremony

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 38, is divorced. He lives alone in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut and the only thing that counts for him is his barbershop. Ali has requested a loan in the amount of US$ 500 to change the interior decoration of his shop, which was damaged during the July 2006 war. This is the first time Ali has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to remodel his shop

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad, 29, is single and lives with his sick parents in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He works in a library and is the sole provider for his elderly parents. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to open an internet café. It is essential for him to be able to make more money than what he currently earns as this is not sufficient to financially sustain his family. This is the first time Mohamad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to open an internet café

loans.name: Loth

texts.en:
Mrs. Loth P. lives in Dombok Korkoh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has a rice farm. Mrs. Loth P. is a 49-year-old widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the one other is a driver who uses a motorbike and cart to transport goods. The remaining two attend the local school.

Mrs. Loth P. used a previous loan from AMK to buy a cart so her son could start his business. Even though the family members have different business activities, they still live in poor conditions in an old house. Thus, Mrs. Loth P. is now requesting a loan to buy timber to repair her house wall.

loans.use: To buy timber to repair her house wall

loans.name: Sobhi

texts.en: Sobhi, 55, is married  and lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He owns a clothing shop and he needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase inventory for his shop. This is the first time Sobhi has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his clothing shop

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud, 44, is a married man and has 3 children who are enrolled in school. He owns a grocery shop close to the place he lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to pay the school bills of his children. This is the second time Mahmoud has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He successfully repaid his previous loan on time.

loans.use: to pay his children's school bills

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad, 49,  is married and has 3 children. He lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut and he is an auto body painter. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 to purchase auto body painting inventory. Mohamad has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 6 years and always repays his debts on time. He is a very responsible man whose priority in life is his family.

loans.use: to purchase auto body painting inventory

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Mrs. Saron M. is a 28-year-old widow with three children, two of whom attend school. The third is too young. Mrs. Saron M. sells "prahok" (Khmer fish cheese) in Tie Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

Prahok, also known as "Khmer cheese," is a fermented mixture of small fish and salt. It is a widely used ingredient in Khmer cuisine. Because Mrs. Saron M.'s business is a great success, she wants to expand it. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more ‘Khmer cheese’ to resell in the market.

loans.use: To buy more ‘Khmer cheese’ to resell i nthe market

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en: Ghazi, 47, is married and the father of 4 children. He lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Ghazi is the owner of a billiard amusement shop and needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase more tabletop games, so that he can expand his business. This is the first time Ghazi has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to purchase more tabletop games

loans.name: Thearoth

texts.en:
Mrs. Thearoth K. is a villager in Kveth Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store. Mrs. Thearoth K. used a previous loan to start her business.

Her husband, Mr. Mao Sin, sells coal door-to-door. Mr. Mao Sin’s business has improved, and he wants to expand it. Mrs. Thearoth K. is asking for a loan to buy a cart so her husband can transport the coal as he sells it.

Mrs. Thearoth K. is 34 years old and is the mother two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cart

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia, 47, is married, has 2 children and lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Alia owns a grocery shop and needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to increase her inventory and diversify her merchandise, so that she can expand her business. Alia has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 6 years and has always repaid her debts on time.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, 38, is the father of 3 children. Hassan lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut where he owns a coffee shop. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 to get a taxi license by purchasing a public registration number for his car. Once he purchases the license, he will be able to work as a taxi driver and this will help him increase his revenue. Hassan's goal is to ensure a better life for his children even if it is at the price of working 15 or 16 hours a day. Hassan has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 3 years and always repaid his debts on time.

loans.use: to get a taxi license

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 32 year old woman, living in the village of Bioci near Ilijas. She is married with 2 children, who are both in primary school.  Her husband is a seasonal construction worker, and they also support themselves through their farming business, raising dairy cows and selling their milk to a major factory.  This is the first loan that Fatima is requesting, in the amount of $500.  She will use this loan to buy food for her cows, and is hoping that she can now afford to buy some more nutritious food that will in turn help her cows produce better quality and healthier milk.

loans.use: To buy food for her cows
